review_body: One of the best Hotel's I've stayed at (and not just in Japan!) The service and staff were excellent, the facilities modern, and the location cannot be beat for train access. This is a true 5 star experience. Also, the view is outstanding, hard to beat looking out over Tokyo with your morning tea!Will definitely book for my next trip to Tokyo.

The Shangri-La Hotel Tokyo was the first accommodation experienced by a tour group of ten we were hosting on an Asia tour. We are incredibly pleased with the choice of staying in this beautiful, well appointed and idealy situated luxury Tokyo hotel. The Hotel's management and staff went well beyond expectation to make our stay extraordinary. Attention was carefully paid to ensuring our health safety as our stay coincided with the beginning of the Covid19 scare in Japan. Our every need and request was wonderfully and cheerfully accommodated and the Hotel manager went our of his way to make us feel welcome and at home in his establishment. We are thankful for the experience of having stayed here and can highly recommend the Shanri-La for its excellent central location, quality cuisine, superb cleanliness and unparalleled graciousness.
user_name:
rditrolio
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: really great hotel in a convinient location - very close to Tokyo station.Rooms were all very well kept and comfortable.there were also quite a number of dining options and had dinner with a set menu - the food was great.

I had very lovely stay in Tokyo Shangrila hotel. Best thing about is of course the hostility, and very clean and nice atmosphere. On top of them, they had the best location that is in the city center, right above the train station.

Enjoyed an all-too-fast one night stay while transiting Japan. Definitely worth the train ride in to town. Check-in staff was lovely, room was large and immaculate, but most importantly silent, and the bed was soooo comfortable. I booked via American Express Fine Hotels, and the property credit covered a snack, breakfast, and lunch before my 4 PM departure. The room service food was delicious (laksa pic included). This is a top pick in Tokyo for sure.

They made us feel special since we arrived, we started our honeymoon with the right foot.Arrival to Japan: someone from the hotel was waiting for us outside our train car at the train station with a sign from the hotel, it was a short 8 min walk to the hotel and he helped us with our luggage. He was EXTREMELY kind and helpful.Arrival to hotel: everyone wished us a happy honeymoon at all times, the staff was so so so kind, they held our luggage and lent us complimentary bikes, provided waters and towels and we went straight to the Imperial Palace in the bike and then went back to the hotel and did early check in. Room: incredible, huge shower, robes, slippers, comfortable bed, flawless sheets.Departure: we only stayed for the night and when we left they gave us 3 bears with little Shangri- la hotel robes and a box of chocolates with a honeymoon message signed individually by the staff in different colors. I believe they were going to put it in the room at turndown service but we had the non disturb sign in our door. We already want to go back to Japan and we will FOR SURE stay here when in Tokyo.

Great hotel and restaurant, excellent check in, great service, English widely understood, great view, the best hotel bed I have slept in , very handy to Tokyo station . Very easy to get around the area, some good shopping

Next to the JR Tokyo station easy to in and out and Daimaru department store, many good restaurant near by it's convenient hotelWhole staffs are well prepared especially, the Horizon Club food and services are excellent. Fitness is a bit small/old Would suggest to stay this hotel in Tokyo

We stayed in a club room located on the 36th floor with a stunning view overlooking Tokyo. The room was spacious (especially regarding being in Japan) with large windows, again with a fantastic view overlooking Tokyo (even when lying in bed). The bathroom was also spacious with a separate toilet and a separate giant shower and a bathtub. The room was equipped with a Nespresso machine and snacks, cookies and chocolate. Pajamas are also included. And of course, being in Japan, the TV is a smart-TV with a soundbar. There is an ironing board and minibar as well.On the ground floor there is staff awaiting to serve you with the elevator and greeting you welcome. The reception is on the 28th floor. On this floor is also restaurants and a bar. The service throughout the entire hotel is excellent. There is an Italian restaurant, Piacere, which is very good. The menu for the gentleman/host includes all the prices, while the menu for the lady does not. A little bit posh, but very pleasant. Great food and service. Breakfast is also served here.The lobby lounge was also very nice. The service was, again, excellent.There was a gentleman that worked there that really made our stay extra pleasant. However, we do not recall his name, but we do know that he was from Indonesia and think he was a manager. Again, thank you for your exceptional super and pleasant service!On the 37th floor is the club lounge, where breakfast and evening drinks including snacks is served. For evening drinks, real champagne is served, which is always appreciated. The hotel is in the corner of Tokyo Station Mall, so it is close to the metro and other trains.If you arrive with train from the airport, it is possible to arrange for someone to meet you at the train and escort you to the hotel. It is called “meet and greet” and is complementary. We recommend you take this opportunity as it can be difficult to find your way upon arrival. There are lots of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.This is by far, one of the best hotels that we have stayed in.

Of the three hotels we've stayed in in Tokyo, which previously included The Peninsula and Tokyo Station, this is now my absolute favourite. From the meet and greet at the train station platform through to saying goodbye as we left to fly home all the staff were wonderful and made every second of our stay feel special.It starts on the 28th floor of a shared office building, although it has its own ground floor entrance, so the views from all of its rooms are stunning. I am generally a terrible sleeper, more so in hotels, but I've never had such a good couple of nights sleep as I did here. Most comfortable bed I can ever recall using.It only has two restaurants, a Japanese one and an Italian; the Italian was only serving a special degustation menu whilst we were there which with it being the end of our holiday we couldn't face so didn't try. We did have breakfast which, as expected, was of an extremely high quality and one of the best I've ever had.All in all its a fantastic place, so good that it's become a destination in its own right for me...the only other hotel I can think of that makes me feel this way is The Mandarin Oriental in Bangkok. I will travel via Tokyo just to stay here even it its only for a stopover.

The location of Shangri-La Tokyo makes it an excellent choice: walking distance to the main train station within a calm and quite area.I suggest booking at least an Executive suite which offers large room space and excellent views over the city, in addition to access to the hotel private lounge.As usual at Shangri-La, everything was impeccable: excellent bed sheets and towels, full set of bathroom amenities, lovely robes and one of the most well-kept room I have ever stayed in.The private lounge is worth the additional cost, since you may have breakfast, light bites throughout the day and excellent evening cocktails in an intimate location while enjoying Tokyo’s skyscrapers.Unobtrusive staff, eager to assist in the most discreet way.Highly highly recommended

The Shangri-La is a 5* hotel located in the heart of Tokyo’s Ginza district, 1 minute away from Tokyo station.In terms of location, it’s perfect from a touristic and travelling point of view. Beautiful location to walk around, as it is comfortably positioned close to restaurants and shops and well connected with public transport. The rooms are spacious and with a panoramic view over the city. The staff is friendly and welcoming. The concierge and the reception team was knowledgable and helpful!The breakfast is quite pricy if not included in the room’s package and not really worth it. The buffet could use an improvement as it doesn’t offer a lot for $50 pp.Overall, it’s great hotel in a good location with helpful staff. The rooms are spacious and offer stunning views.

Located 1 minute from Tokyo station, Shangrila Tokyo is not in the middle of busy Ginza area but quite comfortably positioned to shops and restaurants. Hotel area is small but the room is spacious (50 sqm). Nicely furnished/decorated to reflect the Shangrila luxury standard. Everything about the room is well function and well maintained. The gym uses Technogym equipments. The swimming pool ( I think about 18-20 m long) is heated and the sauna/bath facilities are great. Breakfast is good. I recommend people to stay here.

The most common word you will hear at the Shangri-La Hotel in Tokyo is NO. I’m sad to report that this stay was the most unpleasant in Tokyo and all of Asia. I suggest avoiding this hotel at all costs as the level of service is comparable to a holiday inn express. Upon checking in I asked where I could eat lunch, was told no, early check in with AMEX no, tea in the afternoon - no. The good:-Located next tokyo station- from my room window I can see the Mandarin Oriental down the street where I had a great stay. The bad-bad attitude of staff who are mostly foreign to japan but without training -hallways that smell like moth balls -outdated hotel-furniture from your grandparents vacation homeBy the way, asked to speak to the general manager twice - never heard from him. Shangri-la truly doesn’t care about guests or level of service. You’ve been warned!

You feel relax and welcome as soon as you step into the hotel. Staff were attentive, rooms were immaculately cleaned and tidied, breakfast at the Horizon Club lounge was good; their Italian restaurant served very authentic meals too. Coffee is the only item that I can pick on. It would be perfect if Shangri-La could improve on the quality of their coffee, better beans perhaps with some well-trained barista.

❤️Greeted by beautiful sunrise daily! Very courteous staff. lobby lounge serves very delicious steak and fish & chips. Daimaru is just next door, 12 Storeys + basement of shopping & dining experience! ☘️Tokyo Station next door, 3 levels of dining and shopping; spoilt for choice!

Start to finish, this was a perfect choice for our stay in Tokyo. Everything was fantastic, but I want to highlight the staff. Not only were they friendly and accommodating, they were able to efficiently book us train tickets to Kyoto and to the airport as well. I want to especially commend Dana who assisted us through the Tokyo station to catch our train to the airport on the final day of our trip. He helped us weave through the crowds and brought us to our train platform and to the correct car. He helped us on with our luggage and did not move from the platform until the train began moving and we were off. He gave us a bow and wave as our train left the station. This hotel made our stay in Tokyo so memorable - thank you Dana and Shangri-La!

Mini-slippers for the kid, heated floors in the bathroom, pristine and beautiful rooms - everyone is so thoughtful, and everything so well thought out.The location is perfect, if you ever end up wanting to actually leave the hotel, Tokyo Station is next door.The concierge group booked tons of restaurant reservations, meaning I didn’t have to call around, and even got me a babysitter so could go for a long run (there’s a ~6 mile loop around the imperial palace that is pretty and enjoyable).We visited the “horizon club” daily this trip, our second stay at shangri-la, and it really is a nice place to wrap up the day with a drink, and take in the amazing view. You can see (nightly?) fireworks from Disney, and they even provided a set of mini binocs for the kiddo. Breakfast is stellar, and Piacere is so good for dinner, that whole setup has been a big draw for us (shout out to Naoya!).Wrapping it up, I booked another hotel to add some variety to this trip, regret it already, and haven’t even checked out of shangri-la yet. Will return.

We had an excellent stay last weekend at the Shangri-La. We were at the Horizon Club which allows one to enjoy canapés and drinks, a continental breakfast, and extra services. I actually was surprised the food offerings were not more extensive, though, like many of the club floors of other hotels we have stayed in. The room was large and lovely with a great view of the Tokyo Tower. I will say, what was wanting is what is also wanting in many Japanese hotel rooms: a huge bathroom but with only one sink, and a shower and bathtub in the same space, so one gets water in the bathtub when showering. And the other item wanting is what is found in many hotel rooms, sadly, now: dramatic mood lighting with small spot lights that do not give enough lighting in many areas of the room, and often those areas where one keeps one's suitcase. I'm tempted to bring along a halogen headlamp in the future. But, with those caveats, this is a very lovely hotel, with a great location 20 minutes walking from central Ginza and right across from Tokyo Station.

The Shangri-La Hotels Group are without a doubt my favourite hotel group, and this asset my favourite property within their chain.The first that hits you when you enter ANY Shangri-La hotel is the smell. The ambiance is set by the familiar sweet smell that envelops you and makes you aware that you’re in a Shangri-La hotel.Check in is smooth and hassle free with a smile. The rooms are large, modern and clean. I had a great view of Tokyo station and the Marunouchi side of Tokyo. Coming back from business meetings. You really enjoy the bar on the lobby floor where there is a good choice of cocktails, wines and drinks. Had dinner at a Nadaman. This is a restaurant that does everything solidly but nothing specialised. It’s a great intro into good Japanese food.Absolutely recommend the hotel and all it’s establishments within.

We have stayed in a few Shangri La hotels and this one was excellent. From the moment we arrived until we left - nothing, and I mean nothing, was too much trouble for the amazing staff. As most of the reviews here say this hotel is so well situated being right next to Tokyo Station (good luck with finding your way around- do what we did and hire a guide to show you Tokyo’s hot spots and they can also tell you how to get around the station!). We were in a club room and so breakfast was in the Horizon lounge- extra lovely omelettes! The happy 2 hours - 6pm until 8pm meant drinks and small items of high quality food. The only thing is that this hotel is eye wateringly expensive - which we did know before we booked but £15 for a glass of house wine in their bar meant we took full advantage of happy hour in the Horizon lounge! We did love it here though - lovely room - great shower - comfortable beds. If you are in Tokyo and your budget can stretch to it - this is the one for you.

We had a two night stay with my wife at this beautiful hotel. The service and the staff where fantastic so cordial and polite and helpful. The rooms were very spacious and beautifully decorated. Attention to detail excellent. The bellman Suraj Sangat escorted us with our luggage all the way from the hotel to the Narita express. He Was so polite and friendly. Thank you

Great location, less than one minute walk to Tokyo station, and Teko building if you want to take airport limousine. A great location for shopping and food tasting.Great house keeping, and cute gifts for kids. The bath tub is big and spacious for kids. Easy to wash and shower 2 kids at the same time.Breakfast is delicious, my girl (age 3.5) likes the woton noddle, I like the pancakes. You can enjoy breakfast with view as well.We spend 4 nights at Shangri-la, and my family enjoyed our stay there very much.I also have Swiss massage at Chi, very relaxing and comfortable.

We stayed for 3 nights and arrived the day after the Typhoon. The welcome and service was “over the top”.The staff couldn’t be more accommodating.They met us on the train tracks and escorted to the hotel thought the maze of Tokyo station, and escorted us back to the Shinsaken bullet train when we left.The rooms were spacious with every small item one would need.The breakfast daily was great and included in AMEX fine hotel program.Location next to Tokyo station also a big plus

Had one last night in Tokyo on our trip and splurged for the Shangri-La. From the fantastic check-in process (club level) and the sushi lunch the day we left (delicious!), everything was excellent. Would love to return!

This hotel is fabulous! The staff are amazing and our time in Tokyo is a very happy memory as a result.The hotel is pristine, not a speck of dust anywhere. It is well maintained and everything works correctly. The bed linen and towels are amazing and all consistent quality. The Housekeeping team who work largely behind the scenes are a credit to the hotel standards. We just loved the concept of the bidet toilet seat and truly appreciated the warmth of the heated seat, bliss in a cold climate country!The location of this hotel is perfect for people who wish to access the train and metro system. No long slog home at the end of a tiring day sightseeing. Shops are within easy access as they seem to form part of the huge concourse area.As a treat I experienced two Spa treatments and had one of the best massages ever. The food we ate in the hotel was great and catered for our western palates as well as introducing us to some Japanese delights. Breakfast was very varied and obviously popular with most guests. Some of the “couches” were a tad low for us but staff made every effort to give us a table to make us more comfortable.The staff who work front of house and in the Horizon Club Lounge are delightful. They are immaculate in their uniforms, polite and helpful and so courteous. Not one member of staff let the side down and the current recruitment practices are spot on.I cannot recommend highly enough. We have already booked to return next year for the Cherry Blossom viewing - hanami.

High quality service throughout from check in to departure including help with booking rail tickets. Great view from the room on the 32nd floor. Japanese restaurant was lovely and the bar service excellent. The hotel is easy walking distance from Tokyo station.

We recently stayed at the Tokyo Shangri-La for 8 nights. This was our second time staying at this hotel. We had a Premier Horizon Club room.The service from check-in to checkout was amazing and professional. We were very glad that we booked the Horizon Club level as the food and service at the club were amazing. The club is elegant without being stuffy and has floor to ceiling windows with great views. I highly recommend the eggs benedict with lobster that they serve for breakfast in the lounge.We used the meet and greet service at Tokyo Station after taking the express train from Narita and it couldn't have been any easier or better.We have also stayed at the Mandarin Oriental and the Hoshinoya previously and we found the location of the Shangri-La to be much more convenient to mass transit,We never had a chance to see the pool or spa as we were far too busy exploring Tokyo with Mac from Maction Planet tours.I highly recommend the Shangri-La if you are going to be exploring Tokyo.

No need to look any further for any hotel in Tokyo. Best hotel we’ve ever stayed at in the world, with the best staff ever. The welcome party that greeted us instantly made us feel at home. Every time we left and entered the hotel, the perfection was unmatched, from the specific perfume scent once you walk through the doors, to the personalized music created just for the Shangri-La. The breakfast buffet is the best breakfast we have had anywhere, compared to other luxury Hilton and Four Season hotels. We don’t know if we will ever be able to find another hotel that will compare to the standards and services received at the Shangri-La. Even when we had dinner at Nadamah Sushi, the gentleman who waited on us (he was there every night) was extremely kind, helpful, and courteous to walk us through our meal. Overall, words are not enough to describe our experience at the Shangri-La. Everyone around the would, without a doubt, should stay here when visiting Japan. This is the only hotel that we left feeling homesick, and will definitely stay again the next time we are in Tokyo.

I was back in the wonderful Lobby Lounge on the 28th floor of The Shangri-La last week. Its a great place to relax and get some work done. Wines by the glass are excellent, Kazuma the bartender is so polite and skillful. A joy to watch him work. The music was just starting as I left - hard to leave, nice to come back

After much deliberation, I decided to book with the Shangri-La over the Four Seasons and Peninsula. I was thrilled with my choice. While the great location to JR Rail, bullet trains and station restaurants was similar among all of the hotels, I don’t think a better level of service was possible. It was what I expect from an Aman hotel (my wife thinks it even exceeded that). The morning breakfast soon became a daily highlight for my wife, three children (ages 8-14) and I who loved the mix of menu and buffet options. But even better was the restaurant staff who greeted us warmly for every meal. In particular, Kohei and Yuki stood out for their service. My wife is still raving about the way the staff catered to our 8yr old at dinner and the mango pancakes for breakfast. Despite a larger hotel (3x the rooms of the Four Seasons), they made us feel like royalty. Truly above and beyond.

This is our second stay at Shangri-La Tokyo, and it is still superb. I am writing to give a special mention to one member of staff, Yukari Matsumoto in the Horizon Lounge, who really made our stay so special. She is simply the best member of staff here, and deserves special praise. Thank you Shangri-La Tokyo, and thank you Yukari!

We had a family stay. We were recognized as Diamond member and been upgraded to bigger size room. Bathroom was spacious, with generous size bathtub with a great view. Breakfast worth mentioning as it was one of the best breakfasts we had amount our trips. From buffet selection to beautiful Japanese bentos. Location is next to Tokyo station, Imperial Palace and other places. Tokyo statin is itself a city on they own and offers plenty restaurants to eat and access to the malls.

My family of four took up the hotel offered the wonderfully helpful meet-and-greet for guests coming from Tokyo Station when we rode into Tokyo on the Shinkansen. That meet-and-greet offered the first glimpse of the opulence of the hotel. The bell staff took several of our luggage pieces and guided us expertly through the maze that was Tokyo Station. Once we arrived at the 1st floor of the hotel, the other staff there greeted us warmly as well. The female bell staff noticed that one of my sons ran out of water and immediately offered iced cold bottles as replacements. The elevator has a chandelier, and it took us to the lobby floor for check-in. The check-in area was equally grand. The check-in staff spoke excellent English and was friendly. Our luggage went to our rooms (interconnecting/connecting Imperial Garden view King/Twin Rooms) while we processed the check-in. The rooms were large and immaculately clean. The staff frequently reminded us that the weather was hot and muggy outside and offered cool water whenever we went out. I had to use the doctor one day due to illness. The staff recommended the English speaking clinic located at the next building. A staff then guided me to the doctor and spoke with the nurse there about my reported symptoms. What great service! (The doctor visit cost around $130 USD with diagnosis and medicine.) Several staff was aware of my need of a doctor and inquired about my health when they saw me. Again, it showed warmth and that they cared for me enough as a guest to ask. The location at Tokyo Station offered many conveniences to my family and I. The breakfast buffet was great with many choices. However, after we selected the one pre-set main dish, which was excellent, we barely had room for the wonderful pastries, suimai or other items. Of the small samples that we ate from the buffet tables, the food at the buffet tasted great. The hotel offered to buy the Narita Express tickets for us at cost, but we ended up buying them ourselves when we were at the station after shopping. The hotel also offered, and we took up, the service to guide us to the Narita Express platform. Again, that was needed due to the maze of Tokyo Station. The food at the Lobby Lounge tasted excellent! On our last day, my family visited the Lobby Lounge and ate the excellent tasting soba and wonton noodle soup. The cost was very reasonable, and it was relaxing to enjoy a different view of Tokyo (one can see Skytree partially from the Lobby Lounge). The afternoon tea appeared popular with the locals and one should reserve it ahead if possible. We tried to book the afternoon tea once last minute but were told that they sold out. Shangri-la really pampered us. We were glad that the hotel was the last impression we received from Japan as we departed this country for home. We will be back to stay here again in the future as we are frequent visitors to Japan.

First time staying at a Shangri-La, and our experience in Tokyo was excellent. The hotel is located right next to Tokyo Station, and a short walk to shopping and places to see. We wanted to walk around town for a bit, and the friendly staff provided directions to everything we wanted to see. We are heading to London for our next trip, and the Shangri-La at The Shard is at the top of our list of places to stay.

The staff is the friendliest most helpful group I’ve encountered at any shangri la property in the world and I’ve been to about 8. They are warm and inviting and make you feel like royalty. The food is tasty especially the breakfast. The only thing that could be better if the rooms were a little bit larger. But other than that this hotel has a great location as well as wonderful service and tasty food. Best business hotel in Tokyo.

We had never stayed at a Shangri-La before... If every Shangri-La experience is like ours was in Tokyo, then they have earned customers for life! The service was beyond phenomenal. We looked forward to their breakfast every morning... Every staff member was so helpful for our entire week there. I had even e-mailed the concierge before we came asking if I could get the room decorated for our arrival, because my wife was turning 50 on that day. Not only did they have the room all decked out in balloons, but the chef sent up a personalized birthday cake and a cart full of sweets. It was honestly a truly amazing way to start our first visit to Japan. Cannot rave enough about the staff, service, and food. Top notch!

We have stayed in this hotel before. I am glad to say that the service is as excellent as ever. The young Caucasian lady (Australian or New Zealander by her English accent) who greeted us on arrival was polite and helpful; certainly more so than anyone in Australia would have been.The hotel is right next to Tokyo Station, to which one gains access through the Marunouchi North Gate. It is vital to note this, as one can easily get completely lost in the winding maze of corridors. Tokyo Station has a range of restaurants and shops, so food is not a problem.For those who can't be bothered to wander out (eg, in winter, which is when we stayed the previous time) the Lounge does quite good meals. Try the salmon bowl or the Ceasar salad.In short, excellent location and superlative service. Definitely will stay again.

We stayed here for the first five nights of our first trip to Japan. We had a great start using their "Meet and Greet Service" where one of their staff met our NEX train. We phoned ahead from the train to tell them which car & seat and what time - and someone was on the platform to greet us. And thank goodness. Tokyo Station is a labyrinth and very confusing to begin with (though we got to know it after a while).The hotel itself is gorgeous. Lovely room, comfortable beds, large bathroom, spotlessly clean, spectacular view. Great food in the restaurants, and room service is so good it is hard to resist and very helpful as we recovered from jet lag. Excellent friendly service.Pricey but worth it. Highly recommended.

I love this place so much, I wish I could live here. I've been here twice, my most recent trip being September of last year. Horizon lounge is amazing, and the staff even more amazing - they help you with whatever dining / entertainment reservations you need. I also love that they have a wifi hotspot you can use during your stay! Thanks SGL Tokyo and Horizon Club staff for always going above and beyond!

What more can be said about this jewel? Great property and centrally located. Customer service befitting royalty. Opulent rooms with every detail attended to. Would not stay anywhere else in Tokyo. Great views too!

We stayed for 7 nights at the Horizon Club level and just like 3 years ago, it was an outstanding experience. The rooms are large and perfectly maintained. Club facilities are top-notch and the staff really goes all the way to add to the experience. Many thanks to Hiroko Hayakawa, Suyeon Song, Yukari Kobayashi, Yune Tayaka, Keiko Yokota for making this yet again a wonderful stay.

Like everyone said shangrila is different than any other 5 star hotel in Tokyo. No frills. Very big room, bath room, good lighting, big windows and view of tokyo sky tree, amazing location.It comes with a price tag but it's all comfort here.

Arriving from the bullet train it takes a few minutes to get ones bearings but the hotel is within 10 minutes walk.A warm welcome and first class 'club' facilities.Our bedroom on the 37th floor had superb views, was well equipped and serviced. In house dining excellent

My husband and I headed to Japan for the cherry blossom festival and we wanted to experience them in different cities. Our first stop was Tokyo and we had to stay at Shangri-la Hotel Tokyo because of the luxury paired with convenience. Since its located right across from Tokyo Station, we had the convenience of walking to the train station to get to wherever we needed to go. Everything about the hotel was beautiful and opulent. The service, decor and everything else is luxurious. We stayed on the 33rd floor and had amazing views of Tokyo and the Tokyo Tower! We had lunch and dinner at their Japanese fine dining restaurant and we had the freshest of sushi. The salmon belly and fried rice was some of the best we've ever had! Breakfast at their Italian restaurant Piacere was so delicious. We had fluffy, light and airy pancakes, avo toast and a buffet of delicious fruits, detox juices, and pastries. If you're visiting Tokyo, Shangri-la Tokyo will be perfect for all your luxury getaway needs. If you have any further questions about our stay, please don't hesitate to ask.

Shangri-La hotels offer amazing experiences, and this one is no different. The meet and greet service from the train station, to the escorted return, is a great service offered. We stayed in the horizon club rooms, beautifully appointed, and offer a seamlessly smooth check in and out, by the delightful staff, who even purchased our train tickets back to the airport for us. Food and beverages, with wonderful attention by the horizon club staff, are on offer throughout the day. What a wonderful experience with one of the best hotels in the world.

Embracing a stranger as one's own and that's how I feel each time I arrive at a Shangri-La. The whole experience at the Shangri-La Hotel, Tokyo was absolutely impressive with top-notch service provided by the all-star team and a hotel that is so well maintained even after ten years of service. From the moment we arrive, each encounter with the associates at this hotel is a feel of luxury, a sense of belonging and a place like home. The little details they put into designing the hotel such as the arrival lobby on ground floor and basement, the timeless decor, the Swarovski crystals that adorn the elevators, the signature Essence of Shangri-La scent infused all around and the touches they have in the guest rooms such as welcome amenities, the pyjamas during turndown and the unique escort services to the Tokyo Main Station - these are representations of their hallmark "Hospitality from a caring family" service.Every guest feels so well taken care and from observations, I believe they all feel pampered and definitely enjoy their stay. I highly recommend this hotel to those who want to enjoy more luxury during their stay in Tokyo and it is definitely worth their claim of being one of the top hotels in the capital city. Expect perfect location as the hotel is right next to Tokyo Main Station - the hub where it all happens!Lastly, a special shout out to Katrina and the entire team for making this stay so wonderful and memorable!

the location of this hotel is superb, beside Tokyo station. The room is huge and spotless and the scent they used in the hotel is really good. As it was my birthday the staff generously gave me a bottle of prosecco and some Japanese fruits. The hotel service staffs are very helpful is more then willing to go an extra mile to help us. when we checked out we had lots of stuff (6 luggage, 2 back packs and one shopping bag) the hotel arranged a staff (guy from hong kong) to help me move it all the way to tokyo station's nartia express, the staff even went with us to the platform and even WAITED for the train and help us load up all the luggage into the train (we even told him that we can manage and thanked him as he already help us enough by helping us this far, but he insisted on helping us till the end) . we were beyond impressed by the services standards of shangri-la tokyo.breakfast was amazing (try the pastries !!!) and the view is awesome. thanks shangri-la for making my stay so wonderful !!!

This would have to be the finest hotel I’ve ever stayed at. Located above Tokyo Station the rooms are large and feature a “wet area bathroom” with rain shower. Ginza is a 5 minute walk away and Metro lines close by. The staff anticipate your every needs are beyond polite and graceful. I have nothing negative to say about my stay

We stayed for three nights as a family. Fantastic and friendly service from checkin to departure. We really enjoyed the food at the hotel. Breakfast Buffet selection is a bit small, but the to order cooked dishes were amazing and pastries some of the best we have seen in a hotel. In fact all food we ordered from the hotel restaurants were of high quality from a burger in the bar to dinner at the Japanese restaurant. The pool is a decent size for an indoor pool and the location next to Tokyo station convenient for exploring the city by train lines. Really one of the best hotel experiences we have had for a long time and one of the better Shangri-La hotels we have tried.

My husband and I have just spent six wonderful luxurious nights at Shangri-La Tokyo. The hotel is absolute perfection in every way but what truly differentiates it is the service. Every single staff member greets you warmly and does everything they can to make your stay special. We have never ever had such a level of service - discrete, professional, friendly, proactive, thankful for your custom and genuine in their approach. The rooms are incredible and luxe (points of difference - high quality pyjamas provided for your stay, bvulgari products, heated toilet seats (a Japanese thing that should be adopted worldwide), turndown service, in-room check in etc). We had room 3701 - top floor, corner room - which was huge and stunning views over the city and imperial palace. The horizons club is worth every cent - buffet and a la carte breakfast, high tea, drinks and beautiful high quality food on offer at all times between 7am and 10pm, sweets buffet (with bags to fill up and take with you) etc. service again is outstanding and personalised. Gym is small but well equipped.Lobby lounge is great for a drink and live jazz - worth an evening visit. Also great concierge service - they arranged transport, cabs, day trips and restaurant bookings. Also they printed directions in Japanese to provide to taxi drivers - hugely invaluable and thoughtful. Thank You Shangri-La Tokyo.

My now fiancée and I stayed here for 6 nights for my birthday. We decided to upgrade to the Horizon Club and my god! We weren’t disappointed. Right from the word go we were treated like royalty. The room was stunning , with amazing views! We also got engaged at this hotel and will always remain special to me. The staff were amazing and the Horizon Club was brilliant and somewhere where you could come for some peace and quiet and enjoy the views. Nothing was to much trouble. If you able to, upgrade to the Horizon club - it was worth it. The attention to detail and helpfulness from the Horizon Club staff are second to none.

We had never stayed at a Shangri-La property, so this was our first experience. The hotel is immaculate, embellished with grand chandeliers, decorated with gorgeous flowers, and it smells amazingly. We ended up buying the Shangri-la scent diffuser kit to take home with us! From the moment we arrived, the staff was accommodating and friendly, catering to our every need. Everyone kindly acknowledges you and is eager to assist whether you are checking in, eating breakfast, booking excursions with the concierge, or just requesting a taxi. The rooms are spacious with a large bath/shower combo, and the drawers are fully stocked with every personal care item you could need including razors, toothpaste, hair brushes, and more. The beds are so comfortable. We had a view of the city which was beautiful at night. On a clear day, we even caught a glimpse of Mt. Fuji! If you are looking for a five star stay with flawless service, the Shangri-La Tokyo is the place for you.

The hotel is perfectly located in Ginza, the rooms are high specd and very comfy. The hotel has an amazing Tepiynaki restaurant which i would recommend. There are tow bicycles you can use to tour the city which is a really fun way to see Tokyo.The pool is good sized, no steam room and a small sauna which seems a bit of a miss for a hotel of this price category.

My 4th time staying at this hotel and the standards remain as good as ever.The hotel is extremely conveniently located, bring right next to Tokyo station and very close to my office base when I am in Tokyo.The room are extremely well fitted out with great views over the city. I used the well-equipped gym but did not find time to use the pool on this visit.The staff can not be any more helpful and were very patient with me as I tried to practise my Japanese (but of course they all speak perfect English).Breakfast is extremely nice but, like the hotel itself, is expensive.

Travelled the week before golden week so it was extremely pricey however the room was spacious with amazing higher floor views. The room had a huge double bed and a very comfortable layout with a table and sofa. A lovely large TV and tons of plug points. Location wise you are right above the Tokyo station which is a great central location to jump on the trains and get around the city.Walking distance to the the ginza shopping district and also near to a large Daimaru department store, perfect for high end shopping like Louis Vuitton, Gucci etc Well priced and good room service optionsThe gym and pool were a little small but clean, well equipped and accessible The concierge were extremely welcoming and helpful and even met us at the train station to help us with our bags when we arrived

I have never been disappointed in a Shangri-La, and the Tokyo property is no exception. The combination of Japanese service standards + Shangri-La = outstanding experience!I was happy the moment we took the elevator up to the 28th floor lobby. It smells like Shangri-La, I think they must use some proprietary air freshener that sets off a Pavlovian response. The hotel is just steps from Tokyo Station, so it's very convenient to wherever you are coming from/going to. You do have to walk outside and around the corner, and it took a bit of effort to find the correct north exit from the station, but once we figured it out, it was easy to get around and easy to get the Narita Express train when we departed.Rooms are on the 29th - 37th floors of the building, so have wonderful views. We were upgraded to a corner room on the northwest, overlooking the train station and Imperial Palace. We could hear the trains rumbling faintly, not at all unpleasant or bothersome. It was a huge, beautiful room with so many thoughtful amenities - even a box of office supplies in the desk, including multicolored highlighters. The king size bed was the best we slept in anywhere in Japan. Lots of closet and drawer space (and hangers!), lots of electrical outlets at bedside and the desk. And the bathroom is huge, with a wonderful rain shower, tub with a fabulous view, the usual fancy Japanese toilet, lighted makeup mirror, three double robe hooks (!), a retractable clothesline, plenty of towels, counter and drawer space, and a wide assortment of toiletries. At evening turn-down service, they lay out pajamas and slippers for you. As gorgeous and comfortable as the room was, the thing that made it truly outstanding was the service. When we arrived, a wheel had just broken off one of our roller bags. First, they provided screwdrivers as requested so we could try to fix it, but we couldn't. When I asked whether there was a repair shop nearby, the woman from the front desk called engineering, and brought one of their maintenance guys up to our room, stayed with us while he worked on the bag and was successful in fixing it! Such a lifesaver. Breakfast was also excellent, though expensive. You can order from a selection of main dishes, either a la carte or inclusive of the buffet which includes your beverages as well as pastries, breads, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, Japanese hot items, etc. If you have juice and coffee, it's almost as expensive to order a la carte, you might as well do the buffet.Shangri-La is not cheap, it was quite a bit more than any of the other places we stayed in Japan, but it delivers a lot more - you do get what you pay for!

It is a great experience to stay in Shangri-La tokyo. The location of hotel is very good, Limousine is in front of the hotel, JR and subway are just nearby. The room is cozy and quiet. Breakfast is out of expectation ( French toast and Pancake are amazing ). Stuff are warm and helpful!

The Shangri-la is one of the last bastions of class. Just 100 feet from Tokyo Station, so no need for a Taxi which racks up the Yen in a Tokyo minute. Don't be a total timid tourist, go ahead use your brain and take the train steps from the Hotel front door and the Hotel will send a guide to fetch you at Tokyo Station and bring you to the reception desk. The Hotel is upscale but you won't need a stack of Monopoly Money. Opt for the plan allowing you to enjoy a wonderful all you can eat buffet breakfast.The Staff: They are all very helpful no matter what your request is (within the boundaries of civilized behavior). No question is to silly to receive an earnest, serious and patient response. The Hotel has all the greatest hits for guests. Dedicated Spa, Indoor Pool, Onsen, Business Center, Conference Center, and 39 stories of luxuriously appointed guest rooms. Room 3318 was magnificent. A corner suite with unobstructed views of Tokyo in almost every direction. There was a huge bathroom with a soaking tub.There was also an over-sized rain shower with a shower head as big as a truck tire with lots of pressure and hot water. PJ's, Robes, Slippers, and a whole department store of personal amenities. A dedicated housekeeping crew keeps the towels fresh and fluffy, the King Bed made and there is a fully automatic commode. Want Pavarotti to sing Nesum Dorma? It will. The bidet adjusts from a squirt gun to a fire hydrant. . Shangri-La is fah and away the best in the City.

The first thing that struck me about this property was that checkin was on the 28th floor...most hotels are at ground level. After checkin my room was on the 33rd floor, 3328 to be exact. The hotel is centrally located in downtown Tokyo.The room was extremely comfortable, not that I expected anything less. The regular necessities including tv, frig, safe, coffeemaker - but the first surprise for me was the bathroom. The rainfall shower —- OMG! Then the toilet seat had a warmer, so when getting up from your bed late at night having to use the toilet-a welcome “warm” seat plus a few added options.We stepped out to experience the local area. When we returned not only were the beds turned down but pj’s and slippers were neatly laid out for us.The double bed wrapped me in its pillow arms until I fell into a deep sleep.Breakfast the next morning was very good, especially the detox juice that consisted of rosemary, dragon fruit and other fruit. Delicious!The staff were extremely accommodating...our transfers departed at 5:45am the following morning and breakfast began at 6:30, one of the receptionists told me not to worry, he arranged room service for us at 5:00am! What “white glove service”. The next time I travel aboard my first pick will be The Shangri-La La hotel.

Good for both work and play: Tokyo Station, the Imperial Gardens, the shops and offices of Marunouchi and the historic Nihonbashi area are within walking distance. Friendly and helpful staff. Bathrooms are bright and spacious, many with walls of glass to enable a soak with a view!

It is really difficult to stay at the Shang without admitting the attention to detail, the comfort of the rooms and the public spaces, the location right in the heart of Tokyo and - above all - the ‘nothing is too difficult’ attitude of every single member of staff that we met. The staff on the front desk and the concierge could not have been more helpful or charming. All in all, this is a wonderful place to stay and I would recommend it to anyone wanting a relaxing haven in the middle of Tokyo.

My expectations were already high for Shangri La Tokyo, as I've heard nothing but rave reviews for the chain and its properties. That said, our experience was even more incredible, comfortable, and welcoming than I could have imagined. Our room had a beautiful view of the Tokyo Station and the surrounding Imperial gardens, as well as the coolest bath/shower room combo I've seen in any hotel. While we didn't dine at any of the restaurants on property, the daily room service breakfast (my boyfriend loved the japanese breakfast sets) were beautifully presented and delicious (there were also tons options for any diet/palate). Finally, my experience in Chi Spa were among the best I've had, especially for the price. After a 14 hour flight from NYC, any massage would've felt good, but the interior design, accommodations, and treatments at Chi were 10/10. In my opinion, the only only possible drawback of the hotel is the small/cramped fitness area. There was a lack of space for floor exercises/stretching, and weights selection wasn't too great. However, from what Ive heard, that seems to be standard with hotels in Tokyo.

The whole experience at the hotel exceed expectations. The staff was very helpful, we asked them to help book a few restaurants, not only that but they came back presenting us with a full detail of the place, address in japanese and route to get there (exit from the subway) and the pictures to go with everything so we don't miss it! As for other services, the room was very clean, great amenities and delicious breakfast selection! Later on I forgot some items at the hotel, the staff responded very quickly and solved the problem immediately.

We used the Meet & Greet Service and was met at the Platform right at our arrival. Felt the warm welcome. Though we wasn't able to get our room right away, we got it after we had lunch, & luggage was already inside our room. Location of the Hotel was convenient. Room was spacious & comfortable. We had an enjoyable stay.

This is a fantastic property. The rooms are large with great views. The decor, bath and linens are luxurious. The bed was so comfortable and the staff was amazing. Best of all was the location. If you are coming or leaving Tokyo by train, the hotel is steps away from the station. It is walking distance to the Ginza and ideal for getting around. The concierge was extremely helpful and we truly loved our stay.

Our room was boring and in need of some refurbishment. There wasn't the wow factor that a swanky 5-star rated hotel needs to have.The lift/elevator is impressive but after that, well one's expectations go downhill.Check-in: No one could be bothered to show us to our room or help with our luggage - despite loads of smiling staff behind the counter and no other guest waiting.Room: The wall-to-wall carpet was a bit naff. Large and hidden wet patch near wardrobe that we only found after kicking our shoes off resulting in soggy socks.Cupboard door under desk fell off with he slightest of touch. It wasn't screwed to the hinges.Light control design was confusing. Totally country intuitive.A chaise lounge that was perhaps 1 metre long only! Definitely not fit for lying on.Room did not look like any that are shown on the hotel's website. We opted to cut our time there and eat out.Do yourself a favour and walk 5 minutes down the road and stay at the Mandarin Oriental instead, where you will be treated like Royalty.

When we visited Tokyo we selected this hotel based on friends recommendations, we thought that the hotel will be great but acually it was not, we got disappointed, especially with the concierge never give correct information or direction, we did not like the breakfast variety though the service in the restaurant was good.

I usually stay at the Peninsula and Mandarin but decided to try this hotel and found it to be pleasant.Pros:- Great location as it is within walking distance to Ginza and at the heart of the Tokyo station- Spacious and full amenities bathroomCons:- The staff are all friendly but I'm afraid are a bit slow, for example when I asked for the bellhop they asked too many questions over the phone that I found unnecessary- Lobby area is small- Light switch is a bit hard to control

I had to extend my stay simply because I did not want to leave the hotel.One of the best Shangrila hotels I have ever stayed in. The room was spacious clean and refined; excellent view; excellent service; and excellent food. More than words can say.

We stayed three days at the Shangri-La and found the experience great. While the location at first seemed a bit dull given that it is at Tokyo Station, it turned out to be a good location given that it was so close to to metro with most lines available. The room was spacious, with a great view and the service was superb. The concierge helped us book several restaurants which was very helpful - despite us doing several changes. Well worth the money.

here very near to everything, Tokyo Station, Ginza, etc. is a modern building housing a fantastic hotel. Everything in the hotel is honed to perfection. I remember coming when it first opened under its first General Manager, Wolfgang. Beautiful hotel, super service. Food very well prepared. Our in room breakfast is so beautifully arranged, it's almost a sin to eat and destroy the visual beauty. The staff are all so super courteous and helpful. Rooms are large and so modern. Prices are expensive but it's worth the splurge

The location of this hotel cannot be beat - right beside the main Tokyo Station, near the Imperial Palace and the Ginza District. We took the Narita Express in from the airport and walked right to the hotel. In addition, the hotel is close to two subway stations, while still being extremely quiet.The service was great and the food as well. The concierge arranged tickets for us for sumo wrestling, the bullet train to Osaka etc. Best of all (as the Tokyo Train Station is very difficult to find your way around) the hotel provided a guide for us who took us right to the exact spot on the train platform our train for Osaka would stop.The hotel room was beyond comfortable with a great view over the City.Well worth what we paid to stay there.

Wow. What a beautiful hotel! The rooms are quiet, comfortable, modern, and spacious and perfect for a business trip or couples weekend. I love the fact that the hotel is located beginning on the 28th floor so it keeps everything very secluded, yet you are right in the middle of the Tokyo business district adjacent to the train station.

We finished a cruise in Yokohama and decided to have 3 days in Tokyo before going home. I upgraded to the Horizon Club which was fab. We didn't have afternoon tea, but breakfast and happy hour were perfect with a little hot and cold food laid on with cocktails, champagne etc. We had the deluxe room which was large and the bed was comfortable. There was a choice of garden or city view and we had the city view which was amazing at night. On our last night, we went to the Sushi Restaurant which was a great experience watching all the food prepared in front of us. The Horizon Club staff were very attentive and helpful, arranging transport to the airport for us. We also got us a portable wifi router so we had internet even when we weren't in the hotel.

Well crafted rooms with excellent quality of service and choices of taste foods. Nevertheless helpful staff with excellent communication skills and hospitality. Although it was my first visit to Japan it felt like I have been here before and would love to visit again.

First of all, let me be clear. This was my first holiday to japan, and I truly believe they are the most impressive people I have ever encountered. Having said that, I honestly feel Shangri-La in Tokyo was a rather underwhelming experience. This place is expensive. I have been lucky to stay in shangri la in other countries (loved them) and many other 5 star hotels and resorts, but shangri la in Tokyo is the most expensive nightly rate I have ever encountered by a big margin. So I expected a lot. In hindsight, the hotel is fine for short business trips or luxury transit stops. The bedrooms are big and modern. This is a plush place. No doubt. Bed was very comfortable. Loved watching CNN in the bathroom while shaving. These things make it a wonderful place for a quick stop. However, for a holiday?? I wish I had stayed at Park Hyatt. Shangri La in Tokyo, is boring. The staff and customers are boring. There is a lack of excitement. Customers appear to be used to this luxury lifestyle. The type that live in hotels more than their homes? Staff are competent but not much more. A great hotel has the ability to raise your excitement and get you feeling relaxed and happy to be in the hotel. I did not feel this way. The gym and pool area was very small, single story and underwhelming. The view ordinary. Sterile airport atmosphere. The cocktail area. Expensive. A few drinks and your approaching a half day’s rate at the bar. No happy hour. The Piano singer on Saturday was nice but weekdays seem to be lacking any atmosphere. We made a trip to park Hyatt. Big place. Two story floor to ceiling windows overlooking Tokyo skyline. A 3 hour Happy hour. People having a good time. It was immediately clear we were staying at the wrong hotel. Overall the location of shangri la at Tokyo station was frustrating too. Having to take taxis everywhere, to Shinjuku and Shibuya areas. The Tokyo station and taking trains is too time consuming when you want to get out and get in. The buffet breakfast was limited but the food quality was fine. There is a clear difficulty in deterring what is complimentary and what is costly in your room. We were not offered a room upgrade as according to our Amex deal. Overall. It was ok.

Shangri-La again exceeded our expectations. Superior location, excellent staff and meet and greet service, mobile wifi router available, excellent Horizon Club rooms on 37th Floor, delicious food and breakfast, efficient concierge that did the impossible to get us into two top restaurants, the list goes on. Highly Recommended!

It’s my third time staying on business at the Shangri La, Tokyo. The service and facilities are first rate and the hotel does its best to accommodate individual requests, in my case fresh low fat milk in my room for my first cup of tea of the day. Faultlessly polite and helpful staff throughout. Nothing is a problem here, so I can only recommend this hotel if you are seeking a very comfortable stay whilst busy making the best of the business activities and opportunities in Tokyo.

I’m a greedy girl so I have to start by saying that the breakfast buffet was an absolutely delightful culinary experience! However, the entire hotel is beautiful. The bathrooms indulgent, the views magnificent and the staff beyond attentive. #foodie #breakfast #tokyo #shangrila #fatgirlsbewinning #plussizeblogger #plussize #foodporn #breakfastofchampions #happygirl #hungrygirl #greedygirl #fancy #indulgence @ シャングリラ ホテル 東京
user_name:
Tracie S
Jersey City, New Jersey

review_body: We stay here for 6 nights, before and after our Nagano trip. It is conveniently located adjacent to Tokyo station. Less than 2 minutes walk. As Tokyo station could be complicated for first timer, they also provide meet and greet service and accompany you to find the departure line for Shinkansen. When we returned from Nagano my husband has pneumonia with bacterial viruses. The front office manger Mr. Tomonori Matsuura personally accompanied us to a local clinic, with Doctor who speak great English, than walk to a near by hospital for CT scan, all and all his spent precious 4 hours with us. We are so grateful for this kind gesture that no money could buy. That is why we are so loyal to Shangri-la. We stayed on the 37 Horizon club floor, breakfast is substantial, they also provide bites and drinks for afternoon tea and pre-dinner. Oh they could also make good resturant reservation. The room as alway is spacious and comfortable. And they even provide portable WiFi. The only small thing is all toiletries are with excessive packagings, packed in small boxes. Very Japanese. The next time you visit Tokyo, must give it a try. It is worth every single cent/ sense!

My wife and I stayed here for a few nights and found the hotel to be really luxurious; service was top quality; and views from our room were just stunning (tip - we had the city view). Very large room which is unusual in Tokyo, just next to the station; and towels and linen sumptuously soft. The whole team is great but a specIal mention for Jason Yap who went way beyond the call of duty!

This hotel is expensive and very luxury but it is worth every cent we spend here!! Room is very spacious and room amenities are one of the best quality I ever stayed in other places. L’ocitane toiletries are fantastic. Bathroom is large and I love when they offer a shower room (most hotels in japan offer only bathtub). Location is the best as it’s just next to Tokyo station where you can easily connect to any places in Japan. There are many restaurants and shopping as well. What not to be missed if you stay here is the breakfast!! It’s the best breakfast for me. Quality is so goodddddd. There are an a-la-carte menu where you can select during breakfast. Varieties are quite a lot and you will never bore on breakfast time. So if you can top up the hotel budget on your travel, I would highly recommend this hotel. Once in a while we should indulge our travel in a luxury style.

This is our second stay and has become a definite favorite for Tokyo hotels and within the Shangri-la group of hotels within Asia. It is refined and elegant. The rooms are large for Tokyo standards and the service is impeccable. I don’t know how they infuse the air, but just by stepping into the ground floor reception area, you smell the beautiful aroma in the air and I just felt that I was “home” (despite it being only my second visit). The breakfast is limited in choice (compared to general hotel breakfast buffets) but the standard of dining is so high and the dining room is so elegant, that you would remember this experience far more. Aside from all that, the location is fantastic. It is right next to Tokyo Station so it is very easy to travel within Tokyo and the rest of Japan (especially if you’re catching the Shinkansen). We always catch the airport limousine bus, and the bus stop is literally 50m away. The concierge helped us arrange restaurant bookings on two nights - both into very popular restaurants too. There are now two bicycles for hire (free of charge) which I regret not having the time to do - but hopefully soon, in a future visit.

I think this was our favorite hotel stay of all time - everything about this hotel is luxurious and romantic. I still dream about it.Conveniently located and just seconds away from Tokyo Station. Our room was incredibly beautiful and comfortable with its floor to ceiling windows, rainforest shower, and an amazing view over the city including the Tokyo Sky Tree. Other highlights included the Horizon Club and Nadaman restaurant for a delicious high-end Japanese-style meal. I'm allergic to gluten and they had no problem accommodating.The hotel also has an indoor pool, which we sadly didn't have time to use this trip. - Alicia
user_name:
Levitatestyle
New York City, New York

review_body: I really love this hotel. Perfect location right beside the Tokyo Station, which makes it very convenient for traveling around Tokyo. The staff are definitely world class- one of the most polite and courteous people you will ever meet. Very very efficient. When I ordered room service one night, the next morning I found an allergy card on my door step so I could show this allergy card whenever I would dine out. They have one of the best services ever. Will definitely stay here again. Thanks to the management for always taking care of us.

At the end of last year we were on our third vacation to Tokyo Japan, also the third time we stayed at this hotel. We consider this hotel to be near perfect in terms of cleanliness, facilities, service and location of the hotel itself which is very close to Tokyo Station.

We stayed at Shangri-la Tokyo for ten nights in Nov 2018.I have to say that we were very impressed with the overall experience. The facilities are of high standards, the location is really convenient for both shopping and sightseeing.Staff are really attentive, and professional. This has to be one of the very few high-end hotels that I stayed at where staff can maintain a professional work ethic and attitude. The housekeeping was impeccable. I consider myself to be quite particular when it comes to the housekeeping standards. But I just could not find any fault their housekeepers.I normally like to explore and stay at different hotels. However, because we had such a pleasant stay, I would only consider to choose Shangri-la over the other hotels in my future Tokyo visits!I also really would like to thank the horizon club reception team, thank you so much for all the help (my suitcase, my restaurant bookings, and your professionalism just made the whole stay so unforgettable)!

Returned here again after 3 years. Spent 4 nights in a Imperial Palace view room upgraded from Deluxe by booking thru Grand Luxury hotels with a $100.00 room credit. The promotional offer was better then booking thru Golden Circle and I also got points with this booking. Everything was as great as before. They now have opened a boutique store, where I spent my credit on some gift items. You can feel the perfection of the training in the way the staff treat you. From check in to check out, everything was handled perfectly. I certainly would love to stay here every time I visit Tokyo, but I have to start saving again for my next splurge .If only they would bring back the eggs benedict royale with lobster and caviar. Now that would be perfection.I

This was our first stay in Japan, and it was a pleasant introduction to such a rich and humble culture. The hotel is less than a 3 minute walk to the train station, it is in literally close to many restaurants and shopping complexes that you could spend a day just exploring the surrounding areas. I am a big fan of great spa and gym facilities and Shangri-la delivered with a state of the art working out room and pools with rentable gear for swimming open 24/7. There was an Italian and Japanese restaurant in the hotel, both of which were very good. Mostly, the staff and guest services were exquisite.

Before arriving we arrange for a meet and greet service from tokyo station, because have quite a lot of luggages, upon boarding the narita express train I called and let them know our car and seat number.When we arrived at tokyo station, someone was there waiting for us, help with the luggage and lead us to the hotel.Check-in process was very smooth, it wasn't long before we are resting in our room after a long flight.The room was very nice, and spacious for Tokyo Standard.I'd definitely come back.

It's easier to list the shortcomings of a property. The Shangri-La Tokyo has very few and they are barely worth mentioning. I would be left combing through absurd minutiae, like the ripeness of the persimmon or... what else is there? It's difficult to offer impressions of a very good hotel experience—there should be nothing to say, should there? These are my own prejudices or preferences, I guess, but I think a good hotel stay should be unsurprising: everything you want or desire should be taken care of and the extras should be things that you wanted or desired without realizing it. A good hotel should be able to read your mind. And because of that, it feels somehow indelicate and confessional to describe the pleasures of a hotel stay.The Shangri-La Tokyo is the best hotel in the city.

This hotel is located on Tokyo station which means you can walk to Ginza, Tsukiji fish market, and have many transport options to see Tokyo. Also the station has inexpensive eateries which are convenient.The foyer is small and path to the room elevator right, however the hotel is very well appointed in Shangri La style. Housekeeping is impeccable. Check in was smooth enough and room had excellent high view - Lobby is on 28th floor.The in-room dining was acceptable, not exceptional. Concierge services are seriously lacking. With a months notice they gave average to no recommendations and when we had a positive experience with one of the staff she never followed up, we were never contacted about our dinner reservation. This would never happen at the Shangri La in HK or South East Asia. Communication between staff is a bit muddled. After explaining check out plan to staff on the line had to communicate this again. Would stay again with some room for improvement.

I stayed just for 1 night at Shangri-la Tokyo but the room premises are so luxurious, the view...etc. The kingsize bed is very confortable and the bath very convenient. I had dinner at its Italian restaurant which is really good

Immaculate hotel right in the heart of the city. Fantastic city view. Sipping a cup of Japanese green tea served on a special Japanese tea set and watching the flow of traffic in the city from my room window.

It’s not my first time staying here and it’s always a pleasure to return.The property is well kept. Service is impeccable.Honestly I cannot find a single fault with this place.If you have to have just one meal here, have the breakfast here. It’s awesome! I love the French Toast and the pastries and my son calls the Egg Benedict the best in the world!

This is how a hotel should be run! Great service from the entire staff - very kind and professional from check-in to check-out. Extremely large, modern rooms and facilities. Great restaurants with delicious food. Convenient location right on top of Tokyo Station so you can easily take a train to any part of Tokyo, including bullet trains to other parts of Japan and the express train to Narita Airport. I can't wait to come back!

There’s a stellar restaurant, Piacere, we (somewhat lazily) ate breakfast and lunch at for days, before and after excursions - no regrets. Impeccable staff, will truly miss them. It wasn’t just about convenience, quality is top notch, and we were accommodated beyond expectation (and reason). Remove “where do we eat” from your task list. The concierge crew can’t be praised enough. Emailed beforehand for a few weeks - they got us Ghibli Museum tickets, and completely arranged the next leg of Tokyo -> Kyoto transport. An example of the experience: “11am is available but 11:20 has window seats, and your daughter might enjoy that” WHAT. You walk in or out, they’ll update you on status of requests. Utilize their skills and this service. Blown away. Lastly, and really consider this, the hotel and rooms are beautiful and clean. From my limited experience in Japan (and admittedly nice hotels), this is status quo. The people are where it’s at, they’ll make your trip.

It was a delightful experience from the moment i stepped foot into the hotel . It was my first stay there...something not easy to forget .The hotel room was excellent . I was given a room facing the Tokyo station . I spent quite a bit of time looking at the trains and the views around the station . Amazing .There was a Nespresso machine , which was really wonderful for coffee lovers . The bathroom was beautiful , with a cubicle for the shower and tub and a separate cubicle for the toilet with the wonderful warm toilet seats . And the most wonderful , to me, was the pyjamas provided in the hotel room..which definitely contrbuted to my sound sleep .Breakfast at the hotel was simply delightful . It was semi-buffet , with an adequate selection of the various bread, pastries , soups , cheeses etc . The main dish can be ordered from the menu provided . I had the crab cake with the eggs benedict 3 mornings in a row..it was divine .The staff were very polite , helpful and accomodating . Always willing to make time to assist with enquiries on directions , transportation and even locating certain stores that I was looking for .Does it deserve its 5 star rating ? Definitely .Would i vist again? In a heart beat .And also , the hotel was an easy walk to the palace ground , so those wanting their morning runs will not be missing anything .

I stayed here for two nights on a business trip. It’s centrally located, with the Narita Express underneath. The views are beautiful, tranquil, incredibly clean and well kept. Staff are warm, efficient and helpful.Breakfast room is stunning, excellent fresh food and really something special.

Flawless. I stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel, Tokyo for a business trip in November 2018. It was my first stay there and I was very impressed. The hotel is located vey conveniently right next Tokyo station where the Narita Express arrives from the airport. Plus, one can use underground walkway to get to office buildings in Otemachi. My room (3117) was of exceptional quality with a great view over the train station. For tea lovers: the room had various Japanese teas from the great Ippodo tea house. I would definitely stay at the Shangri-La Tokyo again.
user_name:
mschoe64
New York City, New York

review_body: I have always been partial to Shangrila Hotels and so I cannot help but compare this with my favorite Shangrila, the Shangrila at BGC in the Philippines.I was pleased to note that as soon as we entered the hotel, that familiar Shangrila ambiance was present. The Horizon Club staff were also, as usual, outstanding. They made checking in a very pleasurable experience as we were allowed to enjoy the fantastic view of Tokyo while the staff did everything. Mako Ishigaki, in particular was so nice to us. She spent a lot of extra time with my daughter, helping her practice her Nihonggo throughout our stay. She even created a birthday card, asking every member of the Horizon Club staff to sign it to mark my daughter's very special day. She seemed to be always there whenever we needed something.The location was perfect. Being next to Tokyo station, we could go anywhere we wanted. All facilities were well maintained and the staff always seemed to make our room perfect everytime. One thing I noticed here was that almost all the staff seemed able to speak good English. So for English speaking people who do not speak Nihonggo, Shangrila could be a good place to stay.Compared to Shangrila BGC however, the breakfast was below our expectations.While we had the choice of having breakfast at the Horizon Club, Piacere or in our room, the choices were very limited as compared to Shangrila BGC or Shangrila Hongkong.Also, the driver who picked us up at the airport offered very little help. Maybe, he was afraid that we would not understand him but he just dropped us off at the basement without saying a word. We did not know if someone would come and get us and it took us a while to find out how to get to the hotel lobby at the 28th floor. The same was true with the driver who brought us to the airport.Overall, it was a very pleasant experience and I believe Shangrila Tokyo was the perfect choice for us.

I took my family to Tokyo and stayed at the Shangrila. The horizon lounge was worth every penny! The service and staff are spot on and it made my life easier with managing my family breakfasts and snacks at noon and in the evenings. The staff is attentive and accommodations are five stars ! The pool and spa are a relaxing part of our trip. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else!

Positives on the Shangri-La. The staff is helpful, the facilities are excellent, the view is good. As noted, its right near the Tokyo train station and located near the imperial palace, some pretty amazing shopping, lots of businesses, etc. etc. The beds are awesome. The shower and tub are great, and it wouldn't be Japan without an excellent (and complicated) toilet. The breakfast was good (OK if you are on a package or an expense account...would not pay for it). The gym was well maintained and the pool, while small, was quite nice. So, why four stars? Its not the money. It has all the amenities of hotels in this price range. I didn't feel ripped off at all. My objections are more stylistic. I thought everything was a bit too ornate, in the rooms and in the common areas. The bar seemed somewhat soulless (and had too much cigarette smoke, even for Tokyo). These are not reasons to avoid the place. But the sensibility of a luxury hotel should match yours. This didn't match mine, and it felt obvious during my stay. Sometimes a hotel can be all things to all people. The Shangri-La has its own sense of style.
user_name:
idbinnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: I have stayed at the Shangri-La, Tokyo twice now and it never disappoints. Just had a short two day stay on business.They met all my pre-trip requirements which were waiting in my room (tea, fresh milk) when I arrived and an upgrade on check-in.Staff always charming and the views always worth gazing out on a while longer.Also allowed me to use the facilities after I had checked out as I had a late flight. Highly recommended for business travel.

Would highly recommend the Horizon Club room floors. Includes a special room with amazing views for private guest checkin, breakfast, afternoon tea, and evening snacks.Views of the train station below were fun and interesting. The rooms were super clean and staff was excellent. Great indoor pool and staff.Only issue I would mention is that the restaurant in the hotel is “tapas”..... we assumed it was a “regular” restaurant and portions were sooooo small and disappointing. The restaurant should let everyone know that guests are meant to be order more food! (We figured it out the next day).

We stayed at the Shangri-La our last night in Tokyo. It was a relaxing experience after a two week trip through Japan. The hotel is very nice and has a fantastic view of the Tokyo skyline. The room was well appointed and very comfortable even with an extra bed for my granddaughter. The robes, turn down service and amenities were lovely. We ordered room service for dinner and thought it was well presented and delicious. We went to the buffet for breakfast and again was happy with the offerings and quality. The service was impeccable. The hotel is literally steps away from the Tokyo train station and an easy walk to catch the train to Narita Airport. While the hotel may not be as luxurious as other five star hotels it was well worth it for location and price.

Have had a Tokyo trip in mid-October and stayed at Shangri-la Hotel Tokyo for few days.Being a recurrent guest of this hotel for nearly eight years, it is my only choice of hotel when staying in Tokyo, because of its whole-hearted services, both from the front desk and Concierge.Special thanks to the Concierge team for their perfect arrangement for my trip especially Mr. Yoshioka who always cater our needs during the trip.I cannot think of other reason why I do not choose Shangri-la Hotel Tokyo as my hotel of stay at Tokyo.

Stayed here for our last night in Japan, and it couldn't have been more perfect. The bar has the most stunning view over Tokyo, and great cocktails. Exceptional service - our flight was at night so they let us leave our bags and gave us access to the gym/showers so we could change after roaming around Tokyo for the last time. The restaurant breakfast is held in is so gorgeous, amazing view and amazing decor.Would definitely stay here again.

Very luxurious hotel in the heart of Tokyo. Unmatched personal service that we have never experienced anywhere else in the world. We would like to emphasize the friendliness and the service of the executive club manager and her team. Also, the food at the Excecutive Club was exceptionally good. The opportunity rent a BWM bike for free was a pleasure for us and we were able to discover Tokyo from its most beautiful side.

It’s just beside the Tokyo station and only 10 minutes walk away to ginza shopping area . Also very easy to get taxi in front of the hotel . The hotel lobby is not very big and doesn’t look grand . But, the rooms are good . Nice view . Good house keeping service .

They know how to do service and the staff is very knowledgeable. Just by the train station, you can get anywhere. The rooms are quiet and very comfortable. The light switches are hard to use. More shopping is in the other side of the track.

Huge room! The largest size bed I have ever seen. I think they placed two king size beds side by side. I found it amusing as a single business traveler who have stayed in hotels over my 20 plus years of business travel. I appreciate that they have smoking rooms for smokers and it's in a convenient location just beside Tokyo Station.

This was our second stay here. We booked their trainspotting family package - 2 rooms interconnecting with 50% discount off the second room, train cakes and treats on arrival, breakfast included!
