Right above Tokyo Main Railway station with views of all the railway lines passing through the station - Shinkansen (Bullet) trains through to commuter rail. Rooms were very comfortable, Room service dinner was great and breakfast was sensational, all staff were lovely - they could not do enough to accommodate our various needs. Already looking forward to our next visit!

Most beautiful hotel and staff. The room we got was one of the most amazing we’ve ever stayed at (and largest in Japan). Great location by the station, lovely bar by the lobby to chill in the evening with a glass of wine, can’t fault anything!

There is very little to dislike about this excellent hotel- except maybe the bill!!Nothing is too much for the staff here from room service to concierge- could not ask for better. The rooms are very well appointed and the bathroom is an experience Loved everything here

Lovely location, 5-10 min taxi ride to ginza and Tsukiji market. The rooms are very generous in size , especially the double bed, the bed is huge, can easily fit three people. The staffs are wonderful, extremely helpful and efficient in making restaurant reservations. One of the best shangri la .

Three nights here as the finale of a family trip in Japan. We went for this hotel because we have been to the London one in the Shard which is super special. We also went for Horizon Club which is on the 37th floor.The location is brilliant-with easy access to and from each side of Tokyo station-2 minutes from nearest door to the hotel. There is a pretty standard double elevator set-up to get to the lobby first of all and then on to the rooms. While pleasant, I did not find the lobby and lobby bar special enough especially compared with the Mandarin Oriental where we stayed when we first arrived in Japan. We checked-in at the Horizon Club on the 37th floor. The set-up here is great-it really does feel like quite a small private club with the Club rooms located either side of the lounge which is pleasant but slightly compromised by the available space. Views are lovely though. Usual lounge set-up with a shifting pattern of food and drink during the day and into the evening. The breakfast, which is combined buffet and at seat service, was especially good. The service is quick and attentive.However, however, the attitude with the service was quite mixed shall we say. First of all the passive/aggressive approach to closing time at 10pm which although not quite expressed that way was a fairly pointed "drink-up and leave". The same approach was replicated in the lobby bar. Second and worse, while some of the staff were lovely with our daughter (aged 4), there was clearly communicated lack of enthusiasm for her to be in the lounge even briefly in the evening-culminating in my wife and daughter being asked to leave the lounge for the reason that our daughter was wearing the slippers issued by the hotel! This experience upset my wife. I was out when this happened but I did not miss the customer service manager about it the next morning-she did deal with my complaint very well however. Hotel management: please make your mind up whether you want kids (and relative money) or not and follow-through consistently!! Our room was v nice and comfortable, but not awesomely nice in the way that the rooms in the London branch are. The pool is stunning-I mean stunning. Each changing area also has an onsen attached to it-very pleasant, apart from the sauna which in the gents at least seemed to be built out of plywood like a garden shed. Special word for the pool staff and concierge team who were super-friendly. Overall-given the cost and the special position as the last stay of our holiday, slightly disappointed but the hotel has a great deal going for it, especially location and if you want a pool.

I vacation a lot. I have spent many months in city around the world. This place was the largest rip off I have come across. Everything is over priced and not good. Breakfast buffet was a total rip. The worse show of using a big name for overcharging guests. Many staff could not speak English which is disappointing. I am North American and found this hotel to have a racial component as well. Seemed a bit that all of Japan did. I just didn’t expect it at my hotel. Ordered our $25 bar drinks after waiting for 15 mins just to wait another 20 mins to get it. However some Japanese guests treated instantly. We looked presentable and did not cause trouble. We’re just North American. Our room was facing the train tracks so loud all day. The 2 elevator systems sucks if you want to enjoy the outside and come back in. The gym is very small. Location is good that that’s going for them.

Having stayed at a few Shangs round the region we had an idea of what to expect at this hotel and were not disappointed. Luxurious even opulent facilities and rooms with a massive double bed! Large room though the "garden view" incorporated the railway yard which might appeal to train buffs. Service is great though the 2 lift acess might be a bit of a pain. All in 'Shang' class.

We just spent 4 fabulous nights at the Shangri la hotel in Tokyo. This hotel is right next to the Tokyo Station, we were on the 32nd floor overlooking the beautiful Imperial Gardens, and could watch the trains coming and going looking straight down to the tracks. We found this fascinating. We were not bothered by noise at all. The room was luxuriously appointed. A marble bathroom with a huge shower and deep soaking tub big enough for two people. The bed was the biggest bed I have ever seen and extremely comfortable. I have a very hard time sleeping, and I slept like a baby here. As amazing as the room was, we were even more impressed by the service and food here. The front desk was so helpful with any questions, spent as much time as we needed to help us with dinner reservations, and sightseeing. The breakfast was wonderful, we had a choice of a beautiful buffet or choosing off the menu. We had traditional Japanese breakfast several days, which changed daily. The choices of food the menu were delicious and creative. We had a light dinner in the bar with a cocktail. A couple of nights as we were just so exhausted from walking all day and eating fabulous Japanese cuisine for lunch. The food and beverage manager, Fiachra Martin was so helpful and really made our stay perfect. We were treated so well by everyone at the Shangri la and will return when in Tokyo.

This is a high end hotel (floors 28-37 of a bank building) right next to Tokyo Station. I stayed in a Horizon Club corner room (expensive, but got completely what I paid for). The room, view, Horizon Club service and dining were all pretty much perfect. To give an example of the staff's attentiveness, I found myself there on a 3 day weekend, so the Horizon Club was crowded for about an hour one evening and they could not find me a seat. I said no problem and went down to meet the bartender (nice guy). Later that evening, at least three staff members apologized for my "inconvenience" and three more the next morning (including the Club Manager). This place is wonderful and, of course, its location is perfect.

This hotel lives up to the usual Shangri-La standard and does not disappoint. The location next to Tokyo Station makes my five days stay very convenient since I get around the city sightseeing using all public transport. Got out of the plane and got to the hotel with Narita Express in just a little over two hours. Service is excellent and by the next morning after arrival, the front desk and restaurant staff can frequently address myself and my wife with our last name. A special appreciation to Mr Martin, the assistant food and beverage manager, who is most pleasant and attentive.

Great hotel in the centre of Tokyo next too the Tokyo station. Great service from very attentive staff. This hotel has large rooms and is ideal for exploring the city.all staff are helpful and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.

Stayed here for 7 days in the first week of July. I found the hotel to be disappointing for a number of reasons. Firstly, no acknowledgement of Jade status was given, I was not offered an upgrade even though it seemed obvious to me the hotel was far from capacity. Secondly, the swimming pool. On the website, it stated that children could use the pool, however when we took our toddler there all dressed up and excited, the staff told us no one under four was allowed! He was nappy trained at the time, so there should have been no issue. I had to drag a screaming toddler away in tears and calm him down, he was deeply distressed. No one should have to experience that on a family holiday. The reception staff were less than helpful and the manager was apparently ‘not around’ when I requested to talk to them. I felt very much we were secondary to their concerns. The room was nice enough, breakfast was minimal but had some good choices still. I think next time despite holding Jade I will look at a different hotel in Tokyo next time.

After a two nights stay at the Shangri-la Tokyo, I have to say it was a perfect 5 star experience.The hotel is a foot step away from Tokyo station, in the Marunouchi Trust tower; the hotel reception is on the 28th floor.As we arrived around 3pm but the room was not ready yet and after apologizing, receptionist kindly asked us to come back in 1 hour. I asked if there was a smoking room available but there was just one in the upper room category and that was a 60€ night supplement, so we denied.As we came back the receptionist upgraded us for free to the deluxe Imperial palace view smoking room, that was really appreciated!The room was 50 sqm, with a great decor, Nespresso machine, Japanese Tea making set, big working desk, king size bed, sofa, big bathroom with tv, full immersive tub, walk in shower, fluffy robes and L'Occitane amenities. (the bathroom has a glass in the shower so it overlooks the bed, but it can be offuscated, so maximun privacy). The hotels provided also pijamas and Yukata.The room had a big tv screen equipped with a Bose sound system and automatic shades.The amenieties of the room are all those expected from a 5 star hotel.Very usefull the usb plugs near the bed. The also provide an international plug.I expected something more about the room view, the Imperial palace view wa a bit disappointing...it was more a view over Tokyo station (no problems at all about noises).I've also made use of the Spa and pool, great!The concierge was top notch! made a restaurant reservation, booked our return Narita express tkt and also called some shops nearby to ask and be sure they had an item we where looking for, really a 5 star concierge service!! Can't remember their names, it was once a male and another a woman, great job!One morning we used room breakfast, and again great job! Perfect timing as requested and professional delivery, eggs benedict where delicious.The scent in the hotel is really good.We also used their complimentary escort service to Tokyo station on the day of our departure, Kenta Ikeda who escorted us in front of our wagon on NEX, made an exellent job! very polite and professional guy.Location,as said, near Tokyo station is great for moving around Tokyo and inside the station there are plenty of restaurants and shops to visit.The overall experience at the Shangri-la Tokyo was top notch, really a 5 star hotel! The really difference is made by the people working there, all very polite, professional, and nice.

Fabulous service, really, really great wine and cocktail list, elegant, comfortable with stunning views. Made to feel so welcome by the staff. This is well worth a visit and we weren’t even staying there!

I love this place. Customer service is over the top! I called for room service and I explained that I couldn’t have cheese. Woke up in the morning to a note under that door with a card explaining that in Japanese in case I ate out in the city. Rooms are beautiful, location is great and I can’t get over how responsive everyone is!!! I could live here!!!
user_name:
tfc3nyc
New York City, New York

review_body: Fantastic 4 night stay at the Shangri La on the first top of our honeymoon. Every member of staff was helpful, courteous, and on their A- game. The welcome staff all made us feel taken care of from the minute we walked in to our room - there was a gorgeous desert tray and honeymoon message waiting for us. The room was impeccable, the lobby bar has live music most nights we were there (great jazz and cover piano singer). The location could not be more convenient with the big train station a few blocks away (but far enough to keep the surrounding blocks calm). Breakfast was a treat, and Zaki the manager in the mornings went above and beyond to make us feel pampered for this special stay. We will absolutely be back the next time we are in Tokyo. thank you!
user_name:
Andrea D
New York City, New York

review_body: I was totally pleased with every small touch of my stay. From reception till the room everything is done properly with great and welcoming service. Choose the upper floors for the magnificent views of Tokyo. The breakfast at Horizon’s club was absolutely stunning.

Good central location. Facilities are up to the expectations, although the fitness room is not very large but practically not crowded with good equipments and well staffed.Room are large with modern equipments. Breakfast buffet is good too.Nice garden view although some noise from train station nearby can be heard.Overall good choice.

We stayed at three different hotels while in Tokyo and Shangri-La was probably the one that had the best location just next door to Tokyo Station and the hustle and bustle of city life a stone's throw away. Hotel was great in many ways and room and facilites all very comfortable and luxurious but of the three (other two being Park Hyatt and Aman Tokyo), this was my third favourite as it lacked the grandeur of the other two. Very nice and typical hotel in this segment (i.e. 5 star) but nothing really exceptional about it though I still would recommend it warmly.Gym was tiny but equipment was ok.Staff very accomodating and friendly and helped us out to fix the problem we had with the pocket wifi we got at airport.

Best hotel in Tokyo! Italian restaurant “Piacere” is also very nice. Had a wonderful dinner there.Great hospitality and service!Aroma fragrance in the hotel was very impressive. I got one from the shop on the ground floor. Room is big enough and had a great time.

The room was very nice with a great view of Tokyo station, with a comfortable bed, good size bathroom and all the amenities similar to the Shangri-La brand across their hotels. They have introduced an instant messaging system via Line, which makes arranging bookings via the concierge really convenient. Their response rate was very fast, and everything worked out very well as it saved a lot of waiting time at the Front Desk. The gym was slightly on the small side and not as well-equipped as I would have liked. I didn’t use the pool but it didn’t look very big either. The staff there was very courteous and professional.I checked out using their hotel app and the bill was emailed to me, with the bags delivered to the lobby whilst I was having lunch. It’s really a first class service and I had an excellent stay!

We stayed one night and wish we stayed more. The hospitality, service and overall stay was fantastic. The breakfast was delicious, we used the train escort service which was accommodating, they booked all of our bullet train tickets and gave us advice selecting one over another. I highly recommend this hotel.

Amazing luxurious hotel with beyond the expected service. The service really sets this hotel apart from other large chain establishments. I arrived early with no expectations to check-in except to charge my phone. The front desk was going to take my luggage but the Horizon Club staff invited me to come up to the lounge to charge my phone and to have breakfast. The staff then checked if there was anyway they could accommodate me into a room and I was literally in my room after I finished breakfast.They even provided me with a pocket-wifi service so I could have internet throughout my stay and the charger. The ladies are super sweet and next level helpful. My handbag hardware was loose and they even called engineering to provide me with a micro screwdriver to fix the handle. I mean who does that?I stayed in both the deluxe imperial view room as well as the Premier room. Whilst obviously the premier room being the corner suite was uncharacteristic spacious and luxe, as a solo traveller the deluxe room really is sufficient. Splurge to get the Horizon Club access as this is totally worth it for breakfast, afternoon snacks and dinner drinks & canapés. More importantly, for the incredible service.

Hotel promised free breakfast and refused to honor their promise. They also promised a designated smoking area and have none. Use caution trusting them to be honorable. Tried to address with them four times and they refused to respond.

A nice room with view and a great location beside that i was excepting to find something more interesting for a 5 stars hotel and ranked number 1 in tokyo. We didn't even find a welcoming msg in the room when we arrived , despite mentioning it's my birthday the next day no single action was taken and later they apologize when i mentioned that they lack the attention to the details and then they send a small cake.

Possibly the best welcome we have ever received in any hotel. The front desk staff are second to none. The same can be said for the lounge staff. Ms Inoue (lounge captain) happily took time to give us personal recommendations that helped us to find the very best family friendly destinations in and around Tokyo. Fiachra went out of his way to make us welcome. Overall, an absolute pleasure and everything that we would expect from the Shangri-La chain. Our only disapppointment was that our toddler was not welcome in the Italian restaurant on site. As regular visitors, we appreciate that there is a policy regarding allowing small children into the in house restaurant in Shangri-La hotels. We would sincerely ask that the management reconsiders this. Other hotels of similar standards (the Hyatt in Kyoto for example) make smaller children extremely welcome with special menus and quiet areas. Other branches of the Shangri-La (specifically the Rasa Sayang in Penang) are, at the very least, prepared to make accomodations in order to avoid making families of young children feel unwelcome. This means a great deal. A little flexibility goes a long way to making a stay perfect.

This hotel is a lovely and often rare example of both top notch service and facilities. To start, we lost our family of five’s passports and rail tickets on the Narita Express on the way to the hotel. The staff called the railway office and police to see if they could track them down. Thankfully, ours were found (apparently common in Japan) and the follow through (a staff member picked up our documents which were in another part of town), good communication with us and amongst staff was extraordinary. Lovely rooms with an expansive view of the city. Nice workout rooms kept immaculately clean and a good indoor pool which was especially nice during Tokyo’s hot and humid temps. A few steps from the hotel, a Starbucks and Bellmart convenience store at the entrance to the train station served us well for breakfast and snacks. Location also provided easy train access, restaurants and shops in Tokyo station, and to the Ginza. We used the conciege a great deal and had very good experiences with their recommendations. I loved the pajamas that were provided. Service was friendly, lovely, and on point. We could not have asked for a better start to our holiday (except perhaps not losing the passports in the first place).

The Hotel itself is fabulous,what made our stay perfect was the staff of the hotel.They care so much that you feel like you are the only one in the hotel.The concierge is great,she really assisted us whenever we needed reservations or advices.The check in and check out team are so kind, they upgraded us for our honeymoon!The location of the hotel is perfect,its just a 2 mins walk from Tokyo station which made it very easy for us to go around.The station got an amazing foodhall,A MUST!!What we liked the most in this hotel was THE FOOD.The quality of the products is amazingThe room service is very very good,they got a huge selection of food.We even found in the menu FALAFEL (food from our home country)The breakfast is AMAZING i woke up at 6 everyday (i am not a morning person) just to discover the buffet selection.We met the F&B director and the chef.They were so nice, friedly and professional.We really felt like home.Mr Martin from the F&B packed us a small box for our trip to Kyoto.The waiters are very good,they know what you need before you ask!The stay was so good that we extended it!

So lazy after swimming so decided to order room services, saw the Curry Laksa and thought how could it be nice in Japan ? But why not give a try ?! It impressed me already when I saw it, the smell already hinted me it’s good ! The taste is so authentic and condensed enough, seafood so fresh too ! The wanton ramen & char kwa teoy is good too, tendon also a must try !

I stayed four nights in a deluxe room at the start of my honeymoon. The room was very spacious with a great view of Tokyo Skytree. I loved the view from the bath tub! The room was up to the usual Shangri-la standard with fluffy bath robes & towels & a comfy large bed. We had room service for breakfast a couple of mornings which was very efficient. Didn’t use the pool. Food & drink at the hotel is very expensive but there are lots of alternatives nearby eg in Tokyo station.The hotel is in a good location about a 10min walk from the subway station & train platforms. The best thing about the hotel was the service, some of the best we have experienced. The concierge exchanged our JR pass for us, arranged train seat reservations, walked us to the office to buy a subway pass & walked us to the Shinkansen platform. They also came to our room to collect our suitcases & arranged for them to be shipped to the next hotel. The staff were so helpful & friendly nothing was too much trouble.The only slight negative was that our honeymoon wasn’t acknowledged which was a little disappointing (we told the hotel in advance).

As ever high standards from the Shangri La.Too end welcome and service through delivered in the usual Asian way with the added charm and warmth of a Japanese hospitality.Superb rooms and bathrooms superbly appointed.Breakfast offering again the usual high quality Asian buffet.A real treasure in the city.

Just step outside Tokyo Station—asumning you exit the correct door which can be a challenge. The service is the very best—from the houskeeeping staff to the lounge staff and the front desk. The concierge noticed that a my return train ticket was not the time I mentioned ( my mistake when I purschased in Narita). They took my old ticket and had it exchanged for the correct time for no charge. They also provided me an escort to the station to ensure I got where I needed to be on time for my return to the airport. I could have done this solo but was short on time and could not risk getting disoriented and missing my train. The rooms are very spacious and the shower/tub area with large window views of the city was great.. For sure this all comes with a 5 star price tag but if you can swing it the hotel will not dissapioint. The only slight knock is the gym area is so small that with 5 other people working out there is just no more room—very tight and narrow. But the access to steam etc is cool..

Incredible stay(s) at the Shangri-La Tokyo. We originally booked just a few days but cancelled other reservations at another property in Tokyo to extend our stay here. The staff, the attention to detail - all 5-Star. Claire helped us get tours, spa and dinner reservations months in advance answer all of our silly questions. She is a true gem and when we finally met her in person it was like meeting an old friend. The food and service in the lounge, lobby and many restaurants were all superb. Avocado toast is great and prepared just right with poached eggs. The room(s) we had were clean, quiet, spacious and very comfortable. We enjoyed a spa treatment after our long journey and it was amazing. Super quality from top to bottom. Really liked how the staff met you in Tokyo Station and helped you navigate to the hotel. Sounds simple, but it can be very confusing especially with a lot of luggage. Can’t say enough great things about this property and the staff. We will without a doubt be back.

Location superb especially if you want to go to many cities with shinkansen. They provide pijamas ans yukata so no need to bring pijamas. Place is right above shinkansen, local train. So with jr pass you can do a day trip to kyoto, hakone odawara, osaka while using yamanote line exclusively mainly in city to travel within tokyo. 1 round trip with jr pass to osaka plus using Narita Express from airport already cheaper than not usinyg jr pass.Very close to famous ramen street (rokurinsha, ikaruga), bento ekiben ya matsuri, character street, very good tonkatsu (maizen and wako). Very good place to buy souvenirs, and the service is impeccable.The view to the imperial garden is also very nice. Very close to nihonbachi isetan and very big bookstore maruzen where you can buy interesting stuff as souvenirs. Very close to pokemon dx cafe and relatively close to biggest uniqlo ginza. Buy uniqlo here is cheaper than in sgp :).

Super nice luxury hotel in a perfect location by Tokyo metro! Rooms are very nice and all staff are super friendly. Hotel is beautiful! Can't comment on the food because we never ate at the hotel. Concierge and front desk staff were very accommodating and friendly and they provided excellent advice and service. From perfect restaurant recommendations to assisting with transportation and getting our train tickets to Kyoto for no charge! They are a classy hotel with great service. They even escorted us to the Shinkansen terminal platform as a complimentary service. We would definitely recommend staying here. We also stayed at the Ritz in Kyoto during our visit in Japan and, although both hotels are top rated, we preferred the customer service at the Shangri-La.

We had a difficult time choosing between the aman and this hotel, but im glad i went with this one. The hotel is located next to tokyo station, we were picked up outside of our train the narita express and basically walked to the hotel. The staff, the rooms and the food were all superb.

This place is wonderful. We stayed on the horizon club level, and it made all the difference. What an elegant establishment, with service from some of Japans very finest. The lounge area upstairs made such a wonderful impression upon us, that every time we left the hotel, we could not wait to return. The gym is spacious, well equipped, and even has a swimming pool, with a skyline view. The music played throughout the hotel creates quite an atmosphere. The team who works here are at the top of their game, including the restaurant staff - Mr. Martin - especially, who was always looking after his friends from Hawaii. We will be back next year, and can hardly wait.

We enjoyed our stay at the hotel because of the attentive service, wonderful room and great location. I would highly recommend this hotel. The room was fantastic. The only disappointment was the breakfast buffet; the entree selection was outstanding but the buffet had limited selection given the price of the meal.

This was my second visit to the Shangri-La. Unfortunately, there were a few bumps. On arrival, my room was not ready although the arrival time had been communicated days in advance. When finally a room was ready, it was a twin bed (I do not sleep in two beds). Service at the bar was sub-standard. While there were plenty of servers, they seemed to look straight ahead rather than around. Unless you are making a windmill with your arms, they won’t see you. Refilling water etc. was not happening. Worst was the food service. With two people at the table, our food arrived 15 min apart. Also for one of us, the fries arrived much later than the burger to which they belonged. - Having said that, the food quality is decent. The quality of the cocktails excellent. Breakfast service is a different story. Smooth and attentive as it should be. I think the Maître d’ is from the Middle East - he runs a tight ship. The quality of the food again very nice. Rooms are specious and clean. Even considering the significant downsides (service!), it is still a far better option than the Four Seasons (see my other review).

Love this hotel - great location, excellent views and breakfasts. Cosy meeting facilities. Panoramic windows - cool urban landscape day and night. Imperial Gardens view. Through windows you can see how bullet trains below goes back and forth.

We travelled to Japan as a family of four and wanted a central location with easy access from Narita Airport via Narita express . The Shangri-La is conveniently located next to Tokyo Station and downtown. The hotel concierge met us in Tokyo station on the rail platform and graciously escorted us with luggage to the hotel . The pedestrian entrance is on the ground floor but the lobby is on 28th. You transfer to different elevators for The rooms which start above 31 and we booked the Horizon Club on the top 37 th floor . This was well worth the cost for the comfortable rooms, concierge services , delicious breakfast and drinks and snacks during the day . Check in was in your room - a nice discreet touch .The rooms were magnificent with spacious bathrooms and comfortable beds . They were quiet despite the bustle of trains and city life below . The hotel welcomed us with some Proseco ,fruits and chocolate as we were celebrating our anniversary - another nice touch. Fresh water bottles were replenished daily and there were in room coffee/ tea makersThe Buffett breakfast included with the Club rooms was also healthy , fresh and delicious with both western and Japanese cuisine.The motor entrance is on B1 and the bell hop hailed taxis easily if neededShangri-La was convenient to Ginza, shopping and the famed Tsukiji Fish market as well as all the JR or Metro lines Our dedicated concierges Ami and Mai were professional , courteous - they took care of every wish including booking Shinkansen tickets to Kyoto and our bell hop Kai Yang escorted us to the Exact platform at busy Tokyo station The hotel also kept our luggage for a couple days while we were in Kyoto .We loved the hotel for its superior 5 Star service, central location , luxurious rooms And the Horizon Club . We look forward to returning for another wonderful stay .

Despite being located within an office tower, the Shangri-La Tokyo exudes the comforts of a boutique hotel whilst being embellished in luxurious furnishings. I booked room facing the Tokyo Station/Palace and fitting in a rollaway bed is a snug fit but sleeping on the rollaway bed was extremely comfortable nonetheless. Other than that, the staff were constantly eager to help and everyone from the breakfast staff at the Piacere to the bell staff at the underground lobby seemed delighted in doing so. Truthfully, the location of the hotel is convenient if you are familiar with the subway system (which is rather easy to learn) but on foot, finding places to eat and shop isn't as convenient as The Peninsula, which is located right across the Imperial Palace. Nonetheless, The Shangri-La excels in providing a boutique, luxury hotel feel in a secluded yet connected location and if I had to return to this hotel I would definitely do without hesitation.

We got a Horizon Club room facing the Royal Palace for 5 nights. From the moment we arrived the hotel till the time we left, everything (did I say, "Everything"?) went perfectly. Room, Services, and Staff.The staff at the Horizon Club couldn't be better. They are all very professional and yet warm, sincere, and friendly. They are all so capable of handling any requests. I have a few business to take care of and their assistance was thorough and prompt.The size of the hotel is perfect as well. It is not too big and the staff could be available to pay attentions to all the customers closely.I've stayed in many "Club Rooms" with Club Lounge accesses in many hotels all over Asia including other Shangri-La properties. This club lounge has the most consistent and good taste and quality in the food they serve during breakfast and the cocktail hour. Only problem (?) I had was eating so much at the lounge that sometimes I was too full to eat as much good local Japanese food I planned to venture out to eat. Also, I booked this hotel from American Express Plat. service and it gave me many additional benefits like hotel spending credit, early checki-in and late check-out, etc.Very useful! Shangri-La Tokyo has now become a destination to me, rather than a nice hotel in Tokyo.

Everyone knows that Tokyo is one of the most expensive cities in the world. But an experience that will truly demonstrate how much the Japanese regard their customers as “Kings/ Queens” it has to go to the newly established Shangri-la hotel . Perfectly located adjacent to the Tokyo Station, a stay here will truly give you a vision of how royalty lives . No other country has infused their cultural awareness of respect for nature, people , and life as the Japanese. Combined with the high standard of the Shangri-La service, you will wish to remain here for the rest of your life. Yes, it can be expensive even for one night but you will have the memories of a life style that make it worth it.

We stayed there for the end of our Tokyo trip and we were extremely satisfied by the hotel. Off course, the premises are amazing but the staff makes a great difference... they can manage bookings even when a restaurant is fully booked. Really nice breakfast (it was maybe missing a little bit more proteins), really large room with a beautiful design. If I may say, the view on the Tokyo sky tree is little bit disappointing (but due to the tower which is not as bright as the Tokyo tower for example) so no real need to be on that side of the building. The pool and gym area are great are they are almost empty all the time. The transfert service to/from airport is super smooth. And a funny details, but some shifts are teamed with a majority of women, even the piccolo, really cool and welcoming, even if I had a hard time to let a woman carry my luggage. Definitely one of the best hotel in Tokyo

My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon for 5 days during a trip around East Asia. Knowing that the Shangri-La is a premium 5 star hotel, we had high hopes and it completely exceeded all of our expectations. As most people have already mentioned, the hotel is beautiful with an impressive lobby, panoramic bar and art collection, but it’s the service that really blows you away. We were upgraded to a room with a view on check in and the staff had organised a welcome treat; a selection of luxury chocolates and macaroons encased in a chocolate heart, with a ‘happy honeymoon’ note signed by 9-10 different members of staff.The concierge, Mika, was just fabulous and took care of everything. We told her what sort of thing we were thinking for dinner each night and she called around 5 different restaurants checking availability and pricing before giving us her top 3 recommendations. As well as that, she helped book our Batto lessons and our train tickets to Kyoto, all whilst we were out in Tokyo exploring. Everything was confirmed over email so we knew what she had arranged throughout the day. Amazing.On our final morning over a coffee, we got speaking to one of the girls in the bar and once she’d heard that we were heading to Kyoto for the next part of our trip, she grabbed some paper and scribbled a few suggestions for places to eat and drink. Again, just such a kind gesture.Everyone we met at the hotel was so sincere, polite, respectful and it felt as though they all wanted to do as much as they could to help make our trip as enjoyable as possible. Rooms are also pretty impressive. Large, modern with good amenities and good views of Tokyo. We particularly liked the pjs which were provided every night with the turn down service. Location is great, despite being in the business district, you’re on top of Tokyo station with connections across town and also 10-15 min walk to Ginza and the Imperial Palace.We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in HK a week earlier and although it’s also an incredible experience, this was by far the best part of our trip.Next time we visit Tokyo, we’re staying here!

Beautiful property in a good location near Ginza and right outside Tokyo station. If into nightlife, might want to stay closer to Shibuya, but subway was right there. The lobby is on the 28th floor and there is a beautiful lobby bar with panoramic city views where we enjoyed drinks and music. The restaurants are lovely, and we dined each morning with a window view. The room was absolutely beautiful- great view of the city, huge space for Tokyo, incredible bathroom with luxurious shower and tub and beautiful amenities. The bed was extremely comfortable. The gym and spa were gorgeous- with a lovely pool, gym, and steam room. There were nice amenities in gym area including infused water and fruits, headphones- anything you could need. We came for our honeymoon. Prior to arrival our interactions with the concierge were very helpful- securing many reservations for us. When we arrived there there was a beautiful sparkling sake with beautiful fruit plate welcoming us- and we had been upgraded to a room with a view. Our rate included breakfast and it was extravagant and extremely generous. I've never seen a buffet as beautiful and high end, and then on top of that you could order off the incredible menu. I wish I could eat breakfast there every day. The view is also lovely.The front desk staff and concierge seemed to know who were were whenever we came in and out of the property. There was one slip up and they handled it beautifully. The head concierge Miki personally escorted us out upon checkout and gave her business card, offering to assist us with anything else we needed the rest of our time in Japan!! That was completely over the top and much appreciated. We asked for assistance with train tickets to the next phase of our trip, and this was taken care of as a complementary service (in contrast, the Ritz in Kyoto charged to do this). Overall this was a wonderful stay and we look forward to returning one day.
user_name:
Alexandra W
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff in this hotel are so polite and courteous, they will go out of their way to help in any situation that you are in. For example looking for a special present for out Grandchildren. The Concierge made at least 8 or 9 calls to different department stores on our behalf. They were fantastic.

Visited Shangri La Horizon Club in May and delighted with stay. Staff pleasant, helpful and courteous and quality of service and food on offer together with our large well appointed room with Bulgari toiletries thoroughly deserve a 5 star rating. The bed was super comfy and bathroom/wet room was superb. Highly recommend going for the horizon club option as not only are the rooms on the top floors giving an impressive view, but the breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails are included, served in the very plush 37th floor lounge. An added benefit was the provision of a mobile wifi "box" which meant that wherever we travelled in Tokyo, we could always connect to the Shangri La's wifi system - very neat and exceedingly helpful!One slight disappointment was that the "meet and greet" service did not materialise despite following instructions and letting the hotel know which train and carriage number we would arrive on. Tokyo station is immense and we wasted a fair bit of time trying to navigate our way to the hotel after an exhausting 12 hour flight. The hotel was very apologetic but it was a shame that somehow there was a breakdown in communication.We loved every minute of our stay there, my wife made good use of the swimming pool and if we return to Tokyo we would go there again without the slightest hesitation. It is a classy hotel quite easily on a par with the Four Seasons and Mandarin Oriental group of hotels we have stayed at in the past.

Great hotel ideally placed for Tokyo station for Bullit train, mono rail and other lines. Hotel one minute walk when outside Tokyo station. Ami in horizon club was particully helpful to us and when we booked for the Bullit train a member of staff Yukari ( bell girl ) escorts you to your carriage and meets you off when you return. when we returned it was pouring down and she had fetched 4 umbrellas for the short walk back. Food in the horizon club was excellent and tea and soft drinks always available.
user_name:
Rodney B
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: My wife and I travelled as a couple, it was our first time staying at a Shangri-La and it not disappoint. The hotel was clean, staff was friendly and fluent in english. Location next to Tokyo station is great! The daily breakfast buffet is decent, but not stellar, however, there is a menu as well, but I didn't eat a lot at breakfast because there was so much more to try out in the city! The service could have been better in the restaurant for breakfast, we'd have to wave servers down to have our coffee refilled. Admittedly, this may be nitpicking to some, but this is also a 5-star hotel. The rooms were quiet and the blackout curtains are great as i'm a really light sleeper. To my surprise, i did use the gym 2-3 times which was also really nice. We'd stay here again. It does feel as though it's a hotel where there are a lot of business meetings and where a lot of business travelers could be using as well.

Excellent service from all staffs. Great view from Horizon room. Airport limousine bus stops at the hotel, for added convenience.Very accommodating and helpful staffs.Its also cheaper compared to Mandarin Oriental Tokyo.Lobby Lounge at level 28 for a social business meeting.

Everything about the hotel from the staff, service, amenities, and the room was fantastic. We stayed for 5 nights while sightseeing around Tokyo. Even months before we arrived the concierge team went above and beyond to secure us reservations at restaurants we really wanted to try. We also used their meet and greet service from the train platform for a near seamless check in process. Once I bought my nex tickets I simply called the hotel and they had someone meet us at our car on the train platform when we arrived at Tokyo station. We were in the hotel entrance after 15 minutes of lovely conversation and a brisk walk with our greeter. There another staff member met us and took us straight to our rooms. She explained all about the hotel and even confirmed our restaurant reservations. The concierge even sold us Suica cards for the train system! The room was impeccable and each afternoon they did an amazing job at cleaning and replenishing the room. The view were gorgeous and the location is great as it is central to a lot of places that with 20 minutes on direct train lines. Check out was just as seemless, and they walked us back to the train platform as well. Overall, I can't say enough positive things about the staff, their level of service, and the hotel it self. If it works for your budget and location (its definitely one of the pricier hotels in the city) I see no reason to stay anywhere else.

The hotel is absolutely beautifully styled and feels fresh and classic. Our biggest compliment, though, must go to the staff!!! from the moment you arrive you are absolutely catered to by a most charming staff. They were an absolute godsend when going from the hotel to the train station as they offer a meet and greet service. When heading back to the airport, we'd have never made our way without the gracious young man who accompanied us (even though the hotel is a mere stone's throw from the station). He even stayed til the train left to wave us off! The same experience when we left on the train to Kyoto---we were accompanied every step of the way by a delightful young woman named-----. As a westerner, we felt really overwhelmed by the trains as surely the station at Tokyo must be one of the largest on the planet.As for the hotel---our room was beautiful; the restaurant offered a wonderful array of both continental & japanese fare; the lobby bar had a glorious view of the city; and we were made to feel special always---even to the point of everyone remembering our names.Yes, we put a card into the slot inside the door to activate the lights as a previous reviewer noted, but, that is, of course, to be more eco-friendly with lights and electricity. I appreciate that, whether a Days Inn or a 5-star hotel such as the Shangri-la.Our experience was delightful. Being in the center of Tokyo and next to Tokyo train station was a plus.Oh, and by the way---the pajamas were fabulous. I bought 2 sets to take home.
user_location: San Miguel de Allende, Guanajuato, Mexico
user_name:
Rebecca M
San Miguel de Allende, Guanajuato, Mexico

review_body: For starters how can this hotel call itself a Five Star when they make you put the keycard for the electricity to work. That’s Days Inn stuff. Then it’s old and you can feel it and notice it. Corcierge staff is average at best. Certainly not the best in Tokyo but not the worst. The room is spacious though! Wouldn’t stay there again.

Had stay here for many times, however, this time after never stay here for almost 2 years my fate bring me back here to meet to super dirty toilet bowl which leave evidence of previous guest heavy activities in this toilet. Furniture used to be new and good but now a little run down service is ok. The hotel concierge take long time to reply the email and cant really book any fancy restaurant for us. Bye shangri la tokyo, as my Only shangri La leaf ruin by the pervious guest

The hotel is very close to train station and bus stop from the airport. So it's very convenient and they offer meet and great service from the train platform and airport bus stop to the hotel for every guest,but you need to call and confirm the pick up time with them. The lobby is nice and located on the 28th floor, however if you book the horizontal club you can check in and out at the horizontal club. I have a chance to stay in the horizontal club room and normal deluxe room. The layout of the room almost the same, however you can enjoy the horizontal club floor and get a more luxury brand for the bathroom complimentary. The WIFI in this hotel is super fast everywhere. The staff are nice, kind and professional. The swimming pool and the fitness are clean and perfect condition. There are spa and sauna inside the bathroom. So it's nice to use after the exercise or on the long days of walking. The breakfast is nice and consist of many menus include american and Japanese.

Having spent a few days and nights at the Shangri-La Hotel we were blown away by the sheer opulence of the Furniture & Wall coverings. The soft furnishings were aesthetically pleasing to the eye and quite calming. We arrived very early (10.39) from Osaka, expecting to drop off the bags and check-in later, no way....with good fortune our room was ready! Result...we dropped off the bags in our room, 3633 on the 36F with amazing views over the Sprawling city of Tokyo. The Room was an executive Imperial Palace Deluxe. Amazing, the quirky ‘wet room’ encased in a separate glass compartment with a bath & Rain showers, twin vanity sink with Bvulgari toiletries and every imaginable toiletry man or woman required. The Bed is a king and the linen is Egyptian cotton. The floor to ceiling Blinds & Curtains are controlled remotely, as are the ceiling & Bed Lights.Small touches go a long way....a set of His/Her Pyjamas are in a drawer, also a full set of His/Her Kimono, Towelling Bathrobes, Slippers all of which are replaced each day. A full Nespresso set including Cups plus a list of Teas and a set of Japanese Tea cups.Horizon ClubAs regular visitors to ‘Club Style’ Lounges wherever we stay this was our first experience of the Horizon Club, it ticks all the boxes, warm, friendly, comfortable, unlimited Tea/Coffee & Snacks available all day. We were offered ‘coffee to go’ when heading out sightseeing, even packs of crocs, boiling. 17.30-1900 a full complimentary bar & hot buffet food is available...!A big thank you to Suyeon Song, a Star, and her Team for a Fantastic time in the Club.  The Spa, Pool & Gym area are amazing, the infinity pool is simply stunning....looking out from the 29 floor in the middle of a City is awesome.

We booked a standard double room for 5 nights in April 2018 for leisure and it is clear that this is mostly a business adress. Nevertheless, we were taken in by the beautiful decor and atmosphere of the hotel. The bathroom and especially the shower were great partly due to the large window overlooking the city. Cool! We didn't need much assistance from the staff, but all interactions were very pleasant and efficient. Recommended!

We stayed for three nights in Shangri-La in Chiyoda and it was a superb experience. The hotel defines luxury city hotel in my view. There is a certain coolness factor about a hotel whose reception is on the 28th floor of a sky scraper and one that had a swimming pool on the 29th. The service from the start to finish was top notch, so much so that it has in my mind re-defined the standard with which to gauge all other hotels I will stay at in the future. The staff extremely polite, very friendly and very helpful. Right from helping organise our day schedule around Tokyo, to booking nice restaurants for us to even sorting out our Shinkansen tickets for the onward journey; everything was sorted out so easily for us. Our room was on the 33rd floor and afforded amazing views of the city. On the last day it was raining and it was particularly beautiful to gaze outside and take in the vistas. I have to mention the health club and pool which is superb and no stay is complete without a visit to these. The hotel is quite pricey and we were lucky to get a good deal when booking. I really hope if I get the chance to visit Tokyo again, we can get a similar deal to stay here again as hard to imagine a better hotel than this one !

Good location next to Tokyo Station and about a 15-20min walk to Ginza. Rooms are spacious and beautifully fitted out and decorated. May be difficult to get a taxi during peak hour, sometimes Uber is a quicker option in this area.

Stayed 10/04-14/04/2018. Horizon Deluxe.Service is impeccable and horizon lounge is amazing. Breakfast was always something to look forward to with a choice from the ala carte menu as well as the buffet selection.Complimentary wifi through the city was a bonus.Location just above the Tokyo Station Northern/Nihonbashi entrance/exit is also convenient for easy movement around Tokyo and to Yokohama.

I love this hotel! The hotel is beautiful and very close to Tokyo station. I stayed in the Horizon club and it was well worth it. I arrived early from Kyoto and they were kind enough to accommodate that and allow both early check-in and late check-out. I had free lounge access that included breakfast - the food was great, fresh, and locally sourced. You get a personal concierge who was so helpful - she booked my Narita Express seat (already had my ticket), an appt at Shiseido with an English speaking stylist, and dinner reservations at Nadaman, which has fantastic sushi. She and the rest of the staff were so kind, friendly and willing to help to make your stay more enjoyable. The room was also beautiful, spacious and had an amazing city view. There is even a concierge who will accompany you to the train platform when you leave - I had been in Japan for a week and was fine getting around, but this extra attention was so much appreciated and made my stay there that much more memorable. I can't wait to return and stay here. I highly recommend this hotel!

ONE of the finest hotels in Tokyo without any doubt! The hotel is ideally located just next to TOKYO station. (Make sure you use the small tiny door to and from the station located in the north Yasu exit).The room was spacious and the view was great! With partial look at the emperor’s palace. The service is excellent , staff super friendly and exactly what you expect from any Shangrila!We loved our stay. We will come back for sure.Highly recommended!

Loved this hotel - great views from the bedroom and the shower of downtown Tokyo. The breakfast (which was extra) was phenomenal. The hotel also let us leave our extra luggage there for several days while we toured other cities in Japan. Just the friendliest staff imaginable. My only nit (and it is a small one) is that their restaurants had limited availability in the evening, which was surprising. I would think they would try to save some seats for guests each evening or at least try to accomodate but they did not.

We stayed at Shangri-la for the first part of our first ever holiday to Japan.The staff at the hotel are amazing - so friendly, welcoming and helpful. I emailed with a few enquiries/requests before my trip and was helped by Kyoko who answered all my questions really quickly and even came to say hello and introduced herself at the hotel. We arranged for the hotel to pick us up from the airport after our 12 hour flight which was very relaxing. Our flight landed at 5am - I asked Kyoko prior to the trip if there was anywhere we could have a freshen up when we arrived after our long flight - she mentioned we could have a shower etc in the spa but that she would try and make sure our room was ready as soon as possible. When we arrived around 6am our room was ready! This was invaluable as we could get ready and chill before heading into tokyo. We also were able to use the horizon lounge straight away and had an amazing breakfast to start our day.The hotel itself is gorgeous and the views are amazing. We have also stayed in Shangri-la at the Shard in London and found both hotels to have breathtaking views and luxurious rooms but the thing that sets Shangri-la Tokyo apart is definitely the level of customer service, professionalism and friendliness of all the staff. All the staff speak excellent English and helped us with booking Disneyland tickets, the Pokémon cafe and taxis. I think the staff member who helped us with the Disney tickets and taxi was Agasa who like all the staff was so friendly and helpful.I would highly recommend the horizon club as a relaxing place to have some food, drink and relaxation. We often popped back to the lounge for a break and refreshments during our busy days exploring. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be returning during our next visit. We have fallen in love with Tokyo and cannot wait to return!

Well I am pretty much spoiled for the rest of my life. I have stayed in some nice hotels, but the service provided by the Shangri-la Tokyo puts it over the top. First I should note that we booked an Executive Suite which offered us access to the Horizon Club, a special lounge for guests who have booked at that level. Totally worth it. Our check-in and check-out were taken care of by the Horizon Club as well as the concierge services. All I can say is that the staff is really top-notch. The service we received from the Horizon Club was warm and professional. They went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect - all the arrangements they made for us were spot-on. And I haven’t even gotten to the meals offered by the Horizon Club - all included in the room stay. The breakfasts had everything you could dream of. Every day after a long day of touristing we looked forward to coming back to the lounge for some drinks and snacks (up to a full afternoon tea service if we wanted). We utilized the lounge only once for pre-dinner drinks but they offer that with some light bites and are open to 10pm as well. The room itself was fantastic. Spacious for Tokyo standards, and everything was thoughtfully arranged. We especially loved the huge rain shower and tub. The rooms were very quiet and we didn’t hear noise from the outside or hallways. The location of the hotel is perfect - right next to Tokyo Station - easy for getting in and around Tokyo. Even though we didn’t observe many kids at the hotel, the staff was exceedingly kind towards my two young sons (ages 5 Ana 7). Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Shangri-La hotel and would heartily recommend it to all my family and friends.

From the moment you enter the experience is second to none. Service is impeccable. Breakfast in the main dining room was exceptional. The rooms beautifully designed and well appointed. The bathrooms was gorgeous with top amenities. You will not be disappointed. I’ve also stayed at four seasons, although rooms there are slightly larger, this hotel is in a superior location with incredible views, especially during cherry blossom season.

We have just visited Shangri-La Tokyo and it has been an excellent experience. I decided to wait until I tried another hotel for the other half of our stay to decided whether this was normal service or extraordinary but we realized that the staff there were extra kind and above average. The hotel is quite and clean and classy it’s not noisy not touristic it was a real pleasure to stay there! Will definitely go back if we’re in Tokyo

Visiting Tokyo and staying at the hotel. Very deluxe hotel with a very nice rooms.Really exceptional service and very polite staff. Reception need some improvement as I was waiting more than 10’ for checking and the same for the checkout. It seems a very busy area.Breakfast can further improve to a higher standard and selection.

We loved out stay at the Shangri-La. From the moment we arrived until we left we were treated with exceptional service. The suite was beautiful, modern but comfortable, with great amenities and details such as automatic shades, bath salts refilled,Nespresso machine, comfortable pajamas and robes. We made use of the club room that came with our suite, where we had high tea and cocktails on different days. The morning breakfast was really good, with lots of choices and an attentive staff. All the employees, whether at the front desk or by the entrance, where professional and on top of things. In other words we loved our stay and would chose to go back.
user_name:
Wanna-Vaycay
New York City, New York

review_body: After a recent stay, this has become my new favourite Tokyo hotel! The Andaz is probably still more stylish and has a few more clever details, but the Shang's location next to Tokyo Station is perfect for all forms of transportation links in this megalopolis. The Horizon Club rooms with access to the Horizon Lounge are well worth the extra cost, especially for conducting business meetings. My room on the 37th floor (same level as the lounge) was a decent size, well equipped (but more USB ports please) with detailed attention to the execution of all functions/features. I wish more mid-high end hotels would follow the Shang with installing the retractable line in the bathroom for drying workout clothes. The staff offered impeccable level of service, especially in the lounge. Overall, the perfect Tokyo hotel for business and pleasure.

Me, my husband and son visited Tokyo in Feb 18 for a business trip, we were attending an exhibition in makuhari so we stayed in that area for business purposes for 4 nights, then we have decided to take 3 days of leisure and we moved down town to the Shangri-La by the Tokyo station, we have booked a horizon club room, we were treated like VIPs from the moment our car reached the hotel, everyone was super nice and spoke English something we didn’t have in the previous hotel, we’ve been escorted to the lounge welcomed by wet towels and champagne and canapés and offered a private check in while chilling on the comfy sofa and sipping on our drinks. The room was simply stunning, super clean, neat and full of goodies and amenities. I have to say one of my favorites, if not favorite modern hotel that I have ever been to.

Didn't love the location. It is situated on high floors of a large building. The rooms were amazing however. Service was okay... nothing to write home about. They do have a Michelin rated restaurant within the hotel. Eating there was a great experience.

We arrived on On a cold wet miserable day and escaping the hustle and bustle of Tokyo is the feeling I had entering the Shangri-la's ground floor entrance situated almost on top of Tokyo's Train station. Wikipedia describes Shangri-la as a fictional place described in the 1933 novel Lost Horizon by British author James Hilton. Hilton describes Shangri-La as a mystical, harmonious valley, gently guided from a lamasery, enclosed in the western end of the Kunlun Mountains. Shangri-La has become synonymous with any earthly paradise, and particularly a mythical Himalayan utopia – a permanently happy land.isolated from the outside world.The first contact was the beginning of our permanent happy land and the difference to other gorgeous Hotels was the exceptional friendliness and professionalism of all the staff we met on our 4night stay I take my hat of to Management for this achievement.We where in a Horizon club room a must if you want to experience this place in its fullest.As fare as rooms cleanliness amenities bed quality furniture interior decoration minibar bathroom toilet gym pool wellness centre spa lift waiting time and the list goes on I could not find a fault , ohh the food deserves Gold plates if they don't have some already it was the best I have had but they take pride on the whole organic local and the best of the best ingredient thing and you notice it .Maybe this fictional place Shangri-la really exists as I think I found it in this Hotel.The only downside is once you arrived you don't want to leave so if you are in Tokyo and want to explore this exiting City to its max then go to a capsule hotel.If you are a connoisseur and want to experience Tokyo first class the seriously consider the Shangri-la.

This was my second time staying and was here for 5 nights. Outstanding stay. Huge rooms, well maintained and well stocked [and frankly, BTW, the prices they charge for the minis of some stuff in the mini bar are very fair...almost too fair... ;-)]. We had a king room with an extra bed for our child. She loved the pool. I was fortunate to be able to stay again for a much longer stay.Now, we happened to be there on the weekend when locals really really love to enjoy the afternoon tea - apparently very popular and you must book in advance - I would hope that a hotel guest is accommodated if they don't manage to know this - but we did not have to test this theory. There was also a wedding.Now, normally I find locals to be generally respectful but perhaps people with money globally fall into a entitled state of mind from time to time. So we returned to our room and since the hotel was very busy, afternoon tea goers coming and going and wedding, and our room was not completed by house keeping. What to do? I ask the front desk if there is any place to sit. Other than the lobby, not really given the wedding so basically there is no place for us to sit and wait for the room to be cleaned other than the lobby - which is very very full of people coming and going as part of the afternoon tea. Which would be fine, but as I turn around there is some person (I assume local) "man" spreading on one of the benches in the lobby and with his bag on the same also on what could accommodate 3 perhaps 4 people was being enjoyed by one.I was not impressed and was rather jerky to the front desk which I later apologized for. I sat down anyway and then had my daughter sit to the dismay of the man spreader.It was only a minute or two later than we were taken to the horizon lounge to wait until our room was ready. This kind of response is why they are a five star property along with the fact that I swear the moment we left our room for the remainder of the stay they must have immediately sent house keeping to make sure our room was always clean before we returned. No request was too much and staff was great the whole time and it was nice to be recognized even thought I am a rather unimportant person. Would stay again in a second. Love the area around Tokyo station.
user_name:
KJPaperpusher
New York City, New York

review_body: Firstly, bags arrive in the room as we enter the room, that is amazing.Next, room is spacious and super clean, superb room.Breakfast was great and fast, good range of buffet.Concierge team was superb, made sure all reservations at restaurant and shinkansen train was taken care of. Very polite staff and always with a smile.Will always be one of my favourite hotels, no complaints.BTW, thanks for the upgrade to exec suite, wife and I appreciate it very much.Beautiful hotel and highly recommend to everyone without second thought.

I loved this hotel, my favorite throughout all of Japan including the Four Seasons. Excellent service Very spacious, well appointed, stylish rooms Beautiful bar/lounge overlooking the city Good gym and lovely pool area with a great Jacuzzi and Steam room Brilliant location, next door to Tokyo station which is a good base for getting around the city and Osaka/Kyoto. My only recommendation for improvement would be the concierge, however, I experience this throughout Japan. Improve knowledge of restaurants and bars. Overall, a brilliant stay and highly recommended hotel. The only place I would stay if I returned to Tokyo.

Our first time in Japan and we chose the Shangri-La to look after us and that is exactly what they did! We were met at the airport by an English speaking driver in an immaculate car who whisked us to the hotel whilst answering all our questions about Tokyo. We had booked an Imperial Gardens View room but the gardens are some distance away and so the view is basically the city, not worth the extra money in my opinion. However the room itself was extremely well appointed with everything we needed. The shower and bath were together in a wet room arrangement and there were towels and bath products aplenty. Housekeeping serviced the room immaculately in the morning and at turndown. Breakfast is taken in their main restaurant. It was a bit hit and miss as staff did not seem to be assigned to particular tables which lead to a long wait to have an order taken and on a couple of occasions a duplication of orders arriving at the table. There is a cooked offer as well as a buffet - warning the pastries are to die for!The concierge organised restaurant bookings and a day trip to Kyoto on the Shinkansen, they even walk you right to platform at the main station which is just next door. We ate once in the hotel which was a bit of a farce, feeling a little under the weather I wanted something simple and so ordered steak with salad and a baked potato with sour cream (at least that is what the men offered) when it came it was a steak with a tiny new potato, a big quenelle of sour cream and a few vegetables. After some discussion the staff reluctantly took it off the bill.The small gym and infinity style pool hit the spot and there is a spa where I had a fantastic pedicure, the information in the room gives the impression that this service is not available and implies that there are limited spa treatments on offer so if you want something different it is worth asking. The hotel is right next door to a big department store and the Tokyo metro that will take you wherever you want to go in the city is a short walk away as are the Imperial Gardens. It was great introduction to Japan and we will be back!

Prem. King Suite, Perfect. Spa, total zen experience. Nadaman, chefs special was exactly that, special. Sushi was perfect. Martinis while looking at the breath taking views of the city, relaxing. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Im writing from the lobby if the shangri la tokyo hotel. I stayed here with my family for a spring break trip in march for 4 nights. We had a wonderful stay. I will try to be detailed with my review.Booking:My advice is to book with virtuoso. This gives you free breakfast/upgrade/ late check out.Arrival:We took the narita express from NRT. The hotel sent a bellman to meet us at the platform and escort us to the hotel and eventually straight up to the lounge. This was so welcome after a long flight with a bunch of tired kids. The tokyo station is a huge train station and im sure we could have been lost in there for awhile if we were on our own. Upon arrival at the lounge, we were offered drinks, checked in and given our room keys. Rooms: We had connecting horizon club rooms as we had a family of 5. We were also accomodated with a rollaway in the 2nd room. This gave us plenty of room. Bathrooms were huge and had nice showers. The rooms also had every type of amenity you could ask for including kimonos and pajamas(never seen before).Meals: We had the option of eating breakfast in the lounge or in the restaurant as i had booked through virtuoso. We chose to eat in the picatere? Restaurant as they had a bigger spread. Food was excellent. I reccomend the Japanese egg dishes. We also used our virtuoso credit for dinner in the lobby lounge and kids were able to eat burgers while i enjoyed indonesian food.Location: centrally located just next to Tokyo station. I didnt realize how great the location was untill after i got there.Concierge:They truly went above and beyond. They helped us book our shinkansen tickets to tokyo. They assisted us with dinner reservations and most importantly accomodated us when we needed to extend our stay in the same room. We had booked last minute and they had informed us that for the last night we may need to switch rooms as our particular rooms were already booked by another guest. We were not looling forward to this but thankfully they were able to accomodate us. Much appreciated.Housekeeping: rooms were kept spotless. In addition we did use the laundry services twice. They were always punctual.Gym: small but had great equipment and locker room. Was kind of full. I saw a pool.Value for money: good value when compared to other 5 star hotels in the area. Especially if u are lucky enough to get an upgrade.Overall:The small things really matter. Everyone always seemed to know my name and was always smiling. I could have stayed at any hotel i wanted to. I had initially planned to stay at aman but took a chance with shangri la as it ranks number 1 on TA, had great reviews, had connecting rooms and was significantly cheaper. I was not disappointed withy choice. I recommend shangri la Tokyo without reaervation. Lives up to the hype.The only negative thing that i can think of us that this hotel seemed to be full of people staying for buisness and we were out of place with our kids.

After 2 weeks of traveling around Japan we were so happy to finish up in this wonderful hotel which is just a stones throw from the station and not nearly as hard to find as some people have said in other reviews.To check in you’re whisked up to the 28th floor and it was there that we had our afternoon tea which was simply wonderful. It was all based on strawberries as they are just coming into season (little tip for the hotel though, as 2 English people we know scones and to serve 6 albeit small ones with one tiny teaspoon of clotted cream is not going to work. We asked for more on 4 occasions.)After that we were shown to our beautiful room with views out over the imperial gardens. The HUGE bed was extremely comfortable and the room generally had all the amenities you would expect. The pool and fitness room are brilliant and I would recommend you give them a go, especially as the views of the sun setting are gorgeous.We had room service a couple of times as we just wanted to relax and the food was excellent.All in all a wonderful couple of nights to finish off an unforgettable 2 weeks in this stunning country.

It's been 3 years since I was last at this fabulous hotel and it is just as beautiful as ever! I'm very impressed at how well maintained this property is, the carpet is as if new as is the furniture in lobby, restaurants and rooms.Located just next to Tokyo station it is the perfect location for sight seeing as you can within minutes be at the train station heading in any direction you like. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby.Rooms are spacious with aircon that actually works to the temperature you select! Extremely comfortable bed, fine linen, fluffy pillows. Excellent insulation - so quiet, could not hear anyone or anything - slept so peacefully! Bath and shower is enclosed in glass in case you need a view - great water pressure and large rain shower. The maid service was excellent - room was meticulously clean.Buffet breakfast is delicious - more than enough choices and hot items such as eggs benedict etc are ordered from an extensive menu. Restaurant pays special attention to those who are gluten intolerant, with choice of breads and dishes.For those who need to have a cigarette they have a special room on level 27 so you don't need to stand out on the street or if after 7.00pm there is a smoking section in the lobby lounge.Room service was excellent - high quality, well priced and good choices.This hotel has catered well for those with limited mobility - lifts of course and ramps for those who cannot negotiate one or two stairs. Those of us with one good knee have no issues here.To me, what sets this hotel apart is the service! Beyond comparison. If you are stuck at the train station and can't figure out how to get to the hotel, call them and they send someone to collect you. No request was too difficult and all staff are extremely courteous, knowledgeable and helpful. The staff treat any request as if it is a delight for them to serve you. I'd like to specially mention the young bell hop from Brisbane (am sorry to say I cannot recall her name) - her bright smile and friendliness made each day bright and I went off to work cheerful and optimistic, despite the sudden cold snap and snow! This hotel is well worth every penny and the only choice when in Tokyo!

I am still in awe of my trip to Japan. The shangri-la hotel is amazing. Every single detail is perfect. Every staff member amazing. The position is incredible to get to and from airport. Even though it was just down the lift and walk to the bus the ever helpful and lovely Soyeon Song escorted me. It is these extra little things that stay with you. If you can stay here please do. Nothing will disappoint!

I sadly left the Shangri-La Tokyo Station after 6 fantastic nights. I have had the pleasure of staying there for a few nights every year, for the last 4 years and I must say it continues to be the best hotel experience in the world. The Horizon Club.....Absolutely book a Horizon Club room. The service is unparalleled. Suyeon Song is a godsend!! She remembered me by name and was a welcome face everyday. Not to mention took care of any special request with ease! After a long flight from the US, my son and I were greeted by Hideko Yamanaka like we were family. A special thanks to Yumi for personally greeting us and making sure that the pillow I left behind was happily waiting for me on the bed when we returned from Fukouka. Suyeon thankfully stored our bags while we made the trip to Fukouka and received my DHL package. Tea in the afternoon and cocktail our at night are not to be missed. By far, the best variety of hors d'oeuvres served at any executive lounge. They only seem to get better, with the smiling faces bringing offerings to your table. Awesome glassware and big ice cubes made cocktails even better!!The room........We had a garden view room for the first 3 nights and Suyeon graciously accommodated my request for a city view for the last 3 nights when we returned. The bathroom is amazing with a rain shower and soaking tub. I should mention the Bulgari products, first class. When we arrived there was a hand written note from Yumi welcoming us back. Make sure you listen to the CD thats in the room. I unfortunately didn't get the name, but it provided a great soundtrack for our time.Breakfast.....The spread in Placere is unreal. Fresh juices, mind blowing pastry, detox water(nice touch) and a ever changing array of choices made it impossible to avoid. The eggs benedict menu is fantastic!! I typically don't eat breakfast, but it became my favorite meal of the day in Tokyo. Kudos to the chef. Mako(didn't get her last name) is a stand out, welcoming us every morning. Unfortunately she wasn't working the day I departed as I wanted to compliment her on her amazing service. there was a german waitress(missed her name) who stood in wonderfully. The manager of the restaurant greeted me by name and shook my hand every morning. Traveling during Tet, the restaurant was extremely busy on a Saturday morning and we were forced to eat in the lobby dining room. Chinese tourists were as rude as can be, but he handled them with style and grace. He also apologized the next day for not being able to accommodate us the day before.Location.....The most convenient hotel upon arriving from both the airport or Shinkasen. It's walking distance to Ginza for shopping and Tokyo Station is a so fun to explore!The brand....I'm staying at the Shangri-la Bangkok in the next few days a look forward to finishing up my travels at the best brand in the hotel industry.Keep up the great work and can't wait to return!

We have recently returned from a five night stay at the Shangri-La Hotel, Tokyo. Our visit was centered around my husband's participation in the Tokyo Marathon. We started communicating with the Concierge staff several months in advance as there were a number of requests we had to accommodate dietary requests. No request was too challenging for the staff at this hotel. They went above and beyond expectations to meet each and every need we had. Mika Kobayashi, Takayuki Yoshioka, Hiroko Kamata, Hideko Yamanaka, Miki Saito, Ami Akioka and several others on staff played an integral role in supporting the road to Marathon success. My husband had an amazing run and we know that staying at the Shangri-La contributed to his success. Our room was spacious, well appointed and had a beautiful view of the city. Restaurants in the hotel, we dined at Piacere for dinner and Nadaman for lunch, were excellent. The Shangri-La is an awesome hotel with a spectacular team that will do everything to meet your needs!

My favorite hotel in Tokyo. Spacious rooms with a modern touch without giving up the luxury feel. Great views. Breakfast is excellent and you can order a main alongside the big buffet. Right next to Tokyo station and the Otemachi financial district.

Our first stay at the Shangri-La Tokyo was in June 2017. We chose it because it was close to Tokyo Station and an easy trip from Haneda. In some respects it was a mistake! Now, no other hotel comes close to matching the service and stay experience of the Shangri-La. Since that first stay we have been back to Japan twice more and stayed at the Shangri-La - most recently last week.The hotel rooms are the best equipped I have ever stayed in.
