There is a USB port next to your bed, all the business equipment you could want and the toiletries and bathroom set up is beyond perfect - also for women, the hairdryer is not some horrible underpowered thing - these ones work!Then there is the service. We have opted for rooms on the Horizon floors and the Lounge is superb. Excellent offerings at breakfast and the ambience at the cocktail hour is lovely. The staff are welcoming and extremely helpful. I cannot fault the Shangri-La.

Hotel staff were friendly and professional. Our Deluxe room with a view of the Imperial Garden was luxurious and spacious. Hotel concierge was very helpful in making a few dinner reservations for us prior to arrival, much appreciated. Our only complaint was the tedious walk to & from Tokyo Station, precisely, the time it actually took to reach the platform of your desired metro line inside the Tokyo Station. It’s a pain because the Station is such a HUGE maze. Google Maps says the hotel is 5 mins walk away, it is NOT, maybe true if you are a local and know the shortcut. We took the Narita Express and it took us at least 30 mins to get from the platform to the hotel. We regretted not taking the hotel’s complimentary pickup service from Narita Express train platform. On departure day we requested for an “escort” to the train platform, and it still took a good 20 mins to get there. Hindsight, it would be much easier to use the Airport Limousine Bus which stops close by.

We booked this hotel for one quick night after we flew into Tokyo form the states and couldn't have been happier. We used their pickup service from Tokyo station, and it was amazing to have our train door open with them standing there waiting for us. This was our first time in Japan and what a welcome and a way to help us calm our nerves over the train system! The service at this absolutely stunning hotel was top notch, views of the city were over the top, and our room was pure luxury. They catered to our ever needs and treated us like royalty. We loved the location! Right next door to Tokyo station, and we woke up early with jet lag for a gorgeous sunrise run around the Imperial Gardens (also next door). After our run, they were waiting in the hotel entrance with cold waters and greeted us back by name- super classy and made us feel special. (how, I still don't know because we didn't tell anyone we were headed for a run and don't remember seeing anyone) This hotel exceeded my five star expectations for sure!

Conveniently located next to Tokyo station , staying at the club level which has great service at the club and breakfast choice is excellent.Staffs at the club are very helpful and friendly , room size is perfect with good view of Tokyo.

Stayed here after a weekend at the Grand Hyatt. Smart move since both in different locations and was great to get a feel for Tokyo. From Manhattan and Tokyo most be 10 times bigger. Shangri-La is very nice, we had a room over looking Tokyo station and big. Breakfast was included and very good. Staff super helpful and polite. Bar is only open at night, tried to get a drink at tea time, but only tea:) So went to Tokyo station which has it all. Also near great shopping, Palace, very good location.Not as big or offers the food options as Grand Hyatt, but enough outside to be fine. Did try the main restuartant Nadaman I believe it is spelled. coming from NYC big foodies and it disappointed for a $400+ meail for only 2!! But great stay, would highly recommend. Enjoy!
user_name:
corinc178
New York City, New York

review_body: You won’t be disappointed here. Super comfortable beds, very spacious rooms, attentive staff and good location. Five star in every way. The lobby is on the 28th floor, and rooms go higher, so imagine what kind of views you get of the city so high up.

I have nothing negative to say about this hotel - it is in a great location (easy walking distance to Tokyo Station) the staff were polite and helpful, the rooms were spacious, clean and so comfortable. We had an amazing view, and thanks to the tip from the housekeeper at 8:30pm on a clear night you can see the fireworks at Disneyland (much to my children's delight!) And the sunrise in the morning was also a delight to watch. The beds are huge so sleep quality was sensational. It really did tick every box.

I travel to Japan once or twice a year. I am usually loyal to a different hotel. But after my last trip, I will never stay anywhere other than the Shangri-La. Throughout our trip, we had a lovely stay at the Shangri-La, but it was the way they helped during an emergency on our last day that I will forever be grateful. Around noon on our last day, I was running around getting present for people back home. Coming out of the Tokyo subway station, I tripped on the stairs, cut my forehead open very badly, was bleeding all over and was worried I had broken my nose. Luckily, the Shangri-La is directly above Tokyo Station and two subway workers insisted on walking me back to the hotel. Within 10 minutes of arriving back in my room, the head of guest relations, Mr. Atsushi, knocked on my door and said he heard what had happened and asked if he could help. It was now 1pm and our flight back to the United States was at 7pm that night. I had gotten my American doctor on the phone and she said I urgently needed to have my forehead stitched up before I flew back.Mr. Atsushi immediately got on the phone, calling doctors, plastic surgeons, hospitals--really anything he could thing off to help. Meanwhile, I was lying down with icepacks on my face barely able to do anything. Somehow, unbelievably, after about 45 minutes on the phone, saying god knows what to god knows how many people, Mr. Atsushi turned to me and said, "Ok, I have convinced them. Let's go." He had somehow convinced the doctors at Tokyo University Hospital to perform surgery on me within the hour. Mr. Atsushi immediately guided me down to a taxi, drove with me to the hospital, guided me to the correct department, came with me into surgery to translate, stayed throughout and brought me back to the Shangri-La all before 3pm. It was truly unbelievable. Despite a horrible accident at noon, thanks to the wonderful people at the Shnagri-La, I was still able to make my evening flight back to Los Angeles.I travel extensively throughout the world and I can honestly say I have never experienced such an attentive, kind, concerned, and committed staff as I did at the Shangri-La, Tokyo. Truly, never write hotel reviews. In fact, this is my very first review because I feel that strongly about the Shangri-La. I have forever become loyal Shangri-La. Thank you to the whole team(especially Mr. Atsushi) for their dedication, true hospitality and concern for their guests. I have never seen anything like it.

The short review would simply say how delightful our stay was. From the in-room check-in, to the whole service in general, everything and everyone was so attentive, full of details, recognition, simplicity and friendliness. This is a true luxury experience with a very solid hard product (fabulous deluxe rooms with distinctive interior design, very functional and full of amenities) that brings you on an exotic journey, with really lovely facilities such as the Chi spa and its fabulous treatments, the Nadaman restaurant for a really gorgeous dinner experience or the pool and its amazing views. The whole property is full of charm, mixing traditional and contemporary features just with the right balance that makes Japan unique. It is one of the best service we have enjoyed in Tokyo, and perhaps in the world. We felt really welcomed, well looked after and never, ever we felt this kind of overhyped/pretention that some luxury properties sadly have more and more. Here everything is simply delicate and well thought. It is five stars all the way and my only advice to the staff would be to carry on this road and continue to innovate: they are just on track to perfection!

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is right next to the Tokyo train station which is really convenient and is within 20 minute walking distance to Ginza. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We loved our room and the view was fantastic. The beds were comfortable and we asked for firm pillows which were perfect. We had a minor issue with the rainfall shower head which was quickly fixed. Service was very fast and helpful. The concierge did a pretty good job helping us figure out how to get from place to place, especially as Tokyo's train system can be very confusing. They were very nice in helping us with reservations and confirming for us. A free service that we were so grateful for, was being escorted to the train the morning we were leaving for the airport. Like I said, it is really easy to get turned around in the train stations so a staff member walked us from the hotel all of the way down to the train platform. It was very helpful and they offered the service for free. They also helped us arrange train tickets, as we've had issues in the past of not getting tickets until the morning of, and the booth to buy tickets was not opened yet. So the hotel was great with that too. The gym equipment was top notch. It was definitely the best equipment I've seen in a hotel so far in my travels. The pool was beautiful and really great as well. My husband usually stays somewhere else when he travels to Tokyo for business, but said he wants to start staying there now. We will definitely come back to this hotel.

We stayed there for 10 days during holidays, it is next Tokyo station. It is easy yo get anywhere. It does take a bit of walk to the express train stop to airport from the hotel. But hotel offers escort service to pick and take you to the train stop from the hotel. We used both. It was very much appreciated. The room is big, and well stocked. The service is first rated. The breakfast is excellent. I can't really think about any bad experiences, I will go back again.
user_name:
ShanghaiKevin78
New York City, New York

review_body: My partner and I have been lucky enough to stay at some amazing hotels around the world and have to say this was one of the best experiences we have ever had. We recently enjoyed three nights at the Shangri-La Tokyo (19/12-23-12) and were delighted with this amazing hotel.Firstly its a reasonably close walk from Tokyo station. Handy after a long flight from Melbourne to get the N'EX to Tokyo station. The hotel is luxury +++ and has fabulous decor. We had a beautiful room on the 35th floor with an amazing view of Tokyo. The room was beautiful and the room amenities and small details for the guest were so impressive. I think the aspect that makes the hotel so outstanding is the staff and the service they deliver which was personal, warm and genuine. You can have good hotel but without good service and staff its nothing. Shangri-La Tokyo has the whole package and does it beautifully. The service at check-in was efficient and friendly.The concierge (I wish I could remember the gentleman's name...my apologies!) was so helpful, and so polished and knowledgeable. Zacky the Breakfast manager (such a gentleman) was a friendly face each morning when going for the hotels amazing breakfast. But the most outstanding of all was Erina (Guest service supervisor) who would light up our day when we saw her. She was always to helpful, attentive and would remember what we had planned to do for the day and enquire how we went. She is a delight and such an asset to your hotel. I cannot wait to return!

Rooms are absolutely five star level. Same is the price!! The beds are very good. The breakfast offers some fancy sweet gimmicks but lacks in my opinion some cold cuts like ham or salami. Well, complaining of a high-level. The only two negative points leading to “very good” but not “exceptional” rating is the toilet and the reception. The toilet has a non-through visible wall made off silky glass but you can still see the shadow of the person sitting inside. Here I lack some privacy. The reception was very bad and slow. The room allocations were sent by mail very well in advance but nothing was prepared. It took me more than 10 minutes to get four rooms. Here is a lot of room for improvement.

We are consistently impressed by the Shangri-La Hotels we have stayed in, and the Tokyo Shangri-La hotel went above and beyond our (pretty high) expectations. It was the little things that made our stay here extra special. From the friendly greeting agent who met us as we disembarked the Shinkansen, to the welcome surprise of two small plush bears for our children (which they then snuggled with every evening since then), to the completely edible cake train that was there to welcome us, and the unparalleled service and attention that the concierge and staff provided, we were completely "wowed" by our time there and will definitely stay there again if/when we return to Tokyo. On top of it all, the location is excellent with extremely easy access for all travel and exploration needs.

The service at Island Shangri-la Tokyo was outstanding. My family arrived at Tokyo train station and Shangri-la staff was waiting for us at the train platform to assist my family to take our luggage to the hotel. The staff also provided assistance in booking the dinner reservations for my family. Thank you for providing excellent service.

We stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel in Tokyo on our last night in Tokyo. We had previously spent a few nights at the Palace Hotel (which I have previously reviewed and is still exceptional), but wanted to try another hotel during our stay.The Shangri-La Hotel is located very near Tokyo station (in the Marunouchi area) - the entrance is not very conspicuous and you have to take the elevator to the lobby. The hotel decor is quite gilded and shiny (i.e. not very subtle) but it has a nice bar in the lobby-area with views over the city. The check-in process was smooth and we were shown to our room which overlooked Tokyo station. The room was quite spacious with a big bathroom. We also tried the spa/fitness center during our stay - they have a large indoor pool (which was great for laps) as well as a fully-equipped gym.The breakfast at the hotel was served at the Piacere restaurant which was good (with a wide variety). Overall, a very nice hotel although definitely more in the "bustling" area of Tokyo.

My spouse and I stayed at the Shangri-La for 3 nights over the Christmas season. Arriving by train at the Tokyo station, we were engulfed in activity and traffic. Luckily, we had found out which exit to find upon leaving the train station, and managed to exit the Tokyo station correctly, the Shangri-La is literally next to the train station.A discreet main entrance at the ground floor brought us into a beautiful reception area, where we were greeted warmly and our bags were taken care of, and we were whisked to the 28th floor, where their main reception is. First impressions the Shangri-La is a grand hotel, elegant and luxurious, yet incredibly discreet. It is not a modern hotel, best of all it was not teeming with activity, with people hovering around the lobby at any given time of the day. Check in was very quick and efficient, we were greeted warmly by name, and within minutes we were shown to our corner room. The room is incredibly generous in size for a Tokyo hotel, upon entry, the most beautiful expansive views of Tokyo were before us. Being the corner room, at the end of the corridor, it was also very quiet. Very large king size, looked like 2 queen size beds put together, and incredibly comfortable, we slept so well during our stay. Long comfortable chaise lounge lined the windows. A selection of cold drinks, sparkling mineral water, selection of teas and teapots, Nespresso machine and water kettle, and a welcome fruit basket were awaiting us. Generous amount of bottled water which were replenished everyday.Bathroom was equally spacious, toiletries were plentiful. Another drawer pulled out to provide any other additional amenity you could possibly need. Large shower cubicle with a delightful rain shower, and bath tub. Separate toilet cubicle with the wonderful Japanese washlet. Toilet was, needless to say, sparkling clean.Wardrobes are generous, they even provided a yoga mat, ironing board and iron. Both types of robes were provided, as were cotton pajamas for the night, in various sizes. Lovely fluffy slippers that were thoughtfully changed every other day.We left the room shortly after check in for dinner, and came back to it all turned down for the evening.Our room included complimentary breakfast, which we indulged in at the hotel's restaurant Piacere. The spread fairly boggles the mind. In addition to a vast buffet spread, a selection can also be ordered from the menu. My only criticism would be that they seem to be short of staff, empty plates littered tabletops and drinks orders took a while to be fulfilled. Kitchen also seem to be struggling with refilling juices so jugs went empty.Locationwise, this hotel is really convenient. With Tokyo station next door, you have almost every subway line at your service, without having to change trains anywhere. It is also walkable to Ginza.Special mention must be made to concierge service. Quite simply put, they are amazing. Some of the hardest seats to book in Tokyo at any time of the year, and during a busy period like Christmas, and they managed to secure seats for us. Of course, we also contacted concierge way before our trip, in order to give them ample time. Upon check in, all restaurant reservations were printed, maps given in color, routes charted, and even photos of the front of the building were provided. Absolutely stellar and for that I cannot commend them enough.All in all, it was an incredibly pleasant stay. This is one hotel I would not hesitate to return to.

Perfect stay. Top notch service and beautiful room. Next door to Tokyo station so very convenient. Close to the imperial palace if you’re sightseeing and large shopping malls nearby. The Airport Limousine bus direct to Haneda and Narita leaves from the building next door and the concierge escort your luggage across there so very convenient. Not in the heart of Tokyo nightlife though

Impress so clean beautiful ambient fresh flowers everywhere you go . Excellent in service very helpful, you won't feel lost when you need them to guide you somewhere .. perfect 10 this is my third time visited Japan the city the hotels never disappointed me The room was good size Bed was beautiful to sleep in Beautiful bathroom great quality , separate toilet with door , nice furnishing We used the bath tub every night with bath salt they given us so beautiful feel like home ! Location is perfect close to shopping and right next to Tokyo station walking distance like few minutes Close to Ginza Nice breakfast and bars, we are very happy to stay there again Highly recommend

First stay in a Shangri-La and it exceeded my expectations. Stayed in a Horizon Room Twin room just after New Year and it had amazing views of Tokyo, the station and even Fuji. The room is bigger than it looks on the web and has up to date fittings including USB charge points, HDMI socket at the desk that links into the TV and a lovely bathroom.Finally the beds have to be the best I have ever slept in.Will be back for a longer stay later this year.

Although we are Shangri La Golden Circle members, this was not our regular hotel in Tokyo. We stayed here with our two children upon a friend’s recommendation and we were not disappointed. The hotel is very conveniently located, just steps away from the Tokyo station. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. What really made this hotel was the service. The staff were so amazingly friendly and helpful. We were given the warmest welcome as soon as we arrived. Even the check in procedure was most enjoyable. We were led to the lounge area and were given drinks and snacks as the staff checked us in. The children received a welcome gift. The staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable. They looked up shops and restaurants that we wanted to visit, gave us recommendations and offered to make reservations. Will definitely be returning to this hotel again.

Beautiful hotel with amazing views. The hotel staff were all very attentive and wonderful. I was pleasantly surprised when they had one of the hotel staff escort us directly to the train that took us to the airport on our last day which was a good 15 minute walk. It would've probably taken us double the time if we had to figure it ourselves.

Stayed 2Ns in the Deluxe room and overall it is a great place to stay. Is the little things and level of finesse in the service that sets a 5* hotel apart from a regular hotel. And staying here is definitely a delightful 5* experience, and I'll be back during my next Tokyo trip.Likes- Impeccable house keeping and the cheerful housekeepers are a joy to chat with during the evening turn down- Very nice bathroom- Room look small from the photos on the official site, but turns out to be much bigger - Extremely efficient concierge who speaks excellent English- Contour pillow is available on requestThe stay would have been 10/10 if the lady I encountered during check-in was less brusque in her manner and speech. She looked like the grumpy cashier who was about to close her till but had to entertain a customer who managed to make it to the line at the very last minute. When everything is so delightful, the encounter with her stuck out like a sore thumb in my memory. I checked in on the 17 Dec late afternoon and she's manning the check in station on the extreme left (if you are facing the check-in desk). It would be worthy for management to remind her again of her mannerism.

I stayed here as I was organising an important event. Service from Events Executive, Megumi Shibata, exceeds my expectation. Megumi and her colleagues were very helpful in ensuring that my shipments and event arrangements are all well taken care of even before my arrival in Tokyo. She also kindly offered to concoct a special cocktail drink for our event that match the corporate colour scheme and was flexible enough to offer a refund if we decide to reject the drink if we don't like it (which is a few hours before the event!). We proceed to order 50 of those drinks in the end since it really tasted good. We were shorthanded during the event, but Megumi and colleagues were really nice to offer help with welcoming guests.I had booked a Deluxe room which is huge, spacious and boasts the Tokyo skyline view. Nice interior too. There's a complimentary snack (Agemochi Fried Rice Cake) provided which taste really good. Breakfast is great. A menu is available if you would like to place a set order, otherwise you can also opt for the Buffet spread. This hotel is conveniently located next to Tokyo Station which has restaurants at the basement.

This was our third trip to Tokyo and we chose to stay in the Shangri-la in the Horizon Club Deluxe room. The hotel itself is modern and tastefully decorated with a lot of chandeliers. Our room was large by Tokyo standards and had a very good view of the city skyline and Tokyo Skytree. The bathroom had a separate bath and shower stand together with Bvlgari amenities. Breakfast was excellent and you are thoroughly pampered in the Club lounge with a wide variety of drinks and snacks almost throughout the day.But what made this the best hotel for us was the level of service right from the doorman who greets you at the hotel entrance to the check in staff and especially the Concierge. They made all reservations for us for the whole duration of our trip and their responses were timely.We will definitely return again.

We stayed with them for several days in a deluxe king room. The room was ultra-modern, impeccably clean, comfortable despite its immense size, and had a spectacular view of the city. Since we were doing tourism we depended on the hotel for a lot of services ranging from laundry, borrowing stuff, sending out mail, and particularly getting an escort to the Tokyo train terminal. The guy was great as he walked us out in blistering cold to navigate the labyrinthine station to get us to our inter-city train. That was completely unexpected, as was their ability to get us exactly the train tickets we needed before hand.If you're going through Tokyo for a few days, this is a great place to stay. It's centrally located and you can get to a lot of places by walking, and the train station is next to it to get you everywhere else. We went back through Tokyo later on our vacation and stayed at a different high end hotel that lacked the level of service this one provided.
user_name:
TheTemplar_1314
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Shangri-la is located right next to Tokyo Station and the extensive underground shopping and dining precinct. There is no direct connection unfortunately, but one is only exposed to the elements for a short while.Besides Tokyo Station the Otemachi and Nihombashi Metro stations are within easy walking distance. This puts one within reach of the Ginza, Marunouchi, Tozai, Asakusa, Chiyoda and Mita lines. The Ginza Line will take a visitor to the shopping area in the Ginza (also reachable via the Marunouchi Line or walking 20-30 minutes along the Chuo-dori). In the other direction, both the Ginza and Asakusa Lines lead to Asakusa and the Nakamise-dori shopping street.There are three F&B outlets: the Lobby Lounge, Piacere and Nadaman. The Lobby Lounge serves light meals. The salmon poke salad is particularly recommended. Breakfast is in Piacere. One orders a main dish and helps oneself to the buffet; order either the Japanese or Oriental sets, the western food is not really worth it. Nadaman is supposed to be good, but when my wife and I dined there we were disappointed. The abalone was literally inedible; she couldn't even bite through it. However, there are literally dozens of other dining establishments within a short walk, so there is no need to eat in the hotel.Service is excellent. Ms Otani who checked us in was particularly helpful. Commendations to all the staff.It is possible to have luggage forwarded to other hotels in Japan, which is a great advantage. All in all, an excellent base from which to explore Tokyo and further afield.

Excellent dinner. Fabulous service. Go Go Go Go get that wagu beef. It's delicious not badly priced. 13000 yen each for a 6 course dinner with 120grams of Wagu other places other service 60 grams Money well spent.

We spent a wonderful 2 weeks in Japan ending in Tokyo for 5 days. We decided to splurge and spend the extra money for the Deluxe Club. We felt it was worth it. We enjoyed the variety of snacks and drinks available throughout the day. The breakfasts were spectacular with a mini buffet along with an extensive menu. Evenings had a mini buffet with sufficient food to substitute for dinner. Varied seating from a couches and low tables to dining tables with comfortable upholstered chairs and a variety of newspapers gave a more comfortable relaxed feeling...truly a place to lounge. A variety of candy and other snacks were available throughout the day. A favorite was freeze-dried strawberries dipped in white chocolate.The staff were friendly and attentive addressing us by name. My only criticism is the evening buffet seemed to have the same hot entree...delicious, but the same: beef or fish.

From the time of arrival to departure this hotel was a total surprise. Elegant. Top notch service. Superb location. Within two minutes walk of Tokyo train station, it cannot be beat. I stayed in a suite very high up with amazing views of the city. The gym and pool are very small but I managed to get a workout in. Spa is cute and we enjoyed a massage as well. But the room was unbelievable and could have stayed there all day. Housekeepers were so polite and always on top of things. Thank you for a great stay for the week.

One of the most perfect nights I've ever experienced anywhere in the world - from check-in to check-out, the staff was attentive and left no questions unasked to make sure my friends and I were well taken cafe of. We were greeted by name at every turn and the welcome fruits were seasonal and delicious. I look forward to staying with my family here when I'm back in January
user_name:
THLoke
New York City, New York

review_body: I have had a short trip in Tokyo and stayed at Shangri-La hotel Tokyo for three nights.I stayed at this hotel every time I visit Tokyo since five to six years ago. The only reason is the excellent or even perfect services provided by this hotel, from location of hotel, room facilities to wholehearted services from their staff. The staff are attentive, nice, polite and well-manner.I would like to say a big thank you to the Concierge Team lead by the Chief Concierge, Ms Saito as well as the Assistant Chief Concierge, Mr. Yoshioka. Their preparation work before my arrival makes my stay very smooth.I cannot think of any reason why I do not choose Shangri-La Hotel Tokyo as my hotel of stay in my future visit in Tokyo. Shangri-La Hotel Tokyo is my only choice!!!

The Peninsula is our go-to hotel when in Tokyo and we have yet to stay at one we love more, but this was a very good hotel, with friendly, smiling staff at every corner, scrupulously polite and helpful. It feels a bit more intimate than some of the other luxury hotels in the city. I'm not sure if it's really smaller, or if it just seems that way, but there is no soaring lobby or vast echoing halls. It's all wood-panneled corridors and sparkling chandeliers high above the city, and we enjoyed that. Our room on the 35th floor had a great view, all the way to the bay, the gym is excellent, and the quality of food for in-room-dining is also top-notch, though the portions are miniscule. Location is good, especially if you're taking a bullet train anywhere, as Tokyo Station is minutes away. If I were to rank the luxury hotels in this area it would be The Peninsula -> Shangri La -> Mandarin Oriental -> Four Seasons -> Palace Hotel. They're all good, but some feel just a touch more special and this one definitely ranks near the top.

Stayed here for a bit on a mixed business and leisure trip. The attention to detail was exquisite, but what really stands out was the service which is above and beyond that which is normally expected even of a luxury business hotel. they staff catered to our every need, and there were many odd requests we'd made given that we were with a 5 yr old. Loved the kiddie pack with the kid's sized room slippers and the thoughtful gift of the teddy bear.

My family and I went to stay at Shangri-La Hotel Tokyo for 3 nights in the. month of November 2017 . We decided to go for the Deluxe Room on The Horizon Club floor( the reception for the Horizon Club is on 37th Floor ) as per our last visit and to my unexpected surprise they have upgraded my sister's room to the Premiere Corner Room which was very kind and generous . My favorite hotels in Tokyo are Shangri La and The Palace but I think I much prefer the Shangri La due to their unbeatable services on all fronts as well as the super convenient location ( it's next to Daimaru department store which has a amazing food hall as well as selections of great restaurants .The room itself ( Deluxe ) is on 36th Floor and very spacious with writing desk ,huge king's bed , sofa and a great size bathroom with Bvlgari toiletries .With breathtaking view off Tokyo skyline. All the blinds ( both day and night ) are electric as well as the blind in the bathroom . All other amenities in the room are great including traveler's adaptor and a great stationary box set. We take our breakfast at the Horizon Club on 37th floor and even though I thought the choices were a little restricted ( would like to see more fresh fruits -berries as well as granolas and better selections of bakery ) the service was top notch . I got my egg white omelet every morning and they were always perfect . As a guest at The Horizon Club you get tons of benefits . They have tea with proper afternoon tea sets complete with sandwiches and assorted baked goodies as well as pre meal snacks ( although my sister did have steak with potatoes so I don't know how that is a pre meal snack .It was a full on dinner ! ) and drinks at all hours free of charge . It was worth to pay that little extra to stay on The Horizon Club . Also compliments to all the staffs there who cater to your every need and take care of all your requests efficiently and with such attention to details I was amazed . I also use then gym whenever I travel to keep my body in check and to my big surprise they have upgraded their gym. When I was here last time the gym was tiny with very few useless equipments now the gym is still the same size but they made better use of space and have added more machines and equipments . The pool is also lovely . All in all it is the only hotel I would recommend ( only 18 mins walk to Ginza ) as it's my number one choice at the moment . I had such a splendid time there and I would definitely be coming back . Ps Thanks to the lovely lady who took great care of my DHL package !

There are relatively few Shangri-La properties outside of Asia so this was our first opportunity to stay at one. We stayed at 4 hotels on this trip and this was the best one. I think what really elevated the experience was the Horizon Club, whose perks more than cover the additional cost including breakfast (in-room, in the club or at the on-site restaurant Piacere), canapes, complimentary tea/drinks, desserts, dedicated concierge. The hotel is immediately adjacent to, but detached from Tokyo station.The room is large and everything is electronically controlled. The views are amazing and if you are facing Tokyo Disney, you can watch the fireworks from the comfort of your chaise lounge. You'll also have good views of the Skytree. I think the rooms overlooking the imperial palace are more expensive, but I'd rather have a city view any day (or rather night). The surrounding Ginza area has many upscale shops and Tokyo station is a great central hub for getting to other destinations as well as to Narita airport. They will escort you to/from your trains as needed as well as pick up your tickets.When we come back to Tokyo we will definitely be staying at the Shangri La.

I stay in this hotel for a conference. This hotel is situated right at the side of Tokyo Central station, so you can go anywhere easily. The room is so luxurious and clean even it is not too big. The best one is the breakfast. So huge array of healthy food and dessert. And you can choose one menu from a la carte breakfast menu except the buffet.

I chose the Shangri-La in Tokyo because of a previous good experience with the Shangri-La Bosphorus in Istanbul. Everything was up to the standards I expected. The room and amenities were excellent, the staff attentive and friendly. I had been communicating with the Concierge staff at the hotel for several months before our arrival, to arrange restaurant reservations and tour guides. They had everything arranged before our arrival, and made our stay all the more enjoyable. I have stayed at three different Shangri-La properties around the world, and I am very pleased whenever I stay at one.

I stayed here with family last summer, and it was absolutely beautiful. Great restaurant and service as well, and the pool was incredible. I hope to stay here again someday, it was just luxurious and wonderful

I stayed in this hotel for three days. This hotel was chosen by the committee who invited me to the meeting. I have stayed in ShangriLa at Singapore and Jakarta. This ShangriLa Tokyo is much more smaller, but the service is so good. Nice lobby, friendly staff, extremely clean room inclusive the luxurious bathroom and its amenities. Even like other hotel in Tokyo the room is smaller to one in Jakarta and Singapore. The toilet is a modern one! I really like it, along with a special touch of a fresh orchid on the bathroom table. The most astonishing one is the breakfast at Piacere. A huge array of a la carte choices and healthy choices at the buffet. I also really love their cute and delicious pastries. The hotel is just in front of the Tokyo central station.. so it will be very easy to travel around from this hotel. I already plan to have another stay in this hotel in my next visit to Tokyo.

It is located next door to Tokyo Station with the lobby on the 28th floor of a tower. Like most of the Shangri-la hotels everything ( guest room, lounge, restaurants, fitness) is nice and comfortable and the staff is kind and efficient. A great address in downtown Tokyo.

What's not to love the one and only Shangri-La hotel in Japan? Like other five-star properties in Tokyo, Shang has all the ticks on the hardware list: spacious, well-appointed guest rooms, Japanese and Italian restaurants which offer mouth-watering seasonal cuisine, comprehensive facilities, etc... Yet it is the 'chi' that freely flows from the hotel entrance to the chandelier-decorated staircase at the reception and the tastefully-designed corridors that counts. It is the software – people – which makes the 'chi' so irresistible.

Located right next to Tokyo station this new hotel is Japan class all the way. The rooms are good size and the concierge is very helpful. The lobby lounge does not serve alcohol early in the morning though so if you need that early beer best to go outside. Would come back to stay here again.

The hotel is next to the train station, close to the Palace and other metro stations. It is all you can expect from a Shangri-La Hotel, friendly staff, excellent view from our room, nice pool and a small gym.

Had 2 nights stay in a Deluxe King room and what a view of Mt Fuji on a clear day from the top floor. Bedroom is well appointed with all the luxurious amenities and is immaculately clean and housekeeping service is non-intrusive and efficient. Hotel is located next to Tokyo station which is an amazing place to visit for food, shopping and people-watching! And it is walking distance to free entrance of the Imperial East Garden; beware it is closed every Mondays or Fridays and highly recommended a visit to view the cherry blossoms there. It is less crowded than the popular Ueno Park during the Hanami season.

All employees of the hotel were amazing. From check-in to concierge to restaurants, spa, gym, cleaning and maintenance. Loved our "Tokyo toilet." Totally hands free! Centrally located steps from Tokyo station. RR in from Narita and met on the platform and escorted to hotel. Great room with great view. Food also amazing. Hotel steps from station so took trains everywhere. Relatively easy. Easier than NYC. Everyone so nice and helpful. Tokyo is amazingly clean and orderly. Can't wait to go back.
user_name:
rm1955
Hastings on Hudson, New York

review_body: Beautifully ornate hotel; great service, good size room for a city that is used to tiny sized rooms; huge bathroom; and the service to/from Narita Express is invaluable. Location is right next to Tokyo station which is gigantic. The walk to Tokyo Metro was a bit far. A little more attention to the small details would have made our stay the ultimate stay in Tokyo, but overall it was a great stay.

We dropped in for brunch at the Piacere restaurant on the 28th floor. We had delicious Eggs Benedict as we watched the bustling Tokyo Train Station below! Great food, great view!!!Thank you Fiachra for your traveling tips in Hong Kong as well!

I had stayed in Shangri la during my business trip along with few of my colleagues. It was my very first time staying with the Shangri la brand despite their massive popularity amongst Travellers. It was a little tricky getting there as they have a shared building with office, which is very common in Tokyo. I had stayed at Mandarin oriental prior to moving to Shangri la and we had a little communication breakdown with the taxi driver though the staff from Mandarin oriental had briefed the driver in japanese. Despite the communication breakdown we managed to get to the hotel and was greeted with a warm welcome by the sales director. Check in was so smooth, however we were asked to wait for our rooms which is to be ready by 2pm. I have no complaints on that as we had arrived early by 12pm and made a little time for sight seeing at Shibuya which was little less than 20mins from the Jr station. What I loved about Shangri la is the strategic location just next to JR station- just what you need while in Tokyo to get around places. The rooms were tastefully furnished and the sales director took the time to explain all the work behind the exquisite and intricate detailing of the interiors across various parts of the hotel. The little site visit gave us more knowledge about the hotel. The breakfast at the Piacere restaurant was good. Shangri la is known for serving the best meals across the globe and we were certain when we had our breakfast. We also had lunch at Nadaman, is a world famous. Definitely one of the best Japanese lunch I've had. It's an absolute must try while in Shangri la-be sure to make an advance reservation as they are known for their popularity and a lot of business meetings are held there over lunch/dinner.My overall experience with Shangri was amazing and I would love to come back. They do offer a little meet and greet service to the Jr station which is complimentary for in house guest. Do take advantage of that amenity. I am attaching pics of my room and lunch. I had a massive bed of what me and my colleagues call a 'Swimming pool'.

I have stayed major luxury hotels in Tokyo, but their service quality is the highest from my point of view. What I was completely shocked was their highest standard of room cleaning. Even though Shangri-La is international hotel brand, their cleaning skills and detailed care is very, very, very Japanese.I left with my toothpaste or razor messed in powder area and came back to room in 1 hour to see ALL ITEMS perfectly organized in same distance, and all items' brand label faced front, layered from smaller one to larger one.This was my first experience on my whole life with 1000+ times of travel!

What's this fascination with having glass bathrooms in the bedroom? More light? It's a bit strange to be in the bath inside a shower box. Sink area had plenty of space for makeup and the lighting was good. Shower very powerful if a little hard to get the heat setting right. The bed is fabulous!Good location and friendly staff.

Hotel has an outstanding staff providing an exception level of personal service. We had a club floor corner suite which provided a panoramic view over Tokyo Bay. Club appetizers were well presented and the staff again provided great service. Only draw back is achohol is served over a limited time so if your schedule doesn't accommodate will be disappointing. Breakfast was great both at the restaurant and on the club floor. Great location steps from Ginza and Tokyo Station

An amazing hotel in a great location in Tokyo, centrally located just by Tokyo Station. The hotel was beautiful and the service was unbelievable. We had a Horizon Club room and we had access to the lounge and concierge, which provided an oasis after a busy day pounding the humid streets of Tokyo. The standout feature of this hotel was the quality of its staff - nothing was too much trouble for them and they were so friendly with a big genuine smile on their faces all of the time. They booked our train tickets back to Narita and arranged a complimentary escort carrying our luggage through the confusing passageways of Tokyo Station, they even waited for us to board the train. I enjoyed one of their Japanese whiskies in the lounge and when I said that I couldn't find it in the shops, they sourced it for me and went out to buy it on our behalf. What a hotel!!

It has been many years since we last stayed in a Shangri-la hotel. Did not expect such outstanding service this time.To start off, staff waited for us at the train station once we got off train at Tokyo station. Then he led us to the hotel which was about 15 mins walk through the station underground. We reached the hotel in the evening and were checked in at the Horizon club lounge. Our room was on the same level as the lounge and just round the corner, very convenient. Refreshments and food were available throughout the day at the club lounge. We really enjoyed having light food there. It was actually pretty filling for me. My son and I had a great time swimming in the indoor pool one morning. Gym was right next to it. Service again was great. Wet towels were handed out to us after our swim and the staff were all very polite. Breakfast was at Piacere restaurant at 28th level. Selection was so so but food was tasty. We could choose from menu for the mains plus we could eat from the buffet. Room was very spacious. I especially like the bathroom. Shower area was right beside the bath tub. Glass door to the bath/ shower area blocked cold air from the room outside. Long sliding wooden main door to the bathroom also reduced the cold air. The toilet area was totally separated from the shower area hence more privacy. Location of hotel is very convenient as it's just a stone's throw away from Tokyo station. There is a minimart right across the hotel, we kept buying stuff from there. Would highly recommend this hotel.

I go to Tokyo several times a year for business. In the past a few years, I stayed in a different hotel every time I visited Tokyo. Two years ago, I tried to stay with Shangri-la Tokyo for the first time, and I fell in love with it. All of the rooms are located on high floors, and The view from your room can never be blocked by some of the buildings. I like the service, the food and the hospitality as well. A wonderful experience every time I stay there!

There’s a song from the American musical, “Finian’s Rainbow,” titled “When I’m Not Near, The Girl I Love, I Love The Girl I’m Near.” That’s how I have felt about Tokyo’s Four Seasons Marinouchi, The Peninsula, and The Shangri-La. They are all wonderful. But after recent visits to all three, my wife and I are irretrievably in love with The Shangri-La.Unlike the décor of some Shangri-La hotels we have seen, which we find a bit over-the-top for our taste, the Tokyo Shangri-La is restrained, elegant and beautiful. The rooms are very large and comfortable, and want for nothing. We were in a corner room, and even the shower and bathtub had an expansive view. The bathroom was huge and gorgeous. There was room to do floor exercises and an exercise mat thoughtfully provided, with an Nespresso machine to make coffee as a reward.The breakfasts are in a beautiful dining room, with a buffet that alone would be sufficient. But there is a menu with a broad selection of choices, and my Eggs Royale one morning and Eggs Benedict another were superb. My wife had a chinese breakfast and I tasted the dim sum, which were excellent. Breakfast is the equal of any hotel breakfast I have ever had.But what makes the Shangri-La Tokyo so special are the staff. We are nobody in particular. But from our first visit in 2015, we were made to feel welcome and special. We were greeted by name at the front door (how do they do that?), and most staff greeted us by name throughout our stay. The concierge was wonderful, helping us with a complex set of rail tickets. The front desk is so well staffed that we have never had to wait for assistance. I can’t say this hotel feels like home—who lives this way at home!?—but we did feel welcome and special. Oh, and one more thing: The Shangri-La is smack next door to Tokyo Station. You can take the Narita Express from the airport and walk in a matter of minutes to the hotel. The hotel will meet you at your train car at your request, and when it’s time to leave escort you to your departing train car. Tokyo high-end hotels are wonderful. We have stayed in most of them and they have earned their excellent reputations. The Shangri-La belongs in that pantheon, and for us is at the top of the list.

I stayed at Ritz club level and shangri-la all in one week on Tokyo. Both are great experiences but I feel shangri-la was the best bang for the buck . Shangri-la : Not only did they provide a complimentary cake but they upgraded our room to one with a great view. Their complimentary escort service to and from Tokyo station was fantastic. I called them when I was in the train and ( short notice) and they had a nice gentleman waiting at our train car to guide us to the hotel. It's a 2 min walk but the station is huge can get very confusing if it's your first time there. The room and amenities were fantastic . I needed a bandaid and they brought it asap. Will go back again . The rooms are bigger than average Tokyo hotels. The bed was bigger than a king size .

Absolutely fantastic hotel! The rooms are great, with very spacious bathrooms, very comfortable beds and amazing views. The design of the hotel is fabulous throughout: rooms, lobby, restaurants, the bar - everything looks new and very grand. The breakfast was great, albeit pricey, the set menu dinner at the Japanese restaurant was excellent and cocktails in the bar were delicious - all of which with the benefit of amazing views across Tokyo from every angle. The staff was all very friendly and really welcoming and the concierge provided us with some excellent tips for dinner. We travel a lot and have stayed at some very nice hotels, but this is one of the best city hotels in the world we have ever been too!

We stayed one night at the Shangri-La hotel during a long layover at Narita airport on our way back home from China . It was an amazing experience. Unfortunately, our flight to Tokyo was delayed and we arrived after 10pm with 2 tired kids in a new country. We purchased train tickets from the airport to Tokyo station and called to inform the hotel. Once at Tokyo station, we saw a hotel employee waiting for us; and she quickly guided us to the hotel before my daughter could melt down. Once at the hotel, the check-in process was equally quick and easy. The front desk receptionist even kindly walked us up to our room. The Horizon lounge was elegantly decorated and the food was delicious. Our two kids have severe food allergies (anaphylaxis) and even though we inform most hotels ahead of time, we always have to re-inform them again and even then mistakes are made. Here, they brought up the food allergies. My one child has milk, peanuts, tree nuts, and sesame allergy, while the other one has wheat and tree nut allergy. Usually it takes a long time to make the "special" foods we order because of issues with cross-contamination. I was also sure that with the language barrier, the issue of milk allergy will be confused with lactose intolerance. I was pleasantly surprised. Food arrived so quickly that I remember thinking that at least we have 8 epipens and a bag of zyrtec, benadryl, and prednisone to cover us. To my surprise it was both delicious and safe for the kids. The kids ordered multiple things on the menu and normally we would be told that certain food could not be accommodated because of certain recipes. Here, they accommodated everything and it was all delicious. They even provided gluten-free and dairy-free sandwiches during afternoon tea. The concierge suggested a double-decker bus tour of Tokyo which was just perfect for our 20 hr layover in Japan. Then a hotel employee actually walked us to the bus tour where she helped us purchase the ticket and placed us on the bus. I can't say enough about the service and attention to detail they provided during our short trip. Lastly after we checked-out, a hotel employee walked us directly to our train platform. To our surprise, she stood waiting for our train to arrive and place us in our seats. At that point, we thanked her for her time but she left only after giving us her card with a number to call in case we needed help. This was an amazing 5 star experience.

If you are looking for a luxurious stay and you want to be treated like royalty - then i found the perfect place.The staff where absolutely amazing. Assisted with anything and everything.You will want for nothing while you are here.Recommend you book the club access. Brilliant.Thank you to all at Shangri La Tokyo. We 6 Aussies all miss you as you made our stay unforgettable. Mrs Smith

Centrally located on top of the Tokyo station, the Shang Tokyo affords easy accessibility for exploring Tokyo. Ginza is only a few blocks away and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Staff at the hotel bar remembered us from previous days and our orders. Being Golden Circle members meant our room was upgraded and welcome gift on arrival which is always appreciated.The gym, pool and sauna services are fantastic. We used these daily.

A perfect location hotel, just next to the Tokyo station, you can go to everywhere easily. Nearby with department stores and many shops for shopping, and lots of restaurant choices. This is one of the best hotel I have ever stayed in Tokyo, the service is super, once you stepped in the hotel you feel very comfortable and everyone in the hotel initiated to help, concierge, front desk, restaurant are all with excellent service. Room is big (in Japan), clean and with enough lighting, you get nothing to complain, I think the only part needed to improve is the food choice at the breakfast buffet as there are only limited choices.

Stayed at the Shanghai La on the first 2 nights in Japan. The hotel is lovely and very good staff. If you want to eat in the hotel it pays to book in advance as we found all the restaurants to be very busy. The rooms are good and comfortable.

We love the Shangri-la hotel chain (which makes the Four Seasons look like amateurs), and the Tokyo Shangri-la is a worthy addition. The rooms are luxuriously appointed and modern (i.e. there are plenty of outlets with built-in travel adapters to charge your electronics), the staff is extremely helpful and fluent in English. It is located near Tokyo Station, which means there are lots of dining and shopping options nearby (including Ramen Street, with many excellent ramen options, all at reasonable prices (for Tokyo). The Daimaru department store is literally around the corner as well. The only minor downside is that some Tokyo cab drivers have no idea how to find the hotel or the entrance to the hotel (which is underground). It's not a huge inconvenience because they can drop you off at street level and you can take the elevator directly to the lobby (28th floor), but there is occasionally some confusion, despite the excellence of cab drivers in Tokyo.But that's a minor quibble. There is no other hotel we stay at when we're in Tokyo. The Shangri-la is clearly the best! :)
user_name:
mayliang
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is a stunning hotel right by Tokyo station. We had a deluxe double overlooking the city - the staff were so helpful and attentive, the room luxurious, the shower amazing, and the bed so comfortable. Perfect really, and although expensive, worth every yen

I usually stay at the Club Room at the Ritz or the Four Seasons. Based upon price, reviews and location, I chose the Club Room at the Shangri-La. I could not have been more impressed. There were usually no more than a dozen people in the Club Room at a time, with 4 to 5 attendants. Excellent French champagne, Bordeaux wine and great snacks. Starting with a made to order breakfast to all you really need at night to eat if you have been out sightseeing all day. Moreover, they send an attendant to meet you at the train station and help you return. Although they explain on their website that the hotel is only one minute from the northern exit of the train station, what they don't explain is that you have to walk though a maze for about 15 minutes to get there from the train from the airport. Sending someone to help lean the way and take care of our 2 heaviest bags was really fantastic. In addition, the rooms were great. More attention to detail than I have ever seen. Every type of electronic cable adapter you might need is in the room along with a box of office supplies. Need anything else, just call and someone will be at your door in minutes. All said, a wonderful experience. Thanks so much Shangri-La!

We stayed in this hotel from 6th-th July 2017. The location of the hotel is good, next to Tokyo central station and convenient for getting around the city. The room was of a very good standard and the hotel and staff were nice.The big let down for this hotel is that the breakfast room is far too small for a 5 star hotel. We did not get the impression that the hotel was particularly overrun and yet we still had to wait 30 minutes for a breakfast table for 2. That is simply unacceptable in a 5 star hotel. The staff did not distinguish between size of parties when allocating tables, meaning that we saw a number of 4 person tables with only one guest seated at them. I felt there were too many 4 seater tables when perhaps better use could be made with 2 seaters with smaller chairs. Additionally the hotel should seat guests in the Lobby Lounge (this is not open for breakfast until late in the morning: it should be) rather than requiring them to stand in a queue for half an hour. It's a shame because the quality of the breakfast and ambience was very good but the lengthy wait detracted from the experience.

This is our 3rd time staying in Tokyo Shang and its still a treat. The staff really have good manners. They really make sure that they help you with everything you need and they do it in such a friendly way. The rooms are always well prepared and well maintained. The one we got this time had a really nice view of the Imperial palace. I have nothing but good words for Shang hotels especially the one in Tokyo.

Located right next to tokyo station, heaps of food nearby, room was excellent, service top class, in room dining was delicious, cozy bar at the top.In the past three years prices have gone up significantly compared to before though, such a pity.

That's my first time stayed at Shangri-La Hotel, Tokyo. The location is good, just near Tokyo Station Hotel. I with my mom stayed Horizon Club Deluxe Room. The room is big and bed is very comfortable. The Shangri-La's staff are so nice, and helpful. They give us a warm smile and greeting us every time we leave and in. I want to say thank you to an Horizons Club staff and bell desk staff, they helped us arrange bus tickets, and provided escort service. Also, I want to highly recommended to having a breakfast at Hotel! I'll definitely love to stay at Shangri-La Hotel, Tokyo when I visit Tokyo again!

Very conveniently located, next to Tokyo Station. Spectacular in every way! Got upgraded to a corner suite which has a wrap-around view of the city and even Mount Fuji in the distance. Bathroom was amazing. Stocked with everything you could possible need and more, even a silk travel envelope with more toiletries and panty hose. Breakfast, included, was an incredibly diverse abundance of choices , buffet style but also you could choose from a menu. Service was so attentive and friendly, upon check-out , two staff members escorted us to Tokyo Station up to our shinkhansen train! Amazing stay!!!

Beautiful hotel with great location across the street from the main train station. The huge corner room on the 38th floor had wrap around views of Tokyo. The Service was perfection and the staff very attentive.

We stayed here with our 2 girls (5 and 3) during Chinese New Year and had an amazing stay. The rooms are huge and wonderfully clean and equipped...everything is top quality.....the staff are absolutely amazing and provide just about the best service you could ever wish to experience and the breakfast..........wow!!! It's also fantastically located right next to Tokyo Station which makes getting around this wonderful city a breeze!We loved Japan and split our time between skiing in Aomori and Tokyo but without doubt staying in the Shangri-La in Tokyo was the highlight of our stay. We are frequent travellers and have stayed in many top class hotels but this one is definitely right up there with the absolute best. We can't wait to go back!!

This Shangri La property is up there with the best - the hotel starts at L28 and the floor to ceiling views from the room windows are pretty amazing. The room was large and breakfast room (whilst a bit expensive) was very elegant (great views again). Gym is a bit light on - but enough for a workout (nice pool). Location is very central - right near Tokyo Station (and Narita Express). Will definitely return.

The title sum it up. We usually stayed at Peninsula when visiting Tokyo, this time we decided to try shangrila and we are certainly glad we did. Both hotels are excellent, but here the staffs and service has an edge. The title sum it up and will be back for sure...

Just on top of the Tokyo Station (so convenient) and in Ginza surrounded by restaurants, shops and all the entertainment you will need, the Shangri-La Tokyo is centrally located to save you time. But the rooms are so big and spacious, my family was so impressed with this hotel and we will definitely be back.

The property checked most of my main criteria:Location:This hotel is located right next to the Tokyo station, which meant that not only was transportation was easy, there were a lot of things to do and places to eat within walking distance. For example, the walk to the Palace was pleasant.Property:We stayed on the Club level floor. The club was nicely appointed wth good selection of drink/food. The breakfast was great with options for full western, Japanese, Chinese breakfast in addition to good selections in the buffet. You also had the option to eat breakfast at their restaurant and lounge at no additional cost. The room itself was nice...not the best appointed place we have stayed at but nice. A minor issue...there was a glass wall between the bath/shower area and the bedroom...which I found more common in Asia. I can draw down the blind but even in that case, if I get up to go to the restroom in the middle of the night, the light leakage disturbs the other person in the bedroom.Service:The check-in was a little bumpy. The lobby is not located on the first floor. When we entered the building, the one person stationed there directed us to the main registration level instead of the Horizon Club level since we booked the club level. We carried our own bags to the front desk. After check-in there was no bell staff to help with the bags. The desk person who checked us in carried the one bag that she could manage while we carried the rest. Not sure if this is SOP or if they were short staffed. All other experiences concerning service was excellent. The staff at the Horizon Club desk was especially helpful and friendly.Spa:If you choose to get spa treatment, I would suggest that you make sure everyone is on the same page on what treatment exactly you will receive. I reserved a 90 minute Swedish but apparently what I ended up getting was one of their fancier treatments. At no point was the options discussed with how much it would cost until I was presented with the check. I know it is gauche to discuss money but guests need to know what they are getting for what they are paying. The spa treatment and facilities were excellent otherwise.Gym:The gym was disappointing. There were a few selection of free weights and the choice of machines was not extensive. Minimal...Summary:This is a nice property. Not the best hotel we have stayed in Tokyo. I would rate Mandarin Oriental and the Park Hyatt higher with more of a "wow factor" in the lobby and common areas. If you are a cigar smoker, the only option for you is a small glass smoking booth in the lobby level with no place to sit. There is no place to smoke even outside the hotel. One thing that Shangri-La has that the others did not is a more convenient location for getting around on foot...and the Horizon Club.
user_name:
SixpackDC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Outstanding staff (best ever), from the concierge to the escort services to the train platform, everyone went above and beyond. Awesome hotel. Fantastic location, next to the Tokyo station. Great restaurants. Highly recommended.
user_name:
custodiot
New York City, New York

review_body: We are Golden Circle members and have stayed at other Shangri La properties - I can't imagine a better hotel exists within the group. Apart from the beautifully appointed facilities, the hospitality was equally as good - they stored bags for us while we took aff to Kyoto for a few days, arranged a hair salon visit for me and escorted me there. The breakfast was fabulous and the views were gob-smacking.

I had a quality birthday stay, the staff are knowledgeable. Room equip with great amenities......warm ambience in general not over crowded. Like best the concierge provide quality restaurants information. Only least i think can be improve was the arrival transportation as no airport limo direct to hotel. This ismy 2nd visit with this hotel, experience urself n u will def agree the goods as above.

Another excellent stay here at the Shangri-La Tokyo. The Horizon Club here provides much added amenities. Excellent food, enhanced services and I highly recommend it. The general manager and staff here are first rate. I have never met anyone in the hotel industry with such keen memory, attention to detail and just overall good characters. Once again heartfelt thanks to Mr. Marcus Bauder and Mr. Nicholas Liang for a memorable stay. Looking forward to another return when the Natsume Soseki Museum opens.

The Shangri-La Tokyo was so close to perfect that I do not actually have any criticism or suggestions for improvement - so I will simply state what I especially liked about our stay here.The service- impeccable all over Japan, but flawless here. From swiftly opening elevator doors, taking suitcases and escorting us to where we needed to go after seeing as wander in from the rain like drowned rats on the day we checked in, to providing us with an unexpected and much appreciated bottle of wine upon us mentioning in passing that it was someone's birthday, to the personalised note that it came with, to personally escorting us to our Narita Express platform at the confusing Tokyo station, to even returning a bottle of mouthwash (!!) that we left in the room upon checkout - it was flawless. The staff's mannerisms are warm and genuine too, not robotic and automatic.The Horizon Club lounge- smaller than some other Shangri-La properties' lounges but stunning nonetheless, with all day snacks, formal high tea, all day drinks, and table service which was unexpected. Usage of iPads for business and printing was appreciated too.The room:- stunning. I don't need to mention the usual comfortable king size beds and classic Shangri-La style and fragrance, that is a given. What was unexpected were little things like premium Japanese teas and a traditional cast iron teapot, wonderful kimonos and slippers taken out for us at turndown service, and the most amazing hotel shower I have ever seen - how can I get one installed at my place!?The facilities:- small but well equipped gym- a beautiful indoor pool with wraparound views of Tokyo, what a luxury- nice touches like bottled water and fruit by pool and in the gymSee you next time I am in Tokyo!

I stay for 3 nights at Shangri La with my sister. The check in was quick. I really like the location, because it is next to Tokyo station, as I need to go to Disneyland twice. And also If you want to walkaround marunouchi area, this is a perfect place to stay. It next to Daimaru mall, and near Takashimaya mall and Ginza Mitsukoshi mall. You can also find alot of things in Tokyo station. I also love with the breakfast menu, it was stunning. And delicious. I like the desert, it looks cute and beautiful.The room is comfortable and nice. The housekeeper do the clean very fast and very clean, they will tydi up your room each time you step out of the room.Overall I'm really satisfied with my expirience at Shangri La. It is really worth it for the price,the location and the service.I'll be back.

I tend to shy away from using superlatives in these types of reviews, as they are overused by many and thus rendered less impactful. In the case of this property and our experience there, however, everything was fantastic. The facilities were stellar, and the service superb. More travel-related businesses should learn from this company. I can find absolutely nothing to criticize. Bravo.

The Tokyo Shangri La has set a new standard for me in hotels, as they exceeded my expectations in every single way. Yes, they did the basics such as dining reservations, subway meet and greets exceedingly well, but the following are a few of the above and beyond items:- their breakfast buffet is exceptional. I've never been so excited to eat at a breakfast buffet. It was stunning. My husband, who rarely eats either breakfast or sugar and flour, devoured it.- their Director of Public Affairs, Cynthia Usui, befriended my son after noticing that he came in with some Japanese superhero characters. She sought him out while we were at tea, translated the content on the tags, researched things for us to do, left him character based treats in the room, and surprised him multiple times during our stay with gifts and attention. It was very, very special for all of us. Being dragged through Tokyo by your parents isn't always the most fun time for a 7 yr old, but Cynthia really made him feel special.- while small, their gym was clean, staffed, and we appreciated having it available.- the service - from the staff at the ground level all the way through the team doing evening turn down service was exceptional. Yes, I expect this- especially in Japan, but usually there's one part that falls through somewhere. Not here- every single interaction was perfect.Thank you Shangri La for exceeding my very high expectations. This is the first review I've felt compelled to write in years, because my experience warrants it. We'll be back!

I spent 4 nights at this hotel as part of a RTW trip I took in April. It is well located next to the central station, which meant getting to the hotel from Haneda airport was both easy and quick. We were met at the station by the hotels concierge service who carefully guided us to the hotel and check in. We later used the concierge service on a number of occasions and found them to be wonderfully helpful and knowledgeable..in fact they really couldn't do enough for us and were an amazing asset to this hotel.The room (a deluxe Imperial Garden View) was spacious and luxuriously equipped. The Imperial garden view it offers, it has to be said, is actually several blocks in the distance beyond the station and so while factually correct, isn't quite the view 'overlooking' the garden that I had wrongly expected. However this was not a problem in any way.We ate once in the hotel and had an incredible teppanyaki dinner in the Nadaman restaurant, beautifully cooked and presented by our chef . Again the service and hospitality were exceptional and I can highly recommend this experience.Having been to Japan for work several times before, travelling this time purely for pleasure at 'Sakura' time, was made especially enjoyable by our stay at this wonderful hotel.

Every time I come back to this hotel, they are still as amazing. Like the breakfast, the spacious room and also the hot pool after a long day work. And also it is just right beside Tokyo station and entrance into the Shinkansen platform. I will be back. Keep up the fantastic service. Thank you.

Without a doubt, this has to be the best hotel we have ever stayed in. This was our first visit to Tokyo, and others had previously told us that hotel rooms in Tokyo were quite small. When we walked into our room at the Shangri-La, we were very pleasantly surprised. The room was huge! We were fortunate to have a room on the 32nd floor, overlooking Tokyo city. The hotel itself occupies the upper floors of an office building, which is adjacent to Tokyo Central station. So it is in a very good and central location, which is perfect for exploring Tokyo. It is also a short walk to the Imperial Place, where you can explore the gardens. The Ginza District is also an easy walk from the hotel (approx. 15 minutes). Our accommodation in the hotel was excellent - a huge bed, beautiful bathroom with walk in shower, a coffee machine and an evening bed turn down service. The hotel buffet breakfast was amazing, with so many food choices. All hotel staff that we dealt with were friendly, professional and accommodating. I would have no hesitation in returning to the Shangri-La Tokyo if I were to visit the city again.

Spent 4 nights for a family vacation. Hotel occupies 10 floors in a newish building right next to Tokyo Station, making for easy subway access. Rooms are stylish, well appointed and spacious. Modern amenities. Lobby has a beautiful room with city views in three directions. Staff is warm and service is impeccable.

This was my 4th stay with the Shangri-la in Tokyo. The hotel is extremely well managed and never fails to impress. A big thanks to the GM, Mr. Marcus Bauder and his team, for the warm welcome and the outstanding service.This hotel sets the benchmark for all other luxury hotels in Tokyo and beyond. I already look forward to my next stay with the Shangri-la in Tokyo.

I have just finished travelling around Japan for 2 weeks. We started our trip in Tokyo at the Park Hyatt. We have just arrived at the Shangri-La. Bother hotels are amazing. I spent a lot of time researching both of these hotels. If you are choosing between the two I think Shangri-La is a notch above. I am on the club floor. The view is just as incredible as the Park Hyatt. However the pool area and spa are better in my opinion at Shangri-La. The staff are incredible. I haven't seen my daughter since my 60th birthday so this is my celebration and they have made it very special for me. Thank you. The position is absolutely perfect. Right next door to Tokyo station. We got in a cab at the station and he literally pulled out then pulled back in! We could have walked but the driver seemed ok about it, so it isn't a problem if you have luggage. I am so happy with my decision to stay here. Only thing is we may not do much sight seeing. We just want to stay in the hotel! I'll do an update when we check out and have tried the restaurants and cocktails! I'm not sure but I don't think the Park Hyatt had a club lounge. That in itself is worth choosing Shangri-La!

We stayed in this hotel for 6 days and it felt like home. This is one of the few hotels where we pretty much got anything and everything we asked for. The staff was so amazing, they helped us in every way. We had the most amazing experience and they made our stay comfortable. We are going to seek out this chain of hotels for all our trips now.

I stayed at the Shangri-La Hotel in Tokyo for seven days in June 2017. I am not a frequent writer about my hotel stays, but I felt compelled to share my observations about the Shangri-La because of the high quality amenities and superb service at the hotel. The Shangri-La brand is not {yet} as well known as other luxury hotel brands in the U.S. It is rising in popularity among Europeans, and it is already well known to Asians.The Shangri-La is located within 2 minutes walking distance from famed Tokyo Station, which provides easy access to all of Tokyo's exceedingly efficient transportation as well as the Shenkansen bullet trains. The hotel overlooks the Japanese Imperial Palace and Gardens, where the Emperor still resides. The hotel is visited frequently by business men and women, but also increasingly, by tourists. It is located near Ginza, and it is easy to get anywhere in Tokyo from the hotel. All of the staff interacting with guests are fluent in English.The hotel occupies the 28th through 37th floors of an elegant business tower in the Chiyoda area. Rooms with Imperial Garden views are priced higher, but the views in all directions are inspiring. I stayed in Room 3703 which was a Deluxe King Room located on the Horizon Club floor. It is more expensive to have access to the Horizon Club services, and I am glad I made the choice I did. I have no doubt that service is equally friendly and professional in all areas of the hotel.It should be a given that service in high-end hotels would be top notch, and the reason I decided to write this lengthy review, is because of the perfect, by my lights, service I received. The service was professional, friendly, considerate, thoughtful and insightful. Simply put, this is about as good as it gets. Every interaction I had with concierges and staff members had the same result which was a complete response to what I was seeking fulfilled professionally and with the utmost respect and consideration. I'll provide a single illustrative example. I was on a quest for a particular out of circulation Japanese currency bill, and I asked the Horizon Club concierge where I perhaps might be able to find this. Of course, she made the call to a nearby bank to find what I was seeking, as one assumes she would.. As she was giving me directions to the nearby bank, my briefest hesitation conveyed that I was uncertain about how to navigate amongst the nearby tall buildings to get to where I needed to go. Within a heartbeat, the concierge asked if I would like her to escort me there. I otherwise would have gotten lost.My room was beautifully appointed and the food was excellent in each site at which I ate in the hotel, including the breakfast and evening hors d'oeuvres in the Horizon Club.I could go on, but enough is enough. Suffice it to say that in addition to The Shangri-La having all the expected components of a luxury hotel in Tokyo, the service was perfect. I felt like family while stayed there, as was the intention of the staff. I would like to be more balanced in this review and provide at least one criticism that might help other potential guests who read this, but I am unable to do so.Domo arigato gozaimas to the people who work at the Shangri-La.

Hotel is located next to Tokyo Station which makes it convenient if you are taking the train from Narita.The stand out feature of this hotel is the service quality. From the front desk to the concierge, service standards were top notched.Breakfast was great. Waiting staff attentive. Love the room too.Try this place for yourself.

Outstanding hotel bedecked with exemplary staff. You will be treated like royalty from the warm courteous welcome to the farewell bidding. Every inch of this opulent hotel has been well-thought out and tastefully decorated. My daughter and I had the best four nights sleep in a hotel ever! The bed was heavenly with supreme quality linens. Our room adjacent to the elevators was completely sound-proof. We are a Shangri-La converts for life, Do not hesitate to splurge and treat yourself, your family/friend/employee to this amazing hotel.

Shangri-La is rated as one of the top hotels in Tokyo. We spent 7 nights there and were mentally prepared that we are in a top notch hotel in the heart of a city with one of the highest real estate costs. As a family of 4 (with kids of 14, 11), however, the room was really small even by our low expectations. It was classily done and the bathroom was fantastic.
