But how do they (and most hotels in Japan) expect two individuals to share that single bed is beyond our comprehension - especially a room that charges in excess of $500 a night. To pay that much and not get a decent night's sleep seems unfair. Once the rollaway bed is put in, it is almost impossible for 4 individuals to be able to move around and put any bags anywhere.The room service was quite good - good variety although breakfast left a lot to be desired. The service was excellent. The main concierge lady was excellent - she was very helpful, informative and everyone there was very good and helpful. Set the standards for service quality. Very conveniently located right on top of Tokyo Station but there are no signs from within the station. Good walk to Ginza and trains to anywhere you wish to go.Also located next to Toyota Rent-a-car, which had really poor service - and don't believe them when they say the GPS is English. The keypad is in Japanese and you really cannot enter anything!It was disappointing that getting a largish taxi (to accommodate 4 individuals with 4 bags) was not feasible from the hotel thus forcing us to take 2 taxis to the Haneda airport.

You will be glad you did!This maybe is not the easiest hotel to find. I knew it was adjacent to Tokyo Station but even with his GPS system, the taxi driver coming from Narita had trouble finding the main entrance. (Hint - the motor entrance is below ground, one level below street level.) The building sits in the middle of the block, easy to find by foot but a challenge perhaps for drivers.The Shangri La hotel chain is my "go to" hotel choice around Asia. I have stayed at the Island Shangri La in Hong Kong for 20+ years; the Shangri La in Singapore was my preferred hotel for almost as long; I like both of the Shangri La's in Shanghai; the facilities in Bangkok and Beijing are wonderful; and thankfully the Shangri La Sydney is finally improving its caliber of service. Although I have been perfectly happy staying at the Peninsula Tokyo the last few years, it does not have a club level with club level amenities. So when Shangri La finally opened a new hotel in Tokyo, I decided to try it. And I'm glad I did.There are valid reasons why Shangri La's Horizon Clubs are a magnet for business travelers like me. If you're traveling with other work associates, the clubs offer a quick easy place to rendezvous for breakfast to map out the day's agenda. If you need copies made for a presentation, they can do that. If you need to book a lunch reservation somewhere across town, the Horizon Club staff will do it for you. And on those evenings when you don't have a business dinner, the Horizon Clubs offer a nice place to have a cocktail and some light snacks. (To be honest, a few Shangri La's over-sell their Horizon Club to the point they are so crowded to the point you can't find a seat. Singapore's Tower Wing is a big offender in this regard.) The Tokyo Shangri La however get's it right. The Horizon Club's service is extremely personalized, which is exactly what you would expect. The breakfast they offer is well done, as is afternoon tea and evening cocktails. By the second day, the club staff is calling you by name and already knows whether you prefer milk or cream with your coffee.This is a relatively small hotel in a big, mixed-use office building immediately adjacent to Tokyo Station. The days I was staying there, I needed to take a bullet train to different cities both days. From the hotel lobby, I was literally a 15 minute walk away from the track I need to depart on. (Don't worry, the windows of the Shangri La are double-paned and you hear nothing. The floors which the hotel occupies are at the top of this new high-rise.) You cannot be more centrally located than Tokyo Station! The Imperial Palace is two blocks in one direction and the heart of The Giza is two blocks in the other direction.If you have stayed at a Shangri La anywhere in the world, you know what to expect. And knowing what to expect for frequent business travelers like me is a good thing. Beautiful decor well executed, spacious guest rooms, big marble bathrooms, a large desk with multiple electrical outlets, wonderful beds with both firm and soft pillows, an iron and ironing board (a rarity in Tokyo), a safe big enough for a large laptop, shoe trees, and in most cases free wifi throughout the hotel. The Tokyo property does not disappoint in any of these regards. In addition to the small but perfect Horizon Club, this hotel offers something I haven't found elsewhere in Tokyo - a lobby bar that serves an amazing American-style cheeseburger with fries. Now, I really love Japanese food but sometimes you really crave a good burger. The one here is amazing! And they make a perfect martini. I want to commend this hotel for handling an unusual situation. My first night, shortly after I fell asleep, the fire alarm went off. After about a minute of a very loud blaring horn (and a flashing warning light for hearing-challenged guests), I realized maybe this wasn't a false alarm. I grabbed my pants, wallet, passport and room key and carefully opened the door (after feeling it for heat). The hotel already had staff in the hallways advising guests to stay put while they investigated. It turns out it there had been smoke in the basement but it did not require evacuation. The staff kept everyone informed of what was going on and the next day apologized to each guest for the inconvenience. I never got to the health club, so I cannot comment on that. Nor did I eat in their lobby level tablecloth restaurant. Based on everything else I did experience, I will be back. Even though I thought I knew what to expect, the Tokyo Shangri La exceeded my expectations.

We had a most wonderful stay at the Tokyo Shangri-La. During our 10 days in Japan, we left the Shangri-La hotel twice to visit Fujikawaguchiko and Kyoto. Our Club concierge supervisor, Mr. Tsuruoka and his assistant, Ami, helped us throughout our stay by arranging our Shinkansen and Express bus tickets to these two places. Also, we were able to secure reservations at highly sought after restaurants such as L'Osier, etc. During our return from Fujikawaguchiko, we were pleasantly surprised to have our original Horizon Club executive suite upgraded to a 120 sq.m. premier suite! A wedding anniversary cake was also delivered to our room. The service and attention to details by the Horizon Club concierge team was truly a wonderful experience. The hotel is situated right next to the Tokyo train station which was excellent for our multiple destination itinerary. Thank you to the Shangri-La team for make this a highly memorable wedding anniversary celebration for my wife and me.

It has been a little over one year since my last visit to SL. The level of service is consistent and i always feel welcomed. The reservation department was very helpful and flexible with my date change. My requests were handled promptly in professional manner. When i needed a carton box to pack my belongings late at night, the staff brought over 3 different sizes of carton box for me to choose. I was impressed. Given the location and service I experienced, i will come back again.

Very nice hotel ,excellent location and very good service. the room was specious and the breakfast was very reach and fresh. If you are looking for a good business hotel ,this the right one for you and less for family & kids.

We finished off our Japan travels staying at the lovely Shangri-La Hotel Tokyo.Brilliant location within minutes’ walk to Tokyo station. Plenty of restaurant and shopping opportunities at your doorstep.The rooms are very comfortable, generous size, amazing views, lovely bright bathrooms with huge showers.Delicious breakfast choices with incredible serviceAn outstanding guest experience from the moment you enter this truly magnificent property. The staff are exceptional, professional and very friendly nothing is too much trouble . Thank-you for making our stay a wonderful experience.

Another perfect stay in the best hotel in Tokyo! Room and bathroom were extremely comfortable. The view (I had the Bay view) was unobstructed. Staff were unpretentious- courteous and friendly yet not intrusive. Location was unparalleled- in the heart of Tokyo. I doubt there is a better hotel in Tokyo. Choose this hotel and you will not regret!

We stayed one night here and we chose it because it was just on top of Tokyo station so was very convenient for arrival from Narita and departure on Shinkansen. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay from check in to check out. The deluxe room had a great view of Tokyo Bay and was spacious with coffee/tea and a big bathroom. Room and hotel was quiet and relaxing. We had the kaiseki dinner in Nadaman which was fantastic. Most of all we enjoyed the quality breakfast with a good choice of buffet and hot dish. Mango pancake was delicious and so was the Eggs Benedict. We took advantage of their meet and greet service when we checked out and had staff take us right to the platform when we left by Shinkansen the next day. We will definitely be back again.

Had a great visit with friends and fabulous dinner at the hotel. Hotel dinning is over the top. Prices aren't cheap but you don't expect low prices at this great hotel. Great location right by the trains. Highly recommend. Staff is over the top friendly and they split servings to accommodate light dinners. Great rooms and views

They are many aspects that make a hotel stay perfect. The staff, estate design, location and attention to the little details all adds up. I must say Shangri la Tokyo comes close to being the epitome of perfection. From the attentiveness of the bell hop, to the lobby checkin or if you are staying at the horizon club the exclusivity and ostentatious classic design and offerings makes one feel simply welcomed and pampered. The location is ideal for shopping and food. Although the stay doesn't come cheap you pay for something that is close to perfection.

As many other hyper luxury hotels in Tokyo, the Shangri-la lobby sits on the 28th floor of a Marinouchi tower attached to the Tokyo Station. The lobby bar has stunning views of the city. Hotel staff is impeccable and so are the rooms, amenities and spa. Japanese restaurant Nadaman is 5-star. A lovely week in Japan at a lovely hotel.

We had a suite on the 36 level of this wonderful Hotel in Tokyo. It's situated right along side the Tokyo Train Station and it was wonderful to look down on all the activity at the Station with hundreds of trains coming and going from 5.00am to 2.00am the next day.Now to the Hotel - we found this to be a magnificent place to stay handy to everything we wanted and all within walking distance which we did a great lot of. We were their for a week and at all times we found the staff only to willing to help us out for all of our needs.We were very grateful for their service. Suite was wonderful as was the in house food

Great room.Wonderful view.The service is very good.The food in the Restaurant was good and fresh.The hotel is very well located-train station and The Ginza are at it's doorstep!! I feel refreshed before going back home.

The staff were amazing, really went out of their way to make the stay enjoyable. Facilities excellent. We had a deluxe Garden View Room and it was quite large with all the things you would need. Breakfast in the hotel was good. It is very close to Tokyo station but not many restaurants within walking distance. So had to get cabs or train to experience the hustle and bustle of Tokyo.

At the end of Japan vacation we stayed a couple of nights at the Shangri-La and this was clearly a highlight. From the start service level is at an amazing standard. Arriving at Tokyo station and being met by a representative of the hotel at the platform who showed us the way is a super service and on the way back having someone help us navigate to the Narita Airport express was much needed (I don't think we would have found our way otherwise). We had connecting club lounge rooms which was fantastic for us as a family. The offerings in the lounge are clearly top end as are the rooms and service. The views are great either direction - over the city or on the imperial garden side. The club lounge team is amazing and constantly focused on making your stay enjoyable. THANK YOU again.

Great location next to Tokyo Station this wonderful hotel provides fantastic service in beautiful and large rooms. This is a world class hotel which is hard to beat in any metropolitan centre, The hotel is located on the upper floors of an office building with a private entrance at the ground floor and an express elevator to the lobby floor. An Horizon Club room would be an excellent choice as the club like lounge serves complimentary refreshments and snacks through most of the day. A small but well equipped gym with separate sauna and hot pool.

The hotel is located at a perfect location for visitors. The train station and the metro was just around the corner from the entrance and easy to access to visit other places in Japan. The staff will even escort you and carry your baggage all the way to the train platform. Areas with great restaurants and shopping are just walking distance. We can see the imperial palace from our window.We stayed at the Horizon Club Lounge and the service was exceptional. Before we arrived, I had a long list of restaurant reservations for difficult places to get into and they successfully reserved all. On our arrival, they had all the reservations with maps, addresses and directions printed out and organized in a binder. What was exceptional was the timeliness of response during the pre-trip time with emails to constantly update us on the status of the reservations were were requesting.The rooms were pristine and beautiful and quite large for Tokyo. My son and I also enjoyed swimming daily at the pool.

Stayed recently for 3 nights during our holiday in Japan, stayed in a corner room on the 37th floor with a view overlooking the Imperial Palace. Room was very well laid out, spacious and very comfortable. We were on the same floor as the Horizon Club and were able to get breakfast there as well as evening drinks and snacks. Staff very friendly and helpful. Overall the best hotel we stayed in during our two weeks in Japan and what we would expect from the Shangri-La chain having stayed in their other properties in the world. My review of their restaurants in the Tokyo hotel though will save for a direct review, as the Italian place was pretty poor...

We loved this hotel, specially our view of the bay. We were greeted at the train by the staff and service all around was great. From concierge, to check in, to room service, everything excellent. We enjoyed the complimentary bottle to celebrate our trip. Thank you!

This is my 2nd stay in this hotel in 2 years and Shangri-La Tokyo continues to live up to its excellent reputation.This is a beautiful hotel with great views of the Tokyo city and it has lovely paintings adorning the walls of the hotel corridors.The hotel takes good care of their guests even prior to check in. They had agreed to store my bags for me a day before I checked in because I wanted to go to an onsen first. I really appreciated their flexibility. The concierge at the basement was polite and made everything easy. Check in the next day was prompt and the reception staff was polite and friendly. The room was beautiful and spacious. Mine had views of sprawling Tokyo Station. Room was clean and everything felt luxurious. I loved that the hotel provides L'occitane bath products for its guests. Loved it!The bed was comfortable and the staff gladly brought over new pillows when requested. The bathroom was spacious, by Japanese standards the room is large! Came with bathtub and a separate shower area.When we asked for extra wine glasses, the staff took the trouble to find out the type of wine red and brought the appropriate glasses which I thought was really professional.Location wise the hotel is next to Tokyo station so traveling around the city was really easy. There are tons of food places nearby and inside Tokyo station. Daimaru, a large mall is also next door. Check out was swift and efficient. Overall the staff were polite and professional and very helpful.I love love this hotel. The room rate is not cheap though but if you want to feel pampered and enjoy the good things in life, stay here! It's the best in Tokyo me thinks!

My husband and I spent 4 nights in Apr 10-15 as part of our Tokyo trip. It was an extremely comfy one. The room we had was huge with a good view of the Skytree. The staff were attentive and courteous. The breakfast at the Piacere was delicious with enough options on buffet table though our order was mistaken once. Checkin and checkout were efficient and gave a very good impression to us.We enjoyed our stay very much and Shangri-la Tokyo will not disappoint you for sure.

The service, views, location, rooms, swimming pool and bar are all incredible. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The interiors are gorgeous, and a special shout out goes to their complimentary PJs.. I never wanted to leave!

I travel extensively and can say without a doubt this is the best run hotel I've ever stayed in, and that includes other Shangri-La properties in Paris and London. This is a lesson on how to run a luxury hotel, everything from check-in (by the loverly Misako) to check out was perfection - 5 stars is not enough! The only complaint I have is the food in the Horizon Lounge was not of the standard of some other club level lounges I've stayed in, but everything else, the service, the food (especially breakfast), the comfort of the rooms, was impeccable!

A top hotel at a top price Huge room by any standard - great bathroom - locittane toiletries Also beautiful soaking tub with bath salts provided Great tv with Bose Sound system Soft sheets - Nespresso machine- desk with amazing stationary set etc etc

If I could award six stars I would for this hotel. It's hard to imagine any hotel offering a better experience than what we had on our early April visit. We booked a Horizon Club room and had a stunning 36 floor corner room that was equipped with everything you could ever want during your stay. But the friendliness and warmth of the staff was truly outstanding and made the stay even more enjoyable. There wasn't anything that you needed to be done that wasn't met with a smile and attentive service. Whether it was shipping our luggage ahead to our next destination so we didn't have to bother with it on the Shinkansen train, or personally escorting us to the train station or the friendly greetings , by name, of the club staff even on the second morning, it was all first class. The staff was delightful and only added to the great experience of this luxury hotel. Their English skills were excellent and they made you feel that there wasn't anything that they wouldn't do for you to make your stay the very best it could be. We are used to staying in 5 star hotels and the Shangri-la ranks with the very best we have ever stayed in. And...it is close to the Tokyo station, Imperial Palace and the Ginza shopping area. What a great combination of elements!

Beautiful. Great service. A real treat. Close to transportation. Food in hotel is quite good and elegantly served and arranged. Concierge is helpful with maps and information to make this your base to go out and explore.

Strategically located near the Tokyo station, Within walking distance to shopping area and restaurantsExcellent overall services, front office, concierge, housekeeping Flexible breakfast timing until 1130

Our stay in Shangri La was great. The check in process was fast, and our rooms were fabulous. The bathroom is large enough and had all the necessities, I loved the fact they used L'Occitane as their products. The only problem we faced with the room is that the buttons were somehow confusing although there is an explanation; also, some buttons in the room end up turning off the lights in the bathroom. Furthermore, their service was excellent! The staff were really kind and helpful. My little brother had hiccups on his way to the elevator, the lady at the entrance of the hotel ran quickly to bring water for him even though we didn't told them to. That was really a kind gesture from her.The breakfast area is luxurious and the bakery was satisfying. I also loved how there are many options available in their menu. My favorite order is the French toast infused with chocolate! One morning we faced a problem with some of our orders from the breakfast menu as we didn't receive them after waiting 30 minutes. We were really mad so we ended up cancelling the order. However, all other days were fine and our orders were perfectly on time!Overall, I would definitely stay in this hotel if I went to Tokyo in the future.

The Shangri-LA Experience is truly a reflection of their employees and Tokyo Shangri-LA even steps it up a notch. From the moment we checked in everyone greeted us so warmly and professionally. The service is impeccable but not over the top where you feel there is an intrusion to your privacy. If your budget allows upgrade to the Club Level Rooms so you have access to the Horizon Club. The staff makes a concerted effort to get to personally know you, greet you by name and are so helpful. Even before we arrived the team at the Horizon Club assisted with so many arrangements from Train Tickets, Dining Reservations and went so far to have a someone from the Bell Staff escort us to the train station. And that is where we had the chance to meet Moe - the best brand ambassador there can be. It's these special touches that make staying at Shangri-La such a wonderful experience.This particular location is directly across from Tokyo Train Station so it makes it very easy to get where you need to go for all the different Tokyo train lines - even the "bullet train". The hotel is very discreet and quiet but yet warm and inviting. The rooms are lovely as we stayed several years ago in a smaller room, but it was still roomy by Tokyo standards. This time we stayed in a Club Level Suite and it was very comfortable (just need to get a better blow dryer for all the female guests). The hotel is great for business or leisure - or a combination of both. We will definitely stay at this property again.

We just finished our first visit to Japan and we could have not been taken care of better in Tokyo than by the Shangri-La staff and the Horizon Club team. We received word a week before arriving - by personal long-distance phone call no less! that the Horizon Club floor would be taken over by a delegation (we were told later by locals it was probably the Saudi Royal Family). We would have to be moved with the club lounge to another floor or we could cancel our reservation without penalty. Worried but too overwhelmed by last-minute details of our trip, we decided to make a go of it and thought we would be looked after anyway. "Looked after" was an understatement. From the quick response by email on the NEX train to be met at Tokyo Station right outside our NEX train car, to the beautiful food choices at the Club Lounge, to the spacious, luxurious room, the Shangri-la exceeded our expectations beyond our dreams.Our room was almost a corner room on the 32nd floor and we had a stunning view of Tokyo and the Tokyo Skytree. The room had everything we needed; the bed was a bit hard but was quickly made softer by the housekeeping crew at a moment's notice and was perfect for the rest of our stay. Every day we would come back to an immaculately clean room. We are at a loss for any criticism but to split hairs, we found the lighting in the rooms a bit dark and would have liked higher wattage lighting.We decided to take our breakfast every day in Piacere for more selections; we were not sorry as the breakfast buffet though not huge had many sumptuous choices, specifically the exquisite pastries all themed for spring, some with delicate icing details and strawberry fillings. The Horizon Club was seamlessly moved to part of the Lobby Lounge, and though we experienced one night in the actual Horizon Lounge before the temporary move, we felt we did not have any lack of service or amenities. It was wonderful to come "home" after 6 or 8 hour days to the lounge, have a very nice afternoon tea, then have enough appetizer food choices to make an early dinner (as we did for quite a few nights as we were too exhausted from site-seeing) plus more desserts until 10 pm if you wished! We also found the next-door Daimaru Dept. Store restaurant floor good for reasonably priced dinners. It was also nice to chat with the Horizon Club concierges about our day and they were truly interested and engaged without being obtrusive.Each and every member of the team, I am sorry to forget their names as they were all special, could not do enough for you. From arrangement of Disney Sea tickets, getting our Japan Rail Passes activated, to our luggage being shipped to Kyoto, everything was done quickly and efficiently. Also we were offered escorts to and from Tokyo Station as often as we wished - it is truly a mini city in itself and very overwhelming for first-timers. We found the Nihonbashi Station more manageable and used it for most of our excursions. However if you do find yourself braving Tokyo station, remember the Yaesu exits will get you back to the hotel, Yaesu North being closer. With the use of a pocket wifi (complimentary for Horizon Club guests) and Google Maps we got to and from Tokyo Station and around Tokyo quite well. Google Maps, Google Translate and the Hyperdia apps and pocket wifi were invaluable for our trip all over Japan.You will not find better location, views and 5 Star value in Tokyo than the Shangri-La; trust me I had researched them all. Let the team at Shangri-La take care of you, especially if you are a first timer in Tokyo. At the end of each day, they will truly make you feel like you are coming home. We loved Japan and plan to return; we would not hesitate to book there again.

I stayed in this hotel between March and April and I really enjoyed my stay there. The hotel is really great and the staff is so helping and welcoming. The rooms are also nice and the bathroom is modern, too. The only problem I had is with the breakfast. Not about the food (it's great) it's about the delay. I once ordered to 2 orders from the menu (not from the buffet), but after a period of time I realized that no one brought for me my food. Then, I reminded the staff about it TWICE while 30 minutes has passed and no one brought for me the order. Then, I told them that I want to cancel it, they said they're sorry, and offered me to take something from the bakery. However, I didn't as I was angry, and I believe that they should've expressed the apology more but I realized they didn't put much effort into their mistake...I would've give Shang-ri La a 5 but for the breakfast issue, I have given them a 4.

A kuxurious hotel, with lovely staff, amazing food and breath taking views. When I caught a cold, the cleaning lady got me ice, extra tea, offered me to call a doctor, etc. I felt cared for. Very kind.

We book via grand luxuary hotel.com as we readed in trypadviser review. They include free upgrade ,complimentary breakfast for two and100usd credit. They gave us two category upgraded!! To horrizon club floor! And Miss Park ,our manager kindly gave us club prevalege as well,thankyou so much for your hospitality and your warmest welcome which made us truely more than home!! The lift was decorate with swaroveski crystal and chandelliar. The room was spaciously large for 5luggages we brought. The bathroom is so luxuary and they gave us lovely gift set in the bathroom and delicious chocholate.my family agree that this hotel tops all the other shangrila hotels!!

Great to stay at the Shangri-La Tokyo. Without doubt one of the very best. Accommodation and staff superb. After a long week, it was great to re-charge before the long flight back to the UK. The in-room dining was excellent. Would fully recommend the Shangri-La Tokyo.
user_name:
wmj630
Neath Port Talbot, United Kingdom

review_body: The views, the breakfasts and the service are world class. Check in in the room was great after a long flight. Loads of complimentary water.The pool is nice and big enough for laps.The only let down for us was the room service dinner - one of the orders was wrong and none of the dishes were memorable.

With my birthday coming up, my husband booked an Horizon Club room for 5 nights to celebrate the occasion. When booking we took the transfers option to and from the hotel - a fantastic idea and a seamless elegant way to arrive in Tokyo. On arrival we were checked into a beautiful room with a view of the royal gardens and the city. For the next five days the Horizon Club Manager and staff pampered us, arranged dinner bookings, and looked after us with delicious breakfasts and pre dinner drinks/ canapes each evening in the Horizon Club Lounge. Whatever the need they were there to assist. The lap pool on the Health Club floor is magnificent 20-25 metres long.The time in Tokyo was far too short ,we're looking forward to our next stay.

I go to Tokyo several times a year, and stayed here at least 4-5x past 3 years. I usually attend business conference in Japan, but I prefer it over the conference hotels which may be more convenient as I feel that I sleep and rest better here. I also prefer the location as it's a short walk to Tokyo station where are lots of shops including Yoku Moku cookie store and character shops (e.g. Miffy, Hello Kitty etc) where I can buy souvenirs/gifts. However, the standout character of the hotel is its high level of quality level. Most 5-star hotels in Tokyo usually don't disappoint on services, but I still found the telephone operator, room-service order taker, or concierge desk to be exceptionally well-trained, prompt and courteous. One time I asked a front desk person if I could eat at the Japanese restaurant a few levels (I believe) above the lobby; he tried to call the restaurant and, when there was no answer, he literally sprinted up the stairs to get an answer for me and came back breathing heavily. I certainly appreciated the effort even tough I decided to eat in the Italian restaurant on the lobby level instead. Another time I asked the front desk person to help me book a seat on the Narita express train; he asked me to leave the ticket with him and did it, but I later realized (after staying at the Prince Park Tower Hotel) that he must have walked all the way to the train station to get me the seating arrangement as apparently it was not doable online or by phone according to the Prince Park Tower Hotel.I am not sure if it's location or luck, but I have had a lot more luck getting a taxi here than i ever did at the Four Seasons. Both hotels tried to help you with taxi of course, but it seems like a taxi is always waiting at the Shangri-La in the B2 level and can respond quickly. In terms of food, the Japanese breakfast (room service) is also among my favorites; although it's not inexpensive it's reasonable by Tokyo standard and I prefer it over the one at the Four Seasons, also nearby. If you have time, you must have the egg Benedict in the lobby restaurant for breakfast; it's among the best I have tried around the world. I have also had dinner there, but the experience is more mixed with dinner as table service was draggingly slow. And of course you are paying hotel prices.One small complaint is the small gym which can feel a bit tight with all the exercise equipment if you want to work out. The pool is nice and the locker room and sauna/spa are both nice and well-maintained.Value for the money is hard to say; I think it's well worth the money if you are not going during peak seasons (e.g. April). The price can double (as I discovered) during these peak tourist seasons.

I'd stay here every time if my schedule permit. Favorite part was the mixology in the lounge after dark. The room was quaint but very cozy and comfortable, I regretted that we had but a single night to stay.

I have stayed at The SL Tokyo Station in February/March for the last 5 years and am happy to say that the experience continues to be 5*. The hotel, the room, the spa and the food are amazing. The Horizon Club is the best managed lounge in the business. Remembering my name after a year was absolutely astonishing. They even asked, by name, how my son Jack was doing, and that was 3 years ago!! It's the best location in Tokyo. Perfectly central and convenient. Breakfast is amazing. Abundant selections! Kudos to the chef. Service is equally on point. Staff at the fitness center are great. The office Manager, Yumi, made sure my most recent stay was amazing. She is an asset to the organization! I wouldn't stay any where else in Tokyo.

I may be jumping the gun here by writing this review before my actual planned stay in a few weeks...but I was so impressed by the service I received from the concierge staff so far...I was inspired to write this review. My husband and I were watching Anthony Bourdain and there was a sushi restaurant that he visited that we wanted to try. Emailed the hotel and got the confirmation for the reservation within less than 24 hours. My kids and I are huge Miyazaki film fans and we wanted to visit the Ghibli museum. The tickets are sold 3month prior to foreign visitors and there were no tickets available for our April visit. I could not get any tickets even after searching for numerous websites even willing to pay the extra fees. Again, emailed the hotel and they confirmed our tickets, for our very first choice entrance time and date. And it actually costed us fraction of what we would have paid if we had bought tickets through third party travel websites. They were prompt, professional, and got the job done. It was the most competent concierge service I have ever experienced. If the service is this great already, I cannot wait to see what it's like during our actual visit.Maybe I can challenge them to score me a Kelly bag...

This hotel is just perfect for a city break. Spotless rooms, nice service, friendly staff, and good amenities make it an exceptional place to be. Also for all us shopping maniacs its also a great location. In short, its outstanding!

This hotel is perhaps the best I have ever stayed in. The staff, decor, location, amenities and overall service are simply outstanding. Misako (Guest Relations Manager) and Barthelemy (Breakfast Manager) are two people that standout but everyone is simply wonderful from the bell boy to the gym manager. If you are trying to work out where to stay in Tokyo and have it down to the final two or three, then just stop your search and stay at the Shangri-La (if your budget allows!!).

In the Singaporean Gran Turismo's humble opinion, the Shangri-La Tokyo is one of the best hotels in the world. This hotel's architecture; room layout, fittings, and amenities; and location are excellent. However, the one factor that makes me come stay here whenever I am in Tokyo is the peerless service from their staff.Examples of their best-of-class service: (a) their concierge helped me reserve some hard-to-book restaurants months ahead of my arrival, and in a diligent and methodical manner; (b) I always request for extra pillows, but forgot to do so on this trip - to my surprise, the exact number of extra pillows I like were already in my room when I checked in; (c) whilst bringing us to our train platform, their bell-hop Hiroko Chida helped us locate the exact ekiben we were looking to buy for our shinkansen ride to Hokkaido - in the maze that is Tokyo Station, this extra mile was much appreciated; and (d) on the return shinkansen ride, whilst bringing us back to the hotel, the same bell-hop helped us purchase Narita Express tickets for the train ride to the airport the following day - her English was excellent, and although she was in a rush to complete the task, she always made us feel both like friends and VIPs!Bravo!

excellent location..very friendly and professional staff..the room was exceptional..beautiful city view with 'lost in translation' vibe..the bathroom was unique and the bathtub a dream..but the best was the bed..will never forget these pillows..

Tokyo is the best city in the world for 5-star hotels. I have stayed at the Ritz, The Conrad, The Grand Hyatt, The Mandarin, and the Shangri-La. They are all amazing.Really, if you're staying at any 5 star hotel what it comes down to is where you want to be. The Shangri-La is an excellent location for shopping and tourism - easily walk to the Ginza, and it is literally on top of Tokyo Station so you can easily walk there from the Narita Express. It's also a short walk away from the Imperial Palace, which is one of the few places where its easy to get a long uninterrupted run in in this city.Service was great - concierge helped me with a difficult to get reservation and the bellhops were super courteous and did a lot of logistical nonsense for me. I'd say the Shangri-La had juuust slightly better service than the rest. It does, however, have the least spectacular buffet breakfast - while the pastry section is maybe the best, overall it is pretty small.

Happy to enjoy the famed Shangri-La experience again. Restored my faith in the shangrila brand after the bad one in Shangri-la Suzhou . Pleasantly surprised to note that most, if not all of the staff there spoke impeccable English and offered very professional and personalized service. Special mention for Barty (breakfast Mgr) and Mikey of the ADD restaurant,Ayaka and Yuko of the Horizon Club and Park Hyejung who checked us in and took care of all our needs. Tks also to Suzuki San DoS, who showed us around. Just a comment on the checkout experience which was a damper after the wonderful stay experience. Club Mgr was aloof and not helpful. Other than that , an overall wonderful experience. Will definitely return on my next bz trip to Tokyo.

We stayed five nights in the large room overlooking the park. The hotel has a great location right next to Tokyo main train station: easy to get to Starbucks for coffee and easy to wander around nearby department stores. The staff were super attentive and you felt spoiled. The bathroom was large and the towels luxurious. While expensive this was a nice treat and a nice place to stay out of the rain that we had every day in Tokyo. Do take advantage of their offer to have someone take you to the train station so you can take the train back to Narita airport. It was a tad confusing. We tried to give the fellow who helped us our subway passes which still had money on them. He took them and about 10 minutes later he came back with cash as he handed them in and got cash for us. That was kind of wild as we certainly did not expect it. But that shows you the excellent service you get when you pay the money for an excellent hotel.

Stayed for 3 nights in this nice hotel, which is very conveniently located next to Tokyo station and to the Otemachi subway station. Hotel is on the top floors of the building (direct elevators to the lobby) with nice views over the city. Rooms spacious and very comfortable (nice details like a Nespresso-machine). Staff very attentive. Arranged train tickets to Narita airport for me without extra charge and also escorted me to the right platform ( through the maze of Tokyo station). Perfect service by staff member Risa Seino!The hotel also has a very nice swimming pool at the 28 floor, with also a gym, sauna and hot bath. All very clean and you have also a nice view over the imperial gardens from the swimming pool. Would definitely return.

Shangri La at Tokyo is the epitome of luxury. It was at the right location next to Tokyo Station which made getting in and out very easy. Service was brilliant and was a notch above some of the other Shangri La hotels I've stayed at. Food was good, the rooms were huge with wonderful city views (or Imperial Garden depending on which side you stayed). Overall was fantastic and one of the better Shangri La hotels.

The hotel is exteremly convieneint with the Tokyo Station right next to the hotel. The view was amazing with a beautiful room to go with it. The staff were extremely helpful for all matters that we had. Would recommend to anyone who wants to stay in the Ginza/Tokyo Station area.

I came here as the Proud Trailing (male) Spouse. A first for me :)Great and elegant hotel right next door to the Tokyo Railway Station.Easy walk to the Imperial Palace Gardens too.The staff go way out of their way to provide that famous Japanese sophisticated and friendly service.The ladies in the Lobby Lounge are glorious. So friendly and efficient.They always welcomed us back, and popped by our table regularly to say hi when their shifts changed.The best service was provided to us by Naoya Shiraishi in the Piacere Restaurant.After being advised by our initial waiter that we weren't able to have our lunchtime Green Smoothie for breakfast, when Shiraishi-san passed by our table to ask how we were enjoying Tokyo (he had served us the day before for lunch), we jokingly said we were disappointed we couldn't have our Smoothie for Breakfast.He just made it happen. Within 10 minutes he delivered two Green Smoothies to our table.Now that is Japanese 5 Star Hotel Service.Well done Shiraishi-san. I hope your hotel management appreciate your value, and are prepared to invest in your career.

Can't fault this Hotel. Is was everything you would wish to have in a Hotel. The service, the ambience, the fabulous decor. The amazing food choices for breakfast. Where does one get, eggs benedict with lobster and black caviar as a choice. This was in the horizon club. Sometime things aren't worth what you have paid. But in this Hotel you always got more. Had a beautiful bar on the 28th Floor. So luxurious and beautiful.The accomodation was first class. The service everywhere was like , you were the most special person on earth. Who wouldn't love it.

I certainly had the best stay of my life in Shangri-la Tokyo... Everything from start to end was just perfect. The staff is so elegant, polite, professional and helpful, our whole experience in this hotel has reach perfection. I honestly think that there is no better place to stay while visiting Tokyo. Thank you so much, we are in a hurry to come back to Shangri-la Tokyo!

This is one very nice luxury hotel . Service is outstanding from the front desk , concierge , restaurant staff to housekeeping . The room is beautiful and spacious and well equipped with all amenities and good personal care products . They even provide us with pyjamas. Breakfast is very good . I especially appreciated the late breakfast we could enjoy at the lounge when we woke up late. Location wise, it's next to Tokyo station, so convenient for travel . We even left our big suitcases at the hotel as we went on a 3day trip to Kyoto. All in all, It's a great place to stay .

After a long (first class) flight from Zürich to Tokyo, we arrived by train to Central Station, where already a bellboy (in this case, a bellgirl) waited for us directly at the right track. She guided us to the hotel and we had to wait for a short while for our room at the breakfast bar. They upgraded us to a wonderful corner suite with a wonderful view over the old train station and town. The service was impeccable all three days and breakfast buffet very opulent. We stayed at three different hotels, because we wanted to find out, which one is best. The first one was Shangri-La, the second one The Peninsula and the third one Mandarin Oriental. We stayed at all hotels for three days, a total of nine days. I booked all hotels through GrandLuxuryHotels and have been very pleased by the service offered and all the upgrades we received. At Shangri-La it was an upgrade to a corner suite, complimentary breakfast and high speed internet, plus a US 100 Hotel credit, early check-in and check-out plus a 4G pocket Wifi. Great bargains! We had a very pleasant stay, one of our best stays in a hotel ever. Thank you Shangri-La GrandLuxury Hotels for this pleasant stay and the great service you provided for us during this Christmas!

My stay at Shangri La Tokyo was excellent...Perfect service, excellent location, fantastic room, great amenities (Occitane)If you book there, ask for a room with Tokyo Station view (better than "Tokyo bay" view)I saw 2 time the chef at the Lounge... surprisingly, both time, he has greeted only the Japanese guests... Maybe he doesn't speak English, but it is a pity as I had the impression to be ignored :-)Definitely, i will go back to Shangri La Tokyo

This is the 4th time I have stayed in Tokyo but the first time with the family. Exceptional service and location. Concierge was spot-on for recommendations.. the complementary escort service to our trains at the Tokyo service was far and beyond my expectations.

I wish I could live here. It was Amazing. One thing you don't get back in life is time. So stop reading my review and go stay at Shangri-la Tokyo. The Spa In Room Dinning plus Staff made our stay worth it. My Husband said for our next vacation he wants to stay at another Shangri-la

Amazing view of Tokyo skyline from the Horizon Club Lounge. Excellent service and hospitality provided by Hideko, Ayaka and Horizon team. Everything was flawless from our arrival to departure. Will surely return on my next stay to Tokyo.

There's nothing not to like about the Shangri La in Tokyo - apart from the cost of course! Its a proper 5 star experience with superb rooms and public areas. Its half of the top floor of a tower block right next to Tokyo station so a doddle to get to from the airport by train (the whole Japanese train system is so simple and brilliant) so no need for a taxi - head for the bus depot exit. The staff are outstanding all with great English (inc the room maids) and the polish you'd expect from the brand. There's a spa and a great bar area where they serve afternoon tea with live chamber music.There's a big ballroom so lots of weddings. The restaurant is as you'd expect and the breakfasts are amazing!Views over the station can be noisy even though you can see into the Imperial Palace so get a room on the other side if you can. Special shout out to the lady porters who are very chic and super helpful - we took the train and they walked us onto the platform with our bags!

Very good location, very large and modern room, very nice breakfast. However, the service did not match its reputation. We have visited some other Shangri-la chain hotels in the world, the front of Tokyo Shangri-La showed the most arrogant and carelessness underneath his fake politeness ever.

Wonderful location, friendly staff, perfect for business meetings and conferences. Delicious food and very comfortable stay for me. I highly reccomend it to everyone for a wonderful stay in lovely Tokyo.

These days, the point of difference between high-end hotels often boils down to the nature and quality of the service. In terms of bling, hotels can rival each other in terms of jaw-dropping design and use of luxe materials. It only depends on how deep the pocket is. However, when it comes down to service, the choice of staff and the training provided can often give it an intangible quality that elevates the hotel above others. Too much effusiveness on the part of the staff can be stifling and too little comes off cold. The Shangri-la in Tokyo got the formula just right. Amazing staff that are warm with just the right touch of personal care made us feel like we were coming home each time we returned after a day of sightseeing. From the doorman to the attendant at the Cake counter to just about everyone, we met on the way to our room, we were always greeted with a bow and a smile and a warm greeting. We never felt like it was a put-on and felt genuinely happy seeing the staff each day as well. We upgraded to the Horizon Club level and this became our home away from home. Part of the upgrade package includes daily breakfast and evening canapés and drinks in a buffet style. The food is excellent throughout and the upgrade package is IMHO good value for money. You also get to check out at the Horizon level and it also acts like a concierge service. In fact, the staff booked our Disneysea tickets for us while we were having evening drinks. The room we stayed in was a Premier room at 65 sqm. Lavish as per Shangri-la standards, it was in impeccable condition. The bathroom with separate bath and shower in one 'room' was very clean and the Japanese toilet has a heated seat which certainly was a comfort in winter! In terms of the hotel's location, you certainly could not ask for better. Located in The Marunochi Trust building, it is literally next to Tokyo station, a vast under and above- ground metropolis that not only hosts the Shinkansen service and local trains and Metro but also a mind boggling array of shops and restaurants that could rival a suburban mall. Daimaru has an enormous multilevel store here as well. We have, as per many who travel often, stayed in countless hotels. Very few would offer the right combination of service, quality and value that would make us come back for more. Still fewer would, in our mind, qualify as a home away from home. The Shangri-la in Tokyo certainly fits this bill to a T.

This hotel provides luxury standard, very suitable to business as centrally located in the heart of Tokyo. Easy access to shopping, offices and place of interest. Highly recommended to business traveller.

Generally good, except for a small minor glitch: some staff are not good at attending guests.It's really case by case, and depending on which one you meet. Service quality is dependent on who handles it.

Brand loyalty is difficult to build, after all, five star hotels have similar beddings, toiletries and food; people are the intangible factor that make a hotel great . The staff here made our first stay with the Shangri-La brand a pleasure. The general manager, Mr. Marcus Bauder, has been doing an incredible job to this hotel, and we could see his imprint; his staff seem genuinely happy and dedicated. The Shangri-La Tokyo goes above and beyond: prompt and helpful services, in addition to giving us the directions and instructions, we were personally escorted to the ticket counter at the Tokyo Station. Furthermore, the staff pays meticulous attention to detail, and nothing was amiss: the rooms were spotless, the toiletries, treats, and welcome amenities were beautifully wrapped and arranged. It was also very heart warming to be consistently addressed by name and welcomed back every time we returned. Kudos to Mr. Nicholas Liang and Ms. Erina Sasaki who have made our stay memorable. I highly recommend the Shangri-La Hotel, Tokyo, and if its standard of service rings true to the brand, Shangri-La has won our business.

We were unable to book the Tokyo Disneysea Miracosta due to our typical last minute planning. Other second-tier Disney hotels were charging between $750-1,000, hence hubs thought the Shang would be a better option since it was right at the Tokyo station, which connected directly to Maihama station via the Keiyo line. We ended up choosing the Horizon club room which offered really good value for money.A proper extra bed was set up for our 6 year old. This is important to us as we like to have abundant sleeping space for the three of us. Many hotels in Tokyo barely have room for one to move around after putting in the luggage, let alone an extra bed, so this pretty much sealed the deal for us. There was no lack of space after putting in the extra bed. We even shifted its position ourselves as it was originally placed directly under the air con duct. A complimentary LTE wifi device was provided. The battery was able to last the entire day, unlike the ones provided by other hotels we have been at, which lasted only a few hours.The horizon club deal allowed us to have lounge access for breakfast and cocktails. The canapes and desserts were not extremely tasty, however, the quality was acceptable and we also enjoyed our cocktail drinks. For breakfast, we were able to access the main buffet on the 28F, which offered a bigger spread. The eggs benedict selection was excellent. We enjoyed the scones, danish pastries, oriental noodle, nutella pancakes, nasi goreng, and the juicy sweet honeydew! The coffee could be stronger, and temperature slightly higher. The best part about the package was the ability to have complimentary in-room dining. We chose this option the days we were visiting Disney.Amenities-wise, we were pleasantly surprised with the pjs, which were changed daily. The bvlgari toiletries were light and not drying on the hair and skin. Stockings, miniature shiseido facial toiletries, loccitane hand cream were also provided but I did not use them. On the third day, housekeeping provided a toiletry kit meant for children, as well as kids-sized bedroom slippers on the second day. We appreciated the gesture, especially the thought. One tip for the hotel - our kid couldn't quite reach the sink so toothbrushing was a bit of a challenge. Some hotels we have been at provide a small step stool. We were sure it would have been provided had we asked, but we simply got our kid to tiptoe as high as she could. We did indicate via email our request for a water ionizer, support pillow and bolster, which were in the room the moment we checked in. The hotel provides a meet and greet service if you take the narita express. All you had to do was email your flight details beforehand, and call them once you have your train cabin and arrival time details. This is an extremely useful service for travelers like us with young kids and huge luggage. The hotel also provided a guide to bring us to the train platform for our disney visit and departure for Osaka, and assisted us with translation as we purchased our suica cards and nozomi (bullet train) tickets. Our first guide even remembered this was hubs fifth stay - very impressive. From a location perspective, we struggled with food. There were no lack of restaurants but somehow, they failed to satisfy our foodie desires. When we were staying at the Peninsula previously, the concierge had delighted us with food recommendations around the area. We didn't have much chance to properly check out food options with our concierge this time round. Will test it out the next time we are back. We can't wait to be back!

This hotel has amazing decor in every aspect and some employees go that extra mile. The rooms are impeccably clean and the view from the 36th floor is incredible. I however asked for a 4pm check out as others had asked and was told 1pm is the latest, I feel based on my age we are discriminated against. What's good for one person should be good for another and telling me to just go into my parents room should suffice, this is not 5 star service it's actually quite demeaning considering I have my own separate reservation. I also question the quality of the lounge and I don't think it's worth paying the extra in comparison to other hotels Lounges. I enjoyed my two night stay at the Shangri la Tokyo however, I probably would not come back.

I moved from the Four Seasons because the train noise was bothering me too much. I ended up on the 36th floor and everything was quiet despite my view over the rail tracks. The hotel is exquisitly appointed, staff extremely friendly. Hotel is absolutely fantastic, if I found a better rate, I would return with more certainty.
user_name:
Thomas443
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Spent 3 nights in the Shangri-La, Tokyo. Stayed in Executive suite on concierge level. Staff was outstanding, concierge level was more expensive but worth it especially with the staff there. They gave excellent directions and maps. One even walked with us to the subway to make sure we had the correct line and car going to where we wanted. Also nice place for coffee and light breakfast in morning and for drink and snack after touring all day without having to go to the restaurant. Breakfast in Restaurant was excellent and great variety - did not try at dinner.

I've been in Tokyo 6 times and always stayed at the Shangi-la hotel and I am always happy to return! I stay at the concierge level and always enjoy the breakfast with so many options and the complementary drinks and snacks during the day, always delicious!Amazing service form the concierge level staff, helpful, nice, and perfect english speaking.Nice rooms, good size, and beautiful bathrooms.For me it is the hotel to stay for it's convenient location near the Tokyo Central station but mainly for the quality and service!

I had the privilege of overnighting at the Shangri-La upon arrival in Tokyo en route to Kyoto.The hotel is perfectly positioned alongside the Tokyo Station which is a treasure trove in itself with fabulous shops and gourmet grocery stores in the cleanest, most pristine setting.The hotel itself has unparalleled levels of service where nothing was too much for any member of staff from the porters to the reception desk. The rooms are magnificent with city views and so many amenities for anything you might have accidentally left behind. The beds are incredibly comfortable and the rooms marvellously turned out.The piece de reistance for me was the lovely little touch of a laquered, origami crane that was delivered with my room service dinner that night! It's always the little things!I would return to the Shangri-La in a heartbeat.

Ami met us at our train car as we arrived from the airport. She was a delight, helping us navigate through the underground halls of the Tokyo Train Station and she gave us many valuable tips to help us with our first visit to Japan. (My daughter called the hotel when we knew the train car and arrival time to arrange for the pickup) The room was extraordinary with breath taking views of the city. Pajamas, robes and slippers were provided. I like to drink a lot of water and our housekeeping person thoughtfully left me extra bottles of water. All the staff were kind and helpful. Terrific location right next to Tokyo Train Station made traveling through the city easy. Would definitely stay at another Shangri La Hotel!

I was going to give the Shangri-La five stars until we booked out. When presented with the bill we were surprised to see a daily service fee of 14% on top of the price that was quoted and when we asked what is was we were told it is a 'tip' for turning down the bed at night. We booked five nights and they only turned down the bed twice on the other two occasions I had the 'do not disturb' light on and one night we did NOT leave the 'do not disturb' light on only to find a card outside our door the next morning. We have been charged for five nights and they only came twice. In some countries it would be illegal not to declare all fees at time of booking or check-in. It adds quite a bit extra to your bill. Be careful if you use in tea/coffee making facilities in the room we could not work out which ones were complementary or which ones you would be billed 800yen so I went and bought my own coffee and tea. Rooms are very big and beautiful. Pool area although indoors lovely and gym looked good. I was very impressed that the staff had set us up as non Japanese speaking guest so when we experienced an earthquake (6.9) at 6am in the morning we had a siren and message alerting us that we are about to experience an earthquake ( all this in Shangri-La book so I was well prepared when I heard the siren). Great location very beautiful part of Tokyo. Very convenient for Tokyo station and business area. This is our second visit in twelve months but not sure if I will stay here again because of the service fee (tip) I know it sounds petty but I really love honesty and all fees should be disclosed at time of booking I'm not sure if they think if they add this fee into your daily rate that they would loose a lot of business because guests would be so shocked at the daily rate.

After snowboarding for a week in niseko this is just what I needed One minute walk from the train so it's so easy to explore the city The room was amazing first class and the staff where so helpful and excellent English Loved all the little restaurants around that we could walk to We will be back again

Lobby is conveniently located at a higher floor with nice views; nice spacious bar area as well at same level; the rooms are spacious and spotless; the breakfast was a bit of a search for what I needed, and not really buffet style when you're used to large continental breakfast buffets; but overall a good experience!

The moment I stepped in to this hotel, OMG. Everything is so extremely lavish! The hotel paid every attention to the details of all the areas, from lobby, to the restaurants, to the rooms, to the pool, to the gym and sauna etc. For a 5 star hotel, of course I expected the place to be clean, the staffs to speak English etc, and yes, Shangri-La Tokyo passed this. But not so on food, I will elaborate more below.The Location is superbly good, just next to Tokyo train station.Staffs are superb helpful and polite. They tried their very best to assist me. They made me feel like home. In fact, better than home.The normal room is super spacious, they have separations for toilets, wash basin, bath, and then bedroom. I never felt the lack of space at all.Breakfast was provided for my case. From 6am to 10am, you get to choose from a list of the ala carte menu, and WITH buffet too. But from 10am to 11am, you only get to choose from the ala carte menu. Such generous for breakfast hours, 6am to 11am!!! The hotel hopes you can eat to enjoy, rather than hoping you not to eat to save cost. Having said so, the food quality is not consistent, sometimes on par, sometimes sub par 5 star standard. The ala carte pastries are not warm, they are left to cold. I have ordered Japanese meal from their menu, the grilled salmon fish was overly salty, cold and overly cooked. I fed back to the waitress, she offered to replace another set, but I was already quite full. Also coffee served is not fresh from the machine, it is from a hot tumbler. I was expecting hot and freshly brewed/pressed coffee, so was a bit disappointed. I then ordered for a cup of cappuccino, it was expecting human intervention in making it, but it was straight from the machine. Again disappointed. On the other note, the dim sum served in the buffet are was sub par. In short, food quality is not consistent, and therefore sub par of 5 star standard! The pool is heated, both the indoor air and water. Free flow of fruits and juices and water. So you wont starve during or after the exercise. The changing room is equipped with a cloth spin machine, meaning you can leave the place with your "washed" clothes that are almost dry after spinning at 1500 1600 rpm.There are airport limousines directly at B1, so I never had any issue of transferring to the airport. Overall, I am VERY happy with the hotel. Even though food was sub par, the other areas e.g. the lavish furnishing and deco, the ultra helpful staffs, the location etc have outwit the shortfall.In short, YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!

We were affected by the earthquake this morning. We were in the lift when bells went off and so we got out and sat on the floor in the corridor. We cannot thank the staff at Shangri-La enough. Bell boys ran up and down stairs with our luggage and also changed our tickets all while the hotel is swaying. All we had to do was wait. Now on our train. Terrific staff cannot say enough about a hotel that responds in a difficult situation.

We have an extremely happy memorable stay at the Shangri L La in Toyko,very beautiful room,amenities are great! Very warm hearted,respective,happy staffs,tasty high quallity food,enjoy very much,will definitely come back again.

Last month due to a business trip I stayed a few days at the Shangri -la in Tokyo.The rooms were outstanding in design, outfit and cleanness.What I really will keep in my memories is the helpfulness and friendly nature of all the employees in this hotel.Within short notice they arranged a late checkout as my flight back to Europe was late in the evening.As I hadn't planned ahead of time to get a reservation for dinner in their world renowned japanese restaurant I was a bit disappointed upon arrival.The hotel staff went through all efforts to get me still a place with my friends even forthe arrival day already .Needless to say that we were all very pleased with our stay until the end.

Such a warm and friendly hotel in a good location. Guest rooms and public areas are clean and well appointed.The staff ( from the General Manager to the porters) are genuinely polite and service oriented. I always look forward to my stays at he Shangri-La Tokyo!

Such an understated hotel with the best club floor service. Wonderful helpful staff and totally delicious cocktail hour treats. Faultless & seamless service that is Shangri-La. You fall in love with the hotel & staff. Breakfast in the hotel is memorable with the decadent lobster caviar scrambled eggs. Sitting above Tokyo Central makes trips easy & a stroll to Ginza &Marunouchi shops a breeze. Rooms are roomy & very comfortable. I recommend especially the Horizon club floor

Beautifully appointed rooms & attentive service. Used as home base on recent trip to Tokyo. Ate in hotel each (3) evening as too exhausted after hectic day of traveling -did not disappoint. Highly recommend if you want to be pampered between business appointments while in town. Impeccable service throughout visit.

Honestly, I had never heard of the Shangri-La in Tokyo. Arrangements were made for a meeting and I found myself moving from Narita directly to the hotel.That's when a great experience began. Typical of the entry at any Japanese hotel, the greeting was warm and luggage was sent ahead. I was escorted to the 28th floor lobby and first glimpsed the commanding view of the Tokyo skyline through the floor to ceiling windows - captivating.After a quick and pleasant check-in, it was a smooth trip to a yet higher floor and a room that is remarkable. Every comfort is arranged from programmed lighting to heated bathroom floors. More stunning views are outside the windows but the light can be completely shielded at bedtime by the three layers of power operated curtains. Decor is great - comfortable elegance. Room service was fast and the food was very good. Only tried the Lobby Lounge restaurant and only for lunch but the lobster roll was great as was the view out that side of the building.The hotel is sandwiched into a modern office tower which is next to Tokyo Station. Super convenient for travel by train or walking in the Ginza or Marunouchi but very quiet.Staff is plentiful, helpful and very friendly.Not the cheapest place in town but a really great experience.

Not that this hotel is by any means inexpensive... but its a great hotel. We had a lovely executive room on the 36th floor with great views of the imperial gardens. The club lounge staff is dramatically helpful and accommodating. If they didn't have immediate answers... it was no challenge to get them for you. We really felt like we were treated very special by all the staff at the hotel. I highly recommend eating in the casual part of their Italian restaurant. The main restaurant was a formal fancy meal... but the tapas in the lounge appealed to a much broader palate and the food was delicious. Back to the hotel. The room was very, very comfortable... bed, shower, amenities... black out shades... everything. The only "knock" that could be thrown out there was the complete lack of any Television in english... not that we watched TV... but sometimes its nice to catch up on the news.

From the moment we were greeted at the station to the moment we were farewelled on the platform bound for Narita - the service we experienced at the Shangri-La was nothing short of exceptional. Staying here was one of the highlights of our first family holiday in Japan. The three of us were very comfortable in a Deluxe room which was bigger than we expected given what we'd heard about Japanese hotel rooms. Inside was every comfort one could ask for from a welcome snack to a choice of robes, slippers and quality toiletries - and a great deep bath to enjoy a luxurious soak in. My daughter was thrilled to find the hotel's mascot teddy bear on her pillow as a special gift. The beds were very comfortable - the best we experienced in two weeks in Japan. We made good use of the pool on the 29th floor which afforded amazing views of Tokyo with glimpses of the bay. The spa, steam room and bathroom were well appointed and stocked with everything one needs to freshen up after a swim and. Room service was prompt and the in-room dining offered a great selection of Japanese, Chinese, Italian and American cuisine. Breakfast is served in two restaurants and again caters to all tastes and is of outstanding quality. Attention to detail, care and courtesy are evident throughout the hotel and the staff are without fail attentive, efficient and a pleasure to deal with. Special acknowledgement to Mai Otani who greeted us at the train station and escorted us to the hotel and her colleague So Shiken who saw us safely back in plenty of time to catch our train to Narita. Both were friendly, charming and very helpful.

Wonderful hotel in the center of Tokyo.We had a fantastic suite on the 32nd floor with huge windows overlooking the Tokyo skyline and the bay of Tokyo.The staff were the most fantastic and helpful we have ever met.

This is the best Shangri-La hotel in the world that we have ever stayed. The rooms are huge with wonderful amnesties (from bathrobe to pajamas to slippers) which are always replenished twice a day, the bed is heavenly, the bathroom is extremely spacious, the staff are polite with excellent service, breakfast quality is exceptional and location is great, being right next to the Tokyo train station.Would stay here again and again. Look no more.

We thoroughly recommend this 5 star hotel especially Mai Ocani who initially was working in the Executive Club Lounge and later on concierge. Mai was friendly, charming, helpful and informative. The other staff in the Club Lounge were also wonderful as well. Our suite was exactly what we expected. We would stay at Shangri- La Tokyo on a future visit to Japan.

We arrived feeling tired after a long journey from London to be met by amazing service from the staff at the front desk. We were shown to a fabulously large room with an amazing view which was great given this was our first time in Japan. The room was very clean and the bed so comfortable which is what you need after a long journey. Every request was met with courtesy and helpfulness. The concierges were very knowledgeable and helped us find gorgeous restaurants. Cocktails in the bar after dinner were delicious and also a special thanks to the lovely staff at ground level who always rushed to call the lift for us and were so charming and to the lovely lady who helped us with the luggage and took us to the bullet train for our next destination. I would definitely recommend this hotel when in Tokyo

A fantastic hotel and service is best in Tokyo. Bar is good, breakfast is great, room is big. Everything's is perfect but....The policy of charging more to have more than one person in a room is shocking. I got emails on this and had to change my reservation. A couple at the front desk was arguing about it with reception and a couple other guests mentioned it to me. Five star hotels don't do this and this new policy is a shocker. If you book ask and if they want to charge you stay at another hotel - the Mandarin or the Four Seasons are near by...Again, a great hotel but thoughtless policy!

Very nice upscale hotel so close to the Tokyo station. Literally just across a small street. The staff was courteous and helpful. The hotel itself was very clean, luxurious, and large for Japan standards. The bathroom is the absolute best with the largest rainfall shower I've seen and the cool Japanese toilets but this one would also lift the seat up when you enter the room. The amenities are top of the line. There is a nestles coffee maker in the room, kimonos, pajamas, slippers, safe, small fridge but not much storage space because it is full of alcohol and snacks for sale, tea set, dryer, iron. The amenities included a comb, nice wooden hairbrush, toothbrushes, toothpaste, shavor, nice aerosolized shaving cream, lots of free bottles of water, bath sponges, and more.We didn't pack any amenities this trip knowing in Japan, most hotels will provide them.We wish we had tried their breakfast buffet but it was very pricey. The reviews for it was very good though. The indoor pool and spa was also very nice and rare for Japanese hotels.Nice quiet hotel. Definition of luxury. Great location. Would come again and highly recommend.

* Coming from airport with taxi the car entrance is a little tricky. You have to enter through an underground garage.* The hotel lobby is on the 28th floor of a high rise building.* Quite large room.* Free internet connection.* Very powerful hand shower and rain shower in a large cabinet* Power curtains.* Sophisticated toilet seat with various functions.* Large screen TV and BOSE sound system.* A rich writing and drawing kit and a technology kit with all possible adaptors.* Nespresso machine in the room.* Imperial Garden View room but not hard to see the garden. Overlooking Tokyo Station.* Staff very kind and helpful.* Sound proofing is great. It is a very silent hotel.* Definitely my next stay in Tokyo will be at Shangri La!* I personally thank to Mr.Kentaro Ishibasi, the food and beverages operation manager for his personal attention.

Went with my boyfriend to spend the weekend there and it was super nice! The room is very good and comfortable, they put a chocolate welcome sweet in our room, some japanese snacks and flowers. We had dinner at Piacere thst had a amazing view from the city and a mix of modern/traditional style. Food was very good! After that we had some drinks in the bar that also has view to the city. The club lounge is very good, spacious and good options of food! I was only disappointed with the gym. It is very small and few machines available.

Amazing rooms, especially by Tokyo standards. Large with great views, move bathrooms.Nice gym, small but pretty inventing for exercise.Not impressed with the food / restaurant facilities. Having stayed At other Shangri La Hotels in Asia and Dubai I was expecting. A much more elaborate breakfast buffet.Some of the staff at front desk struggle with English and some of the basic services need to improve. Espresso comes lukewarm and eggs sometimes takes 30' or more - unacceptable in a service orientated place such as Tokyo. Great location next to Tokyo Station. Will be back but continue to dine out and just sleep and exercise here.

Different kind of hotel where you have to take the elevator to the 28th floor or so to get to the lobby, but once there you are in a luxurious hotel. Roomer are very clean and decent size. Lots of oversized windows displaying great views of Tokyo. Highly recommend.

It's one of those weird hotels where you have to travel up the lifts to get to the lobby. However the porters at the lifts are very nice and pleasant. The hotel is very professional rooms are clean and roomy for Tokyo. The best part and I wrote this in last year review is when you come from Narita airport on the express - takes over an hour but saves £$€¥ money - is phone the concierge tell them your carriage number and the porter will wait for you in a red jacket and walk you to the hotel. Trust me if you don't speak Japanese the station is a nightmare. Highly recommend this hotel.

Arriving late at night and walking into a spacious luxury well appointed room immediately made me feel happy Every amenity assuring a luxury stay is provided. Large glass windows all around overlooking Tokyo I found an assortment of Japanese delicacies provided by management. The bathroom is luxuriously appointed with a warm toilet seat and different shower options attached to the toilet flusher which I subsequently discovered is the way most toilets are in Tokyo. My room 3701.. next to the horizon lounge which is a sophisticated lounge offering cocktails and and bar service nearly all day added to my excellent experience at this fabulous hotel The breakfast is superb and the service all around is superb
user_name:
denised634
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: Just back from a short business trip to Tokyo with my husband and had the pleasure of staying in this hotel. It is truly luxurious and the staff are so friendly and helpful. We had a deluxe room on the 35th floor with a fantastic city view from a full length window. The bed was ultra comfortable and the bathroom was one of the best I've ever experienced with a separate wet/bath room, vanity area and amazing Japanese toilet! Plenty of L'Occitane toiletries were provided too. We used room service a lot as we were so exhausted and the food was excellent. We had breakfast a couple of times in the Italian restaurant where there was an extensive buffet choice plus a huge hot food menu - I had the best Eggs Benedict ever! The bar has the spectacular city views and was never overly busy. The hotel is located next to the main railway station from which we had to travel daily into the nearby Yokohama - many thanks to the lovely young man who walked with us to the station, helped us buy tickets and saw us onto the right train - truly above and beyond the call of his job! Tokyo is amazing, clean, busy, safe (apparently almost crime free) and friendly but the shortness of our trip, 17 hour journey to get there and 8 hour time difference knocked us for 6! Thank goodness we were staying in such a comfortable hotel staffed by sincerely lovely people. Highly recommended!

Hotel is well entered in Tokyo. Staff are so friendly and speaks fluant english and most importantly helpful. The property's lounge has a wonderful panorama view and the Spa is quite elegant cosy and nice. The Italian and Japanese restaurants are exquisite, especially the Italian but a bit pricy.

My husband and I stayed for a total of 4 days at this hotel. It is quite simply one of the best we have ever stayed at and would certainly recommend to anyone looking for a very comfortable hotel in Tokyo. It was next to Tokyo Station so very easy to get around.

Stay here many times over the past few years. Room is large by Tokyo standard and amenities are very good. The location is excellent and the level of the service is exceptional, especially in the club lounge. Worth paying extra for the benefits. For the view, you can go with either side of the hotel. Imperial garden view is quite nice but you can probably hear some trains passing by, while the city side has less noise from the train station.Had one bad experience from reservation agents as they had to relocate my room to other floor due to some closing situation and didn't give much explanation to me except one simple email, but the way they handled afterward (by the managers) was good.

2 perfect nights. My only criticism would be the atmosphere is just a little too cold and sterile - but it is very good place to stay. Had great executive room and high floor double aspect views of the city.
