As a super regular Shangri-La client, they normally do the small things better than other hotels.The Shangri-La Tokyo is one of their most expensive hotels and to be honest, there is nothing special about it.The rooms are great but the gym, buffet breakfast and general hotel is very average compared to other five star hotels in Tokyo.

The Shangri-La is a luxury hotel conveniently located next door to the Tokyo Central Station. Rooms and suites are large and very comfortable and enjoy great view (the lobby is located at the 28th floor of a modern tall building). Great staff.

One of the best hotels I have stayed. Love the view from the hotel room. Very convenient. The service staff there is polite , friendly and serve one with a smile. I will stay at the hotel again if price is not a consideration.

It was a great pleasure for me to stay at Shngri-La Tokyo with its beautyful, friendly, polite, charming and lovable staff at the Horizon Club. I enjoyed the wonderful and outstanding perfect service. The food was great and delicious, for example "Egg Benedict" was extraordinary delicate. I have met such high quality of service only at Mandarin Oriental Bangkok. Nowhere else in the world. It was more than 5-stars quality. Thank you very much for the warm and heartfelt everything. I am looking forward to my next stay at Shangri-La Tokyo.

We visit Tokyo very often. For business and leisure. For years, I wanted to try this Shangri-la Hotel because of its location and I am also a loyalty member. However, the price was always very high and I always found better deals with other competing alternatives in the same category. This time, I found the price acceptable. When we arrived, the entrance of the hotel was not very visible. In fact, you cannot see the entrance. It's either by taxi/car/bus you have to head down to the basement of the parking to access the basement entrance (where the bell captain is) OR you have to walk behind a building to see the entrance. I felt this hotel was more of a "service apartment" more than a Shangri la Hotel.The location was one reason I really wanted to try this hotel. However, it turned out to be a disadvantage for us. We did not like having to walk so far to the metro station. The entrance of the metro is only 5 minutes away (one block) but the actual subway train tracks are quite far away. To access to Ginza line, it was 350 meters to walk to. JR station is next door, but the tokyo station is so big and so busy, it was quite stressful to go in and out each time, we ended up taking taxis so many more times than usual staying here.Check in was smooth and quick. Concierge was superb prior our arrival, helped me by email to book all the restaurants I wanted. Room was great. Beautiful view of the SkyTree. We got the 34th floor. The main entrance is very small. The staff at the main entrance never even greeted us or helped us with elevators, our shopping bags.... unlike other luxury brand hotels. Lobby at the 28th floor also lacks ambience, and is again, quite small. I didn't like that there is never any staff at the elevators. No one greets you. No staff or security either at the elevators that go up to the guest rooms. You don't need the room key to access the floors. The amenities and FREE wifi are good things about this hotel. Size of room is good. Housekeeping does a great job. Pillows are very soft. I dislike this very much. Upon my request, housekeeping gave us buckwheat filled pillows, which were very small in size, like for child. Wasn't comfortable.Check out- called for bell captain, perhaps it was a busy time for them. Took them 20 minutes to come get out luggage. We took a taxi to Haneda Airport, which the bell desk reserved and put all our luggage in the taxi upon our arrival from lunch at 1pm sharp. That was impressive.Never saw any of the management. Only three or four staff always at the reception/concierge. We would consider staying here next time if the price has promotion. But at the usual rate that is offered, I would prefer my usual hotel next time I visit Tokyo. Nothing wrong with the hotel, just missing any WOW factor.

Stayed with my boyfriend to celebrate his 40th birthday so it was a special occasion for us. The whole experience delivered by the hotel from booking to escort to the train station was incredible. Such friendly and helpful staff. The room was huge, with a fantastic view over the city. The bed sooooo comfortable it was very hard to get out of it in the morning. The swimming pool, hot tub and sauna area is gorgeous. It was spotlessly clean and a very relaxing experience. We used it 3 times in our one night stay. We spent a bit more for the horizon club experience - best decision ever made. Personal service and delicious canapés and drinks. We ate in the Nadaman restaurant which was exquisite. Overall worth every single penny!

Quality accommodation and supreme service in Tokyo. Nothing is too much bother for the staff, The level of assistance and polite friendliness Is beyond exceptional. The hotel is ideally situated next to the main railway station and perfect for onward travel.

Invited and joined my friend's wedding ceremony here at Shangri-La Hotel, Tokyo. What a great venue. On the 27th floor, they have a beautiful chapel, well decorated waiting rooms and wonderful ball rooms. Services provided by attentive and friendly staffs were just superb. Really enjoyed it.

Pretty much the best hotel experience, including other Shangri-las. I was particularly blown away that every time I stepped out of the room someone would replace the towels and fold my clothes. Location, facilities and people are amazing!

Absolutely perfect hotel experience. Hotel is located right next to Tokyo station making getting around Tokyo/Japan very convenient. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful during our stay. Hotel rooms offer an unparalleled view of the Tokyo skyline and superb beds. Highly recommend!

We were overjoyed with our second visit in same month. Truly felt special, the welcome was great, both re amenities / gifts and service. Could not ask for a better check in, Misako Takai was outstanding. Thank you.Shangri-La Tokyo is Shangri-La. Enjoy.If you do not know your way around, do take advantage of their meet and greet service for those arriving by train, or their escort to platform upon check out - Tokyo station can be confusing, it is massive.

We splurged on Horizon Club rooms in the Shangri- La Tokyo at the end of our trip to Japan. It was well worth it! From the moment we stepped foot in the hotel to the departure escort to the train station we were treated like royalty. The room was amazing with breathtaking views and every imaginable amenity. The breakfast and cocktail hour were exquisite. The location is perfect. The service was the best we have ever had. Since we had a late flight we booked spa treatments which were heavenly. We will not stay anywhere else in Tokyo. We would highly recommend the Shangri-La.

I have stayed at this hotel many time during my travel to Japan. This is a Five Star Hotel with all the world class services. The rooms are nicely decorated and nice size in comparison to the typical Japanese hotels. The lounge bar serves lunch and dinner and other libations. The hotel is located near the Yaesu Entrance of the Tokyo Station and near many shopping and restaurants.

The Shangri La Tokyo is in a fabulous location just next door to Tokyo station. This made getting around so very convenient. The pick up for tours was also close by.Other than the location what made this hotel was the staff and the overall attitude though out. We had 3 people in our room, usually we run short of shampoos etc - not at Shangri La Tokyo - the amount of shampoos, etc was more than enough for 3 people. They even provided pyjamas every night. This was our first time to Tokyo and the staff were very helpful with tours, restaurants etc. Their staff met us at the airport and escorted us though to the transfer car, on departure one of their staff escorted us to the check in counter.We had a tour that required us to get to the other side of Tokyo station and a staff member escorted us on both days and offered to be their on our return to assist us getting back to hotel.I could go on and on. We can't rate Shangri La Tokyo high enough - it was just sooo amazing.Thank you for making a trip I was quite nervous about so easy.

Always outstanding in service, quality and friendliness. Had previously only stayed here for work, but given the large room sizes (especially for Tokyo) we did a 5-day stay with my family this summer. I can't say enough about everyone we came across - the bell hops to the reception managers to the sweet cleaning ladies and the fantastic concierge. Always prompt and reliable service with a smile. The facilities are top notch and it's always an nice restful oasis to come back to especially after a long day in the summer. Location is very convenient right next to Tokyo Station and the ginza area. Traveling around via the metro and rail lines are so much easier. Lots of good restaurants and eateries around the hotel. Take the airport limo bus which drops and picks you up from the basement of the Shangri La. Don't bother with the Narita Express train as you have to lug your luggage through the train station.

A nice hotel, with well sized rooms very well equipped, a nice bar and common parts, a perfect staff like you can expect from a Top Japanese hotel. All that is nice and you spend a good time, but the price is a bit over the top. 800 yens (8 USD) for a nespresso capsule in the room, really? And all the prices are alike. You can get same quality for cheaper, or better for the same price.

Rooms are large for Tokyo standards, breakfast is tasty but restaurants are disappointing for Japanese standards. No presence from management throughout the last 3 years ....despite staying there at least twice a month.Staff friendly in the Horizon Lounge.

I've tried a few of the luxury hotels in Tokyo (Four Seasons, Mandarin, Park Hyatt) and this is my favorite. A few things really make it excel above the others...the staff (more friendlier and accommodating - consistent with the Shangri La style), the rooms (really nice quality), the food (it's the best eggs Benedict I've had in the world and Nadaman's really good), and the spa (Chuan Spa is so amazing and consistent throughout the world). Excellent value for money spent here.

I visited only for two days but wished it were longer. Location is very central near Tokyo Station, close to Ginza. This hotel is superb, almost everything you would expect at this price range except a large outdoor garden, which is hard to do in this location. The decor is very reserved Asian, with lots of gold, downlighting, browns and shadows. Service is very Japanese and impeccable. Rooms are actually quite spacious for Tokyo, with comfortable beds and good facilities. Breakfast is sumptuous, with all possible options from the various continents, and also a bit of an event as you sometimes see wealthy local ladies in Armani and Dior suits gathering for a brunch. The swimming pool is something to see even if you don't plan on swimming, with one glass wall overlooking g the city. Expensive but an all round great hotel.

From the moment we arrived we were warmly greeted and welcomed. Staff is well trained and very attentive. Our room was wonderful with a fantastic view. Turn down service is excellent and includes his/her pajamas. The Shangri-La was an outstanding experience and we will be back next time we are in Tokyo. Excellent location to Tokyo Station.

From the warmest welcome till the departure with the escort to the Tokyo station, we had the most wonderful and relaxing time in Shangri La! The hotel sets the standards very high and achieves perfect results every time. I truly believe Shangri La in Tokyo has the best breakfast in the world and overall the most excellent service. We especially enjoyed the escort service to the train station on several occasions, it made finding the right train/platform so easy and stress free. Our gratitude goes to every staff member! It was our third stay and we plan to be back:)

Sat in the bar for a few drinks and desert after a good meal at Nadaman restaurant. Staff were accommodating and polite, drinks were simply brilliant! We ordered some of the special mixology cocktails and were extremely surprised! Deserts were great! Good selection and immaculately presented.All whilst overlooking an amazing view! Highly recommended for a quick drink in the evening at the least.

Thank you for having an amazing team at the Shangri-la Tokyo. I have just left your wonderful hotel and wished to pass along some special moments I had experienced during my stay. Where to begin, there are so many wonderful moments to share regarding my many encounters with members of your team. Although everyone I encountered was fabulous, looking back there are definitely a few team members that deserve special mention. From the moment I entered the property I was so warmly welcomed by Ms. Yumi Tsujimura and the Horizon Club staff. After a very fast check in process I was taken to my room.I hadn't even met this first special team member, yet I struggle to find the right words to express just how touched I was by the wonderful gift Noriko Seimiya left waiting for me in my room. In the Horizon Club I was made to feel right at home, starting with Ms. Hideko Yamanaka. Her professional handling and speed at which she dealt with all matters was very impressive. I can not express strongly enough at what a wonderful team Ms. Yamanaka has and how smoothly things run under her guidance. Although I never really saw the housekeeping staff, my room was always magically put back together and spotless regardless of when I returned back to the room. I appreciate there dedication to detail. The laundry service promptly picked up my items and returned them swiftly spotless. All staff members in the Horizon Club Lounge made all my dealings there so enjoyable. It didn't matter when I entered or passed by the Club Lounge, they always greeted me by name and with wonderful smiles. They could not have been more helpful and I was very impressed when several of the staff remembered me from my October 2015.  This now brings me to someone very special on your team, Horizon Club team member Ms. Ayaka Sekino certainly took the whole Shangri-la hospitality to another level of making me feel very welcomed. "Ms. Sekino you truly made my visit so much better "! Thank you Shangri-la Tokyo and your wonderful team !
user_name:
Johnny R
Richmond, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: This is an opulent hotel with very attentive service and amazing rooms. Everything about this hotel was nearly flawless, and the location, a few steps from the Nihonbashi exit of Tokyo Station, can't be beat.We don't often chose luxury hotels so we had some concerns about the price of this hotel for a 5 day, high-season stay. We both feel the stay was well worth the price.Tip: If you get an e-mail offering to meet you at Tokyo Station - take the offer. Tokyo station is a maze.

Sure, it's not cheap but the level of service and quality of the room are exceptional. It's such a little oasis in the middle of Tokyo, right next to Tokyo Station. The only minor point of critique would be that the gym is too small (yet the pool is nice). The last two times I visited Tokyo I stayed in the Shangri-La and I will definitely stay there next time as well.

Beautiful hotelPerfect locationBrekkie Restaurant overlooks Chiyoda which is stunningEasy access to everything from where we wereConcierge is an excellent resource Remember to book tours you may want to go on before you get there as they are often booked in advance Nil negatives

It is a bit of a labyrinth to get to the hotel from tokyo train station as it is really huge, but you don't need to take a taxi and as long as there are wheels on your luggage you are good.the service is impeccable from the beginning, yes yes yes to whatever you want.we arrived early and were invited to have breakfast immediately. (even though it was not included in the deal and we really didn't expect it)hands down the best breakfast ever. I never enjoyed eating salad for breakfast, but it felt like a treat in Shangri La Tokyo.the room was good size, very clean, i very much liked the decor. we had imperial garden view, which was perfect. we could observe the other side of tokyo from the breakfast lounge anyway.another perk was "tea", from 4-7pm in the afternoon or thereabouts. again, super nice food. they booked the trains to kyoto and osaka for us and even walked us down to the platform so we don't get lost. and that was more than a mile I'm sure :-Dabsolutely amazing100/100

for our 3rd consecutive trip to tokyo, my husband decided to book shangrila, since we will be just in Tokyo this time around. it was a week of pure bliss! we had to check out for 2 nights since we will be at the disney ambassdor hotel, and as always, shangrila took care of everything, down to keeing our pieces of luggage and ensuring that it will waiting forbus back in our rooms as soon as we check in again. i have always emphasized that one of shangrila's greatest asset would be their people- and once again, we have been great witnesses as to how they were able to show their mastery of making each guest feel so valued- not that we feel that we must be treated like VIP's but just the mere fact of them going all the way with us to hail a cab (2 cabs actually) and telling both drivers that we were running late for a restaurant reservation and that if they can take a less traffic route just made us love shangrila even more. they greet us with a smile, and go the extra mile, all the time. there is a reason behind why we have been loyal with any shangrila hotel, and each year we travel and stay in a shangrila, we are reminded yet again why we fell in love the first time. yes, it's a bit on the pricey side, but trust me when i say it was worth every penny, maybe even more. :-)

The Shangri-la Hotel is conveniently located immediately north of Tokyo Station near the Daimaru department store.We stayed in an executive suite that was a decent size with an excellent bathroom and all the typical amenities of a hotel in this class. The view is quite nice, although the corner, non-suite rooms are even more spectacular. Having stayed at the Four Seasons in Maruouchi (next to the southern end of the Yaesu entrance of the Station), the Shangri-la seemed newer and more formal, with better views. The Four Seasons though offered rooms with two queen-sized beds, which might be more amenable to families. In any case, you can't go wrong with a stay at the Shangri-la. The staff is also quite nice!

Expectations for top notch design and quality service in Tokyo are high and Shangri-La delivers at this luxury hotel. One of the several five star choices available in the high-end market in bustling Tokyo. Beyond excellent service and first class accommodations, I like this hotel largely for its location. It is rather centrally located for touring or business in the city and is literally right next to the main train station. Its location is a huge positive for making the Shangri-La your selection over some other options in the city. They even offer a complementary meet and greet at the train platform upon your arrival with baggage assistance and a most welcoming staff member assigned to greet you as you exit your train. The same service will escort you and deliver your bags back to the train for departures. Once at the hotel, you enter on the main floor and take an elevator to the reception area - the hotel is situated above an office and retail area. Some will consider this a detraction, but I prefer the higher floors for less noise from the traffic below and Shangri-La does a wonderful job with interior appointments to make this transition seem luxurious. Rooms are spacious and beautiful, the beds are soft by Asian standards - which makes them super comfortable and all of the linens are superb. Our bathroom had a shower and tub and every possible appointment. There are two dining and lounge areas near the reception desk for guests that are lovely - offering wonderful food and service. However, the hotel could stand to improve the management of these areas to reduce guest frustration with wait time or lack of available spaces, as these areas are also frequented by businessmen and other outside tourists not staying at the hotel. The location, the gorgeous view and the upscale atmosphere attracts too many, but could be turned into yet another positive for the hotel with some management of non-hotel guests being limited to certain spaces. The food served to our party through dining and with room service was excellent throughout both of our stays in 2016. This hotel should certainly be on the list of "Best in Tokyo."

It's located above one of the main train in Tokyo. Well easy access to many areas. If you enjoy moving your legs a little bit and shopping freak, some main shopping spots within 20 mins doorsteps.We arrived very early and leave very late. So we made use of the spa facitiliies for early prepare ourselves and late shower for overnight flight. The spa (women) area is quite small in compare to some 5* hotel I stayed but its well equipped. Don't worry about head to toes' skincare and toothbrush. They have everything. The room is well maintained. The view from the room is magnificent. Bathroom is big. I know it sounds chicheThe service is too notch. We had few nights that got specific dinner requirements (late night dinner/crave for sushi omakese/want good grilled eel rice) and the concierge team managed to book/suggest us some good restaurants. Apart from the strong perfume scent at the lobby, too intense from my liking(this is a personal preference). I guess it belongs to the signature Bvlgari Eau Parfumée Au Thé Vert. Love it or hate it.

i went to this hotel, and is fabulous. Rooms are very bigs,(we are in tokio), very modern and you can see all the city under your foots. service is amazing, and location is in the city, close to central station

We were very pleased that we chose the club at the Shangri-La for our first trip to Tokyo. The location is well situated for the train station and Imperial Palace, the rooms were well appointed, with high quality products, and room service was prompt and efficient. The quality of service was consistently excellent, in particular in the club area, including being very accommodating with our late check out request. We would definitely use this again for our next stay in Tokyo.

I stayed at Shangri-La Hotrl Tokyo April this year, with my wife and one year old daughterThe hotel location only about 3 minutes walking from Tokyo station, which was one of the most busiest station in the city, and destination for shinkansen train. It only about 10 minutes walk to imperial palace. and it only one station away to ginza stationOur room face towards imperial palace. when it was raining, you can see shinjuku area. The room was great and comfortable, especially the bathroom. The internet was fast and reliable.In room breakfast is highly recommended by us with wide variety of choices, and it was delicious. The staff was friendly, and really helpful.If you are looking for luxurious hotel in the middle of tokyo, This might be the place

Once you get used to Japanese culture and their outstanding customer service qualities, you will understand just how top notch this hotel really is. The only disappointing feature is the pool being indoors! Everything else is class. Will be back with family or business. Highly recommend

Great hotel, close to Tokyo station, the central hub of Japan's travel (5 minutes walk). The view was amazing and the food superb. The hotel has very modern rooms, the toilet is a UFO, lol. They even took us to our bullet train free of service and waited on us when we arrived from Kyoto. Now, that's service!!!!

This was our second time staying at the Shangri-La in Marunouchi,and we weren't disappointed. Nothing was too much trouble. Communication in advance of our stay (discussing arrangements for our young son) were straightforward, and we were made to feel very welcome the moment we got there. Our airline had left our pushchair in London, and promised to put it on the next flight. That meant getting it 24 hours later, which would have been a huge inconvenience had the hotel not stepped in straight away to have a pushchair put in our room. And, when our son was ill with a mildly upset stomach, there was no fuss at all. Within minutes, two people were in our room helping out.I've spoken before about how good the rooms are. We didn't have a corner room this time, but still had one overlooking the Palace. Be warned, due to the buildings around Tokyo Station, the Palace is barely visible. However, that doesn't detract at all from what is a dramatic view. Our son certainly enjoyed watching the trains come and go.The room was very comfortable. The bed is great, giving us a near perfect night's sleep, despite a jet lagged toddler. The bathroom had everything you needed - plenty of decent products, and a good sized bath and a rain shower. Of course, had we had a corner room, we could have taken a bath overlooking the city, but this was still fine.We took breakfast each morning, and there was something for everyone. Delicious juices, an abundance of fruits and pastries, and a hot selection (covering Asian and European/North American dishes).It really is a gorgeous hotel. Sumptuous decor and some stunning art in the corridors. Minutes away from Tokyo Station, it is easy to get to once you know your way. If you've not been before, be sure to take advantage of the "meet and greet" service. Just get in touch with your train details (including carriage and seat number), and they will meet you at your train door and guide you through what must be one of the more overwhelming stations in the world.Highly recommended - we've stayed twice now, and although expensive, it's a great place to stay if you can stretch to it. We certainly hope to be back on our next visit to Japan.

Highly recommended - not cheap but definitely worth it. Great room with good views due to the hotel height, nicely decorated, first class service, a lovely bar area ...Nothing to be said which is negative - it's all great. modern hotel with I am told all latest available anti-earthquake architectural measures..Highly recommended

We stayed at the Shangri-La Tokyo last month. Had extra bed put into the rooms for free for the kids. We are Golden Circle members and the staff were very thoughtful... they put little teddy bears on the kid beds! :) They really liked that personal touch and have both brought back their bears to the states! Thanks to the very thoughtful staff at Shangri-La, they had a great time!The rooms are huge, I believe 700+sq ft, twice the size of the standard hotel rooms in Tokyo. My parents had a corner room, their "king" bed was HUGE! It's like a whole person bigger than a Cal King! you can literally sleep 4 people in that bed! Décor is modern but of the Shangri-La classy look. Not your contemporary modern but has a warm wooden look. That huge window with great commanding view of the Tokyo skyline is probably one of the best in the whole city. Hotel is on the 28th floor, our room was on the 32nd... there were no buildings taller than 20F next to us. Relaxing by the window and looking at the Sky Tree was a treat. I am sure if you are on the other side and have view of the imperial palace, it would be even more enchanting.Staff were very courteous, rooms are very clean. We got good recommendations from staff for eatery suggestions. Location next to the North east entrance to the JR Tokyo station is very convenient. The station is HUGE, with Dai Maru Dept store and many eatery selections. So the location of the hotel is very convenient. We had the hotel staff meet us at the Shinkansen platform, he guided us from the platform (straight out from the train's exit door) to the hotel. It's free service from hotel. They cannot bring luggage rollers to platform but he helped my parents with two of their carry on luggages. We had a great stay at the Shangri-La Tokyo. We will be back. Next time, will enjoy the spa and pool...

My wife and I stayed in the Shangri-La for three nights during a recent visit to the Far East. We have stayed at other Shangri-La hotels and have always been very impressed and the Tokyo branch did not disappoint.Centrally placed near the main railway station, Ginza and the Imperial Palace. The hotel occupies the top few floors of a tower block and has great views over the city, especially good at night.Fabulous room, great bed, all amenities shower and bath and heated loo seat. Two restaurants, Japanese and Italian. Great service.All in all a great hotel.

The hotel is located within 5 min walk from the Tokyo station. The Tokyo station is a major station with lots of trains, including Narita express, Shinkansen, and the local JR trains and metro. When you exit from Tokyo station, look for Diamaru department store or the Yaesu North exit.The room , bed, bathroom etc were all excellent and from our room we can view the Tokyo sky tree which actually saved us from going there to view the Tokyo skyline!The Concierge was one of the most helpful ones in hotels we had stayed. When asked about the restaurants we wanted to visit, he helped us book and even had a confirmation with a map and direction attached.Even the junior staff e.g. bellboys, cleaners were very responsible. They definitely treat their jobs seriously.The swimming pool was great, indoor, but you have to wear a swimming cap.Would definitely stay there in future whenever we are in Tokyo.

The rooms is what you expect from a top class hotel in Tokyo from top class Hotel chain: specious, modern, great view, location next to Tokyo station, Giza and Marunochi area and a toilet bowl to die for. Yes its expensive to stay and to eat here. not sure about the food but for stay its wort it. Step out of the hotel and you ave access to some of the best Japanese eating places.

Location is superb, 1 minute walk just out side of Tokyo station. The lobby is on the 28th floor and the rooms are surprisingly spacious and luxurious for Tokyo. The second I walked into the hotel area I was greeted by a fresh fragrance, cool air and friendly staff, they managed to create Shangri-La.

We love Shangri-La for delivering luxury in a friendly way that's welcoming and not aloof and this one didn't disappoint. Beautiful, spacious (if somewhat anonymous--could be anywhere) rooms, amazing breakfast and a staff that provides exceptional service every step of the way. This is the standard to which all luxury hotels should aspire. The location for train travelers could not be better--direct connection to the station and if you email your train, car and seat numbers they will meet you trackside and escort you to the reception desk!
user_name:
nycgwm
New York City, New York

review_body: Fantastic hotel for a business trip. The rooms are spacious and very neatly decorated. The staff is very polite and helpful and the lounge/bar area is great for a quick bite, a drink or a less formal business discussion. The location could not be more central. Delighted with my stay.

We stayed in a Club room on the 37th floor for our 1-night stopover in Tokyo at the end of our Japan vacation. I chose the hotel for its proximity to the Tokyo Station/N'Ex and used AMEX FHR to book for the guaranteed late check-out. (Japanese hotels are known to be strict about check-in and check-out time.) We were all very, very impressed by the exemplary service, especially at the Horizon Club where all the staff spoke good English and showed genuine hospitality. They would offer to buy N'Ex tickets, escort service to the train platform, and would often ask to make sure we had everything we needed.The room is nicely appointed, but that was expected for the pricepoint and level of accommodation. It's not as large as a standard room at the Peninsula (which is a great hotel in its own right), but still spacious. With a view towards the Palace side, it was very comfortable in western decor infused with Japanese touch such as having the tub inside the walk-in shower enclosure and the availability of pajamas. Booked a 60-minute stress relief massage at the spa at the last minute and enjoyed the relaxing treatment as well as the facility. Though I didn't use the gym or the pool, they are free for hotel guests, unlike some local chains. The Club lounge serves good hors d'oeurves in the evening that could almost replace a meal. We had a choice for breakfast at the lounge or at the restaurant on 29th floor, and we decided to eat down there. There's a very nice buffet section with a good spread of western and Asian dishes, and on top we would order a main plate from the menu such as eggs benedict, pancakes etc.There are hotels in many cities that can offer similar level of comfort in terms of amenities/facilities/hardware, yet I was particularly pleased with the exceptional service demonstrated by everyone I have interacted with at the Shangri-la Tokyo. Kudos to the management and I won't hesitate to recommend to anyone ready to splurge!

Stayed with the family for four nights in Tokyo. This place is a zen,calming oasis. Rooms are big, gorgeous, well stocked with amenities and quiet. Everything that we needed in a hotel. Great nespresso pod coffee maker in room, bottled water complimentary, and bath amenities. Hotel has an amazing location next to Tokyo station for restaurants and trains. We had a great stay and would recommend it.
user_name:
peterdaisy
New York City, New York

review_body: Recently visited for a short stay, but I cannot stress the level of personal service given by all staff members I encountered.I stayed in a standard room with a view of Tokyo Central Station 35 floors below. The location is very convenient when traveling anywhere in and around Japan. The rooms are a very generous size, and nicely appointed. The three in-house restaurants were outstanding, with breakfast at Piacere being my favorite.They also offer a meet and greet service at the Central Train station to assist you in navigating the maze of gates and exits.All in all, a fabulous oasis in Tokyo!

We only stayed briefly but the Horizon Club staff were so incredibly helpful especially with managing our late flight. I would absolutely recommend them and was so impressed. We stayed at the park hyatt on our last visit and found the location and service overall and especially in Horizon at the Shangri-la to be far superior.

We stayed in a corner room on the horizon club floor, floor 37, the highest one. Views are striking day and night. Having glass wrap around such a large room gives a feeling of great openness and space which is saying something in Tokyo where space is at such a premium.Even the bathroom had windows (frosted for the toilet cubby) and with power blinds for the bath/shower. Bath and Room could be completely closed off with high quality wood sliding doors. Made it the room feel more like a suite. The sink area was separated from the shower/bath with a glass door. Nice design for the shower/bath. This dedicated room where the huge shower area was open to the bath. Encourages a shower then soak. Probably my favorite room layout of any hotel I have stayed at so far for a non-Suite.Staff was very good: from the welcome at Narita, to remembering our names and drinks every morning for breakfast, to the warm greetings each time we returned for the day. I already miss these folks.We used the pool and had it to ourselves. It was in top notch condition. And what a view from there.We stayed a week.

The Shangri-La Hotel Tokyo is an amazing hotel. From the moment you walk in the doors with your luggage, you are made to feel welcome and taken care of. The bell captain makes your luggage disappear as you set foot in the door and makes them reappear in your room later. The reception is friendly and efficient, highlighted by the manager coming out presenting his business card and offering any assistance to fulfill any requests that you may have. The rooms are spectacular, outfitted with luxurious amenities, outstanding views of the city, and technology spread throughout the room, even in the high-tech toilet that are so common in Japan. We availed ourselves with a trip to the spa to get a special offer on the price of a 60 minute massage. The spa facilities were tranquil. The massage absolutely relaxing. Following the massage, they provide tea and an area to rest while they collect your bill to sign. The Japanese restaurant we ate at the hotel was simply incredible. The splurged for the Keiseiki menu and were rewarded with fabulous dishes of Japanese cuisine one after another. Well worth the experience. The buffet breakfast was very good. Good selection at the buffet and an excellent menu of kitchen prepared dishes to choose from. This hotel is definitely worth considering for the luxury traveler who wants convenient access to Tokyo Station with superb service.

Its only 11pm and I still haven't checked out of this hotel, but I feel so empowered to write the review now as I'm looking over the Tokyo skyline with the Imperial palace in the distance. I am on the 37th floor of the Horizon Club suite, with relaxing music playing in the background. I don't want the night to end but being away for over a week on a business trip, I am getting home sick!! However the friendly service and impeccable luxury just makes it harder to leave without some emotions. Make sure you upgrade to the Horizon club as you would be treated like a princess with everything beyond your expectations, the reviews on this hotel are all very true. The location is central, but the complexity of the metro system within Tokyo city station will need to be mastered before you would work out how to get around. However the staff are all very helpful and will give directions followed with well equipped maps for your reference. Everything about this hotel is amazing and its really the personal touch that makes a difference, Such as personalized welcome letter, chocolates, fruits and local snacks on arrival. The special Bvlgari toiletries and super soft pillows along with fine thread count sheets just makes the whole experience even more special. Please allow time for the CHI spa, it is the best in the world, the products and ambience takes you to a world far away. How I wished the time stood still as the hours seem to go like minutes... THANK YOU Shangri La Tokyo for making my stay such a memorable one, I will spread the word back home and now you have set the standard & expectations for my future travels. I will now be a loyal Golden circle fan!

A wonderful hotel, although quite expensive. The staff are amazing, rooms luxurious and situated right at Tokyo station. Breakfast is good, quite a reasonsble range, however other meals, whilst good, are quite expensive. There are hundreds of options close by. Staff couldn't be more helpful in providing assistance and advice. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

This was my partner's second time and my first time at this hotel and it certainly lived up to my high expectations. There was a minor issue regarding the building but it was not really the hotel's fault, although I can see it becoming a constant issue going forward.Location: right next to Tokyo station, extremely convenient, lots of eating outlets around. They have a concierge service that will pick you up and drop you off on the platform if you are coming from Narita on the express train - reason being it's quite difficult to find the hotel on your own through the maze of tunnels and walkways. I'm told even the locals get lost!Service: absolutely impeccable. Nothing was too difficult and everything was done to the high Shangri La standard and a warm smile. Facilities: excellent. There is a pool with amazing views across imperial palace direction, overlooking Tokyo station. The gym had good functional equipment with sports drinks and juices at times. The sauna and hot tub was fantastic especially after walking around all day. Free wifi throughout the hotel. Eating: we ate at Nadaman and the manager there (sorry forgot his name) looked after my dietary requirements, and ensured our night was perfect. It really was! The most amazing Japanese food ever tasted, and it was as excellent both in taste and aesthetics.Room:The best Bose sound system we have ever heard. The bed was big, very comfortable, with a range of pillows on offer. Loccitane toiletries. Massive rain shower head and separate bath tub. We initially had an east facing room, which had amazing views but unfortunately because of the weather outside, would expand the metal structure of the building and create a popping/banging sound, every 30 seconds usually from around 5.30am to 7.30am. Apparently this is a common occurrence even in winter and the hotel is aware of this. Ask for a west-facing room!Overall a very good stay!

Can highly recommend upgrading to Horizon Club on 37thF of this beautiful property, it will exceed your expectations. Apart from such professional, gracious service from all staff, rooms are magnificent offering superb amenities/views and of course, it is a hop, step and a jump from Tokyo Station. Thanks to all at Shangri-La for looking after us. Jan & Rob

The Shangri-La Tokyo is an excellent hotel with great service and a very convenient location (near the back side of the main train station in Tokyo). We had a beautiful room, facing west, toward the imperial palace. Also a nice view of the train station. Hotel staff was very helpful with restaurant suggestions, directions getting around the city, etc. When we left the hotel we traveled by express train to Narita airport and one person from the hotel escorted us to the train platform and helped us move our luggage (complementary service)

The shangri-la hotel is a great hotel with wonderful service.The location cant be beat as it is right next to tokyo station.my room had a great view of downtown tokyo.My room had everything a 5star hotel should have,large screen tv,safe,comfortable bed seperate bath and shower and auto and heated toilet seat.I tried both rest ,both had wonderful food and service.special thanks to all the ladies at reception.thank you to concierge hiroko kamata who helped me navigate tokyo.If i return to tokyo i would stay at the shangri-la.

Great location , just above the central train station. The room decor was lavish and we loved the resto bar overlooking the city! The service was fantastic and the food and beverages options were good.

Visited in May 2016 again.This is truly a five star hotel. Hotel is adorned with Swarovski lighting and amazing floral vase displays - quite stunning.Service is professional, friendly and plentiful from entrance [Bell Hop staff], reception, dining, cleaners and fitness staff. You are well looked after.We stayed on a room overlooking the city this time [previously over Tokyo Station] and this was just as pleasant. Room is spacious, bed is large with luxurious bedding and daily cleaning services with night turndown service. Nespresso machine in room and lots of bottled water. Robes and slippers provided and internet.Breakfast are fantastic. You can order off the menu and also partake in the sumptuious buffet of cereals, cooked foods [European and Japanese both provided], breads, fruits, cheeses and devine pastries. This will fill you up and last you into the afternoon.Had several cocktails in the evening in the bar and must say that the martinis were fabulous. Complimentary snacks provided.Didn't have evening meals in so cant comment.Fitness centre is ok. Not big enough though. Not enough space to do floor exercises and when on floor very conscious of people on machines very close by. If you are just wanting to do cycles there are several of them and popular in use. Staff very helpful. Take note of opening times as they are not ready to open early [Japanese work times differ to Western times]. Spa pool excellent and women had a steam room.If returning to Tokyo will stay at no other hotel. Location is perfect [right beside train networks in Tokyo Central Station] and close to main Department stores for shopping.If you want luxury stay and to feel treated this hotel is the place to stay
user_name:
Julie J
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Located adjacent to the Tokyo station, the Shangri-La is a role model for superb service. Large rooms & bathroom. Wonderful concierge floor ('horizon club'), with great breakfast, snacks and evening hors d'oevres and drinks. Ideally located for both a short walk to the Ginza district and the Imperial Palace. Many thanks to Suyeon Song, Yukari Kobayashi, and Sayumi Tanaki for making this a wonderful stay.

I have been staying in this hotel many times and this is the home away from home for me in Tokyo. Even I had tried many 5 stars (Peninsula, Aman, MO, Ritz, Grand Hyatt, Four seasons, Conrad.....) hotels in Tokyo, this is always my favourite!Location: Since it is located right next to Tokyo station. It is Extremely convenient from both airports especially if you are using Narita. And which also means you can travel to anywhere in Japan by train just a few door step away. Shopping: Many shops, restaurants and department stores are around the hotel and everything is talking about a few minutes walk!!Food: A great Japanese restaurant Nadaman is in the hotel which serve very good Japanese food! Also I must say, they serve the best Japanese breakfast among the 5 stars hotel! Room: Um.... Room in Shangri-la is nothing special, standard 5 stars hotel rooms. You get what you paid for and you won't be disappointed, but also no surprises. Good size though. Room service: Um....... Their room service menu is not promising!!! Choice are limited especially Japanese dishes. You may say no one is gonna have room service when in Tokyo so no need an extended menu, but I always arrive late at night so just don't want go anywhere else in the middle of the night! Then the menu is not promising! I am surprise that they didn't include any food from Nadaman as in the Peninsula, they have special room service menu from their Japanese restaurant. Service: Very good, nice and efficient!!

This is a well located hotel just above Tokyo station with great amenities as one would expect of any 5 star hotel. But that would have described at least a dozen other hotels in the area, and would have done a great disservice to this gem. The best part about this hotel is its staff, who served us with heart and anticipated our every need (at the horizon club lounge, they even noticed that my daughter is left handed, and placed her utensils on her left from the second day- without us saying anything!)The lobby lounge is not to be missed, as Ms Risa and her very capable team would cater to your every possible need. Also, we are very impressed with the service at the Piacere, and the Nadaman, both of which we visited several times in the course of our stay. We had visited many Michelin starred restaurants during our stay, but these 2 restaurants left a lasting impression, which in my opinion is no mean feat. Would definitely recommend a stay here.

5* Hotels in Japan are generally hard to fault... but the Shangri-La in Marunouchi definitely comes up on top for a business trip in town. Many people stay in Roppongi but if you have business meetings, then being close to Tokyo station and the business district is hard to beat, including the convenient express train to Narita Airport which is walking distance (if you don't get lost within Tokyo Station!). And it's quite close to the popular Ginza shopping district. The lobby on 28th floor has a good choice of bars & restaurants, and is more busy than your usual hotel bar. The views from the rooms are amazing (see pic), as all the rooms are above 28th. The bed is large and comfortable, rooms more spacious than your average/comparable hotel in Tokyo and modern sizable bathrooms. Finally, the service (again hard to fault in Japan) is personable and swift, including the room service and the friendly concierge. Not much else to say... Small tip: Get taxis from level B1 rather than street level, much easier!
user_name:
fizios
New York City, New York

review_body: Shangri La is always a sure bet when traveling. What a great located hotel with perfect service and environment. The staff was always very friendly and knowledgeable and they truly care about your stay. 300% recommended. The view was amazing!

Perfect location. Impeccable service. Perfectly clean room with ample amenities that makes every stay super comfortable and easy. Breakfast buffet is unbelievably good and yet simple. The Shangri-La Tokyo is one of the best hotels in the city (at par with the Mandarin and Peninsula) and one of the best in the Shangri-La chain. I always feel like coming home every time I stay here.

Hard not to fall in love with this hotel. 1. Concierge - picked us up from tokyo station and walked us to our hotel. Greeted us by names everyday. Ive never felt more welcome each time i enter. They made such a big difference to my stay.2. Location - maranouchi is beautiful for walks. You can walk to imperial garden. The tokyo train station is right across the hotel which makes everything quite convenient. On taxi: We got a discount on our taxi fare going to haneda airport bec of shang. Not sure how. I did not even request this. Cab driver just deducted. From hotel to haneda, it was 6700 yen. Meter reading was 7k+ 3. Shopping - its a must for ladies like us! One need not look far as daimaru is right across the street. Inside the train station. I also took a stroll around the neighborhood and went inside the beautiful maranouchi building. There were a few well curated shops inside including united arrows.4. Room amenities - need i say more? Shang uses nespresso, jasmine scented l'occitane products. Beddings, pillows, room temp were all perfect. 5. Breakfast - splendid! This one i will definitely miss. I love the opulent interior of the breakfast area. Not to mention the food. Fresh strawberries and kiwi! Im in heaven. You can order poached eggs adorned with truffle on top. Everything was exquisitely done! 6. I want to say a special thank you to shang for the lovely cake they sent to our room for my fathers 74th birthday. The butler lit so many candles to signify 74! And it was such a yummy cake too. Im grateful that i chose shangrila for this tokyo trip. They made it one of the most unforgettable. Tip: if you love your vinos like me, they have a wine cellar with very reasonably priced bottles. Must get a table with a view! Lovely experience!!!!!!!

From the moment we walked in to the the time we checked out the Shangri-La Hotel did not disappoint us. Everything was absolutely perfect, the small things which make a stay in a large hotel like this so memorable were taken care of, even down to a book marker being left on the bed the morning of our first day as they had spotted our books by the bed. The staff were without exception courteous, friendly and engaging. All in all one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in and we've stayed in quite a few. Thank you Shangri-La for making our first few nights in Japan so relaxing and enjoyable.

We had a beautiful room on the 34th floor. Great amenities and fabulous shower. The room was a non-smoking room, but unfortunately you could tell that it had been smoked in recently. I would have asked to change, but we were a late check in as it was.The fitness center was average for a luxury hotel. They had a terrific lap pool and a handful of cardio machines. There was not enough in the way of free weights or machines to get in a serious weight lifting session, however. The service at check in and check out, as well as the bell desk was very friendly and professional. We checked in around 10pm and grabbed a light dinner and drinks in the lobby lounge. My biggest complaint about our stay was the service in the lobby lounge. It was terrible for a 5 star property, and in my experience, very unusual for Tokyo in general. We had to ask for menus, wine list, and had to ask more than once for water. Our dirty plates and utensils sat in front of us for 20 minutes without being cleared.Overall, it was a good location and great room, but I didn't really find it a good value for the price. The extra touches that you expect from the Shangri-La chain just weren't there.

On a business trip to Tokyo, the staff met me at the train station to guide me through the underground maze in Tokyo to get to the hotel. The room was awesome, everything you can need is in the room, from an umbrella, shoe horn, to a hairbrush, toothbrush, etc. The bathroom and shower were top notch, the 2 ft center ceiling rain shower head provided such an awesome shower. would definitely stay at this hotel again.

We are usual visitors to the Shangri-La chain of hotels and visited Tokyo last April to see the famous Cherry Blossoms. The hotel is located on the upper levels of a skyscraper providing incredible views of the Tokyo skyline from almost any room. The staff and restaurant/bar were excellent, especially the breakfast service each morning.The hotel is situated next to the Central Train station providing handy access to the sites of Tokyo and is also close to the Daimuru Shopping Centre and a short walk to the Imperial Palace.The rooms were modern, new and very clean and our adjoining rooms had every possible feature needed. I came down with a 24 hour bug whilst there and the hotel staff we excellent and organised an english speaking doctor to attend my room and had me back to health the next day. We will definitely be back one day when we return to Tokyo.

We were on the 33rd floor. Beautiful views of Tokyo. The breakfast buffet is extraordinary. The fitness center has personalized earphones and an indoor pool.The best thing is that in space-strarved Tokyo the rooms are very spacious and wonderfully equipped. (sometimes difficult to turn off the lights). When we arrived, we were greated by two staff members who spoke to us in their best Japanese, We responded in English and they were happy, It is located right next to the train station and only 10 minutes walk to the imperial gardens. A wonderful hotel!

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The customer experience was of very high standard, with very attentive staff. Extremely comfortable rooms, and excellent facilities. Overall, we had a very good experience. The hotel is next to the main train station which made it easier to commute as well.
user_name:
Alia S
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: We LOVED this hotel, the staff we lovely and always helpful, the room and views were stunning!, breakfast was amazing and the amenities were perfect, right down to the toiletries. We left this hotel to stay in another 5 star in Kyoto and they didn't compare, this was better by far.

On all my previous trips I stayed at the Mandarin in Tokyo, but this time it was fully booked, any my Assistant recommended me the Shangri-La, which has not the complete attention to detail and fantastic service of the Mandarin, but is a great hotel anyway. Location is very good, rooms are good in size, and very clean. Service is great and staff is very friendly. The only negative of the hotel is very poor quality of the wi-fi.Really bad and not ideal to work with my business laptop through a secure connection. For the rest, a great place, where I would go again without hesitation. Is good to have an alternative to the Mandarin.

Book a room with Sky Tree view. Superb !Have a cocktail at the bar its worth it.The LOCATION is the best you can get. You can get on a city or bullet train next door at Tokyo train station.Great experience - M.S. from Switzerland

We always choose Horizon Club rooms at the Shangri-La, rooms are luxurious and they include pre dinner drinks/ canapes and breakfast in the Horizon Club Lounge . Arrivals/departures, transfers and even restaurant bookings are all handled by the super efficient staff in the Horizon Lounge. Whatever the need, it is met here, no more standing in a queue waiting to book in, you arrive in your room relaxed and the luggage follows you. From a welcoming pot of tea to nightly turndowns the service is impeccable.Tokyo Shangri-La didn't let us down, all of our expectations were realised ,and yes, we pay a bit more for this choice, but do yourself a favour and include it in your travel budget you won't regret it.

this luxury hotel occupies several floors of an office building in the central business district. I stayed here for two nights recently and had a great time. The location was convenient, the room was beautiful and luxurious, the amenities were great, room service was yummy, the staff couldn't have been more polite or helpful. highly recommended.
user_name:
tekboy
New York City, New York

review_body: What can I say? Take the best hotel you can find staff it with personnel that can't do enough to make your stay wonderful, and wrap it up with amenities and accoutrements that amaze at every step and there you have a Slice of Heaven on Earth. The location is central and there are many attractions, shop, restaurants, and transportation within walking distance. The Hop on Hop off buss is a few blocks away but be aware they take cash only. There is an underground mall around the corner and a great Italian Restaurant in the next building on the second floor, Papa Milano. Wi Fi is fast and reliable even in your room. Absolutely wonderful!!!

I looked at a few other hotels before booking this one (The Ritz Calrton, The Andaz) but ultimately choose The Shangri-La based on my wonderful experiences at their Vancouver property.This hotel is top notch. From the women who greet you in the lobby to the front desk, the professionalism, courtesy and want to please is incredible.The rooms are really lovely, and I had a city view and could see the SkyTree from my room (though would have preferred an Imperial Palace/Park view which the other rooms look out over). They are wonderfully spacious, and again, attention to detail at every turn, from the master light switch to the automated blinds.The property itself is amazing, with a pool on the 35th floor, and a hot tub in the men's locker room.The only downside is that the area the hotel is in is a little antiseptic. But you are super close to the Imperial Gardens and Ginza (both just a few short blocks away). It is super convenient, though, if taking the Narita Express to/from Tokyo Station!

Being accustomed to Shangri La service, we booked this hotel as our final stop after a three-week journey across Northern China and Taiwan. Upon arrival to this hotel we were greeted in the basement level where the car dropped us off. The main lobby is located at 27th floor of the high-rise building. The view from the lobby and the bar was outstanding and you could see Tokyo nearly 360°. We were given room 3724, which I think is the best room of the whole hotel complex. I don't have time to write that many paragraphs describing the degree of luxury and perfection required to describe the room. I could just say it's been the best hotel room I've ever stayed in with the best view and amenities. All of this three steps away from the concierge. Her name is Tamoko; was a fine lady and provided my wife and I with superb and exquisite service with attention to detail and made our stay there outstanding. She got us tickets for several events eight floating sumo matches and local regional theater. We spent four nights and five complete days and this hotel, which was perfectly located. They even had bicycles for rentals, which were the best way to get to know the Giza district.I strongly recommend this hotel for those who want to visit Tokyo in style and comfort. There might be other more look Shuri us hotels, however unlikely with the degree of service gotten in the Shangri La.My best congratulations to the manager and all the staff.Hope to see you all soon!!!

My family and I stayed here for 10 days and wish it would have been more. We usually cannot afford such luxuries but after a 14 hour flight and having planned for over a year we were due for some fancy living. The hotel itself is amazing - it shares floors with a business but once you get up to the hotel floors you notice this sweet delicate smell that is just awesome! We looked forward to it every time we came back from a tour. The staff was so friendly and attentive. They walk you to your room, show you all the gadgets and let you get settled. You will love the layout of the huge tub an your warm biget! You must try their afternoon tea, spa treatments and pool. We were able to relax and really enjoy our hotel; I really wanted to live there and the restaurants were awesome too! Not only is it located next to Tokyo Station so you can grab any train you could possible need, but you are also close enough to Ginza to just walk over and shop or just shop inside Tonyo station too. There is a huge shopping mall inside where you can get everything you could possible need.If you want to stay in central Tokyo, close to the Imperial Palace, shopping and transport, plus get outstanding service, stay here!!!

Shangri-la has a great location in the building above Tokyo station (with many metro lines, JR lines and Shinkansen).Note that Tokyo Station is so big that it is a little bit difficult to find the right way to the metro/JR lines at the beginning…We were in a Horizon Club Deluxe with Imperial Garden view (and partial view on Mont Fuji if not too cloudy).The room itself was very clean and convenient even if a little bit old-fashioned. View on Tokyo was amazing (just above the railway station and in front of Imperial Garden). As usual, it’s worth to take a room at Club floor to have access to the lounge which is very cosy and quiet compared to the main restaurants.As everywhere in Japan, service is excellent (even if not yet at the exceptional level of Intercontinental Osaka which was really amazing). Horizon Club staff was very kind (late checkout immediatly proposed, invitation to come back at the lounge before getting our luggage to go to the airport...).Swimming pool is very nice but I was a little bit disappointed by the SPA which is very simple.We had the chance to observe Mont Fuji with a very clear weather in the morning. Our room (3607) was not the best one to see the Mont Fuji (partial view only). Prefer room 3602, 3603 to have the best views ! Fuji can also be viewed from the swimming pool.

Stayed here for four nights on business trip. Location is closed to the Tokyo station but it does take a while to find it due to the numerous pathways inside the station. The pathway is under renovation. From the Tokyo station take the Nihonbashi exit, its closest to the hotel. If you take the subway, the closest station is Otemachi (exit B7). The room is spacious, living to the Shangri-la high standard.

Went on a solo trip to Tokyo for a concert and couldn't be happier I decided to stay here. The service alone is impeccable. I received several emails before my stay confirming my arrival and departure time. Once they learned I was coming in by train they offered their free pickup service. I was picked up by the bell hop service exactly on time. It was raining that day but she brought umbrellas for the both of us. She greeted me with a smile, verified my name and took my bag. Once she realized I didn't speak Japanese she immediately switched to English! The walk to the hotel is sooooo quick, the longest part is inside the train station. The hotel is right next door! She chatted with me during the walk and asked if this was my first trip to Tokyo. She was very nice and allowed me to take her picture for my trip collection. Once inside she escorted me directly to reception for checkin and took my bag to my room! I arrived around 1100 so I was expecting my room not to be ready but right away I was checked in. The receptionist spoke excellent English and I was checked in quickly. She gave me a free meal card for being a member along with the wifi information. Surprisingly my room was ready and she escorted me to my room!! I didn't have the room I wanted (premier) but I WAS NOT disappointed. I had a regular king deluxe room and I was blown away. The amenities are fantastic and the service is top notch. The mini bar is stocked! Alcohol on first shelf, assorted teas and coffee with a coffee machine and a tea set to make tea on the others! Fridge is stocked as well with some snacks in there. The closet has the usual things along with a umbrella. The bathroom area is nice with the shower and tub in a room with a small step down. There is a window in the shower area so you can still see the view, but a curtain of course if you want privacy. They had snacks waiting on the desk and my bag was in the chair. They have a drawer of things you might forget and if you use anything it's replaced the next day. I hung up my dress for the concert later and left the room for lunch and when I returned there was fresh fruit and silverware waiting for me. I went to hang something else up and noticed she had given me really nice plush ladies hangers for my dress and nice shirts!!!! What a nice touch that she noticed I brought dressy clothes. My heart melted from the attention to detail. For lunch I ate in the lounge and true to fashion service was excellent. The food was delicious and when someone didn't speak English they immediately sent someone else over to help. The view was beautiful as well. I left for the night and attended a concert, the taxi area is on the ground floor and I never had a problem. They give you a card for the taxi so you have no worries getting back to the hotel. If no taxi is there you wait inside in the area comfortable from the outside. Once the taxi arrives they make sure the driver knows exactly where you are going! Talk about seamless service. Upon returning from the concert they always say welcome back! They open the doors and always get the elevator open and press the floor for you. They even helped me take pictures of my outfit and when I put my things in the chair they picked it up and held it! I ate a late dinner in the lounge, was taken to a nice table which offered some privacy cause I was still dressed up. I ordered the chocolate martini and was blown away when it came. It was in a bag and it was smoky! She opened the bag and the chocolate melted! The service was quick and the food hit the spot. Back in my room the bed was turned down with slippers placed by the bed, a pair of pajamas, bedtime story on a bookmark and a bottled water with a glass by the bed. I felt like I was being tucked in for the night. The next day I decided to have lunch in the lounge before heading out to shop and sightsee. I was immediately seated at the bar area and once again when they realized I spoke English they made sure my server did as well. She gave me a stool for my purse!!! I think this made me never want to leave, someone understanding that you don't want to put your expense purse on the floor is heaven. I decided to get the afternoon tea option and was pleased. It came with little sandwiches, your choice of tea from a menu, a variety of scones with jams and honey and a variety of cute desserts. I was helped by so many people I felt important! When I went to refill my tea cup someone immediately came over and poured it for me!I left the hotel again by taxi and was given another hotel card for the taxi and the staff made sure the taxi took me to the right place. I returned hours later tired from shopping but was greeted with a smile and a welcome back. They got the elevator again and pressed the lobby floor. Each time you walk through the lobby you are greeted with a smile. After a quick nap in the most comfortable bed ever I had my free meal in piacere. Oh goodness, the food was good! I had the ribs, meatballs and potatoes. I didn't feel like a cocktail and wanted a soda instead. They apologized that only the lounge offered sodas, but not to worry that they walked over and got it for me. The service was the same, seamless.I returned to my room and noticed the maid had put the things I left out (comb, lotion etc) in the bathroom area on towel and all setup for me. So sweet of her. My bed was once again turned down, with fresh water, fresh pajamas, a new bedtime story and slippers. The view from the huge window is massive but the curtain offers a electronic night and day option if you choose to sleep in. I checked out the next day sad to leave. The check out was a bit slower because my rate was different than when I booked. But they apologized for the delay. I was given directions from the bell hop ladies of which way to go once inside the station. As I was walking in the station there were some bell hop ladies heading to meet another family. They noticed me from the hotel and took their time to make she I got to the right train!! I arrived back at my platform on time and ready for my train with no worries. I can't say enough about this hotel and their staff. Yes it is a bit expensive but you get what you pay for! I am extremely happy with my the service and hotel and I'm planning another Tokyo trip just so I can stay here again. Don't look at the price just book it!!! You won't be disappointed, I felt like royalty while staying here.

Wonderful stay our first visit to Tokyo. Extremely helpful staff nothing is too much trouble .customer service second to none .Beautifully appointed spacious rooms fantastic shower and fabulous toiletries We had breakfast on 2 days which was equally delciouso

I was greeted with a friendly welcome at the front door, and they proceeded to lead me into the elevator then bowed (they were VERY polite). The room had enormous windows and a great view of the city. The hotel was very clean and had a luxurious feel to it. I really liked their bathroom amenities as they were from loccitaine . I would definitely stay here again!

Spent 3 nights at the shangri-la, standard of service superb, minor details so noticeable. Excellent breakfast buffet, coffee cup never empty, napkin in place each time you return from the buffet. Little things like always prompt elevators. With the first floor being 29 stories up, rooms blissfully quiet, good blend of traditional and modern, black out lights very effective.

Rarely do you come across a hotel which cannot be faulted, 5 stars in every sense. From the moment we arrived by car, our bags taken from us and delivered to our room, we were then taken in person to the Club lounge on the 37th floor and 'checked in', very informally. We had a Horizon club room on the 36th floor with partial views overlooking the Imperial Palace grounds and looking down onto the railway station. The room was very large with a big bathroom, bath and independent shower, couch area in the main bedroom with lots of electrical kit, electric blinds for daytime and electric curtains for nighttime, TV in the wash basin area as part of the wall. Various switches for lights and a plug and charge area for phones, tablets and so on. The quality was exceptional. Then we come to the Staff, they couldn't do enough for us, the club lounge staff were out of this world! Great views from the club lounge over parts of the city. Underground shopping malls, the subway, the railway station all minutes away from the hotel, Ginza no more than 10 mins walk, the Imperial Palace about the same.Breakfast in the lounge is really good, both hot and cold options available, also able to take breakfast in the main restaurant. We did not eat other meals at the hotel except the breakfast.Thank you Shangri-La for exceeding our high expectations, your Hotel and Staff are truly exceptional.

This hotel is based closed to a Central Sattion but this movements of the trains did not affect our stay. The hotel is located on the 28th floor of the building and the Club Lounge is located on the 37th Floor with excellent views of the city. The main Resturant is located on the 28th floor and has views towards the Imperial Palace. The staf are extremely helpful and nothing is too much trouble. Rooms are lovely and spacious - our rim was on 36 h floor. We requested a late check out and this again was not a problem and they were more than happy to look after our cases until our transport arrived and gave us access to showers and change facilities so that we could change prior to our flight., we would definitely return to this hotel.

Walking from the hotel to the main Tokyo station is always a plus for this hotel. Of course the chic and quietness of Shangri-La Tokyo PLUS the lovely staff is always what draws me to this hotel. It is more business like in this lovely hotel and I like that. The Horizon Club lounge is so nice and just right itty bitties with champagne in the evening. Excellent room amenities plus lovely room and those oh so amusing "automatic" warm toilet seats!!! Love it!

Just returned from an amazing stay at this Hotel. From first stepping foot in this Hotel, staff are on hand to see to all of your needs. So welcoming and friendly. The Hotel is very central for everything especially train station which we used quite frequent. Twice the Staff escorted us to the station to make sure we were on correct train as never visited a station as large as this one. We stayed in a Suite which was so comfortable with lovely views. The rooms are immaculate and housekeeping work so hard. Breakfast available in two dining rooms with an excellent menu and display of fresh fruits, pastries etc. Tokyo is one of the most exciting cities I've visited as we crammed lots of sightseeing in our visit especially the flowering cherry blossom. I would certainly return to this Hotel as it made our holiday perfect.

This is one of the finest hotels in the world with the very best service. The rooms were immaculate and views were awesome. Highly recommend this hotel. There is really cool art in the hotel. The horizon club is worth it.

Our room was comfortable, lovely and well equipped. Only tip to offer is to use the do not disturb button when getting changed as I nearly got caught out. The staff were so helpful, from those on the bell desk to the receptionist who booked our early airport taxi which arrived within five minutes. We didn't eat in the restaurants as my other half was up and out before 7.30 each day and we had plans each evening. We did try the bar lounge before and after heading out in the evening and the service was faultless. The cheese board was an excellent as a late night snack. The location is perfect! I did however get lost for an hour finding it so do arrange a hotel escort from the train station when you land. Tokyo station is a huge maze and you will easily get lost.

I have stayed here before on business, and do immensely enjoy the comfort, amenities and outlook of the rooms. The location at one end of Tokyo station is convenient, and the greeting service at the platform if arriving by Shinkansen very helpful. So as far as the room and hotel facilities are concerned, it's absolutely first class. However I do find the service at breakfast a little too intense, and feel that because the staff are always rushing, they tend to frequently lean right across people with minimal warning; this, I don't like at all, and pointed it out a few times. My single greatest disappointment (probably over the last decade) relates to my room booking here made on points. At check-in I asked if it would be feasible to change to a twin-bedded room. It was not essential to change, just simply that I was suffering from a Sakura allergy and thus twin beds would be less impact on my Wife and Daughter. My room was changed but there was no mention whatsoever by reception staff of the associated cancellation charge plus an additional points charge, which I only discovered a day after arriving home in Thailand. Yes, on reflection the T's & C's do mention the conditions for changing a room, but it's amazing that reception staff cannot highlight this to a guest? Imagine if such treatment was replicated with routine everyday retail transactions and you discovered multiple additional charges on your credit card statement at the end of the month because staff had not mentioned associated additional costs! Any Golden Circle members will realise how much Shangri-La Hotels have been promoting Loyalty recently, so I truly find it astonishing that staff at a hotel of this standard could be so deceitful. I would sincerely hope that all of the Shangri-La Tokyo management are not supportive of the manner in which this room change was handled; this is a lesson to anyone else who might find themselves in a similar situation at this property.

Stayed at this property on business, and the service was above and beyond what I expect from a five star hotel. Everyone, from the maids cleaning the room, to the concierges, to the lounge staff, to the doormen went out of their way to make my trip pleasant, and addressed me by name when I arrived and left the hotel. The Horizon Club was a little oasis, with a beautiful view of the city. The restaurant breakfast was superb, and the chef went out of his way to ensure I found delicious vegetarian food every day. Highly recommend.

This was by far the best hotel we have ever stayed at from the room to the staff to the meals. It's hard now to stay at other hotels after you have been to an amazing one like Shangri-La. It was funny that we would leave our dirty clothes in a pile by our luggage when we went out for the day and when we returned at night, the hotel staff had folded our dirty laundry and placed it neatly on the couch! I have never been to a place where they fold your dirty laundry for you! So if you don't want it folded, make sure you stuff it way down in your bag lol. The staff really makes this a great place to stay, my husband had left his phone on one of the bullet trains we had taken and because we didn't speak Japanese fluently enough for converse with the police department, the hotel staff actually took care of the whole process for us and got our phone back. On top of that, my husband left his wedding ring on the bedside table after we checked out and the hotel staff ended up mailing the ring in a little pouch back to us with a kind note telling us thank you for staying with them and if there was anything else they could do to please let them know! The server for breakfast was super nice, polite and on point with the service. The people at the fitness center kept that place spotless. I know that i was sweating when I was working out and they always kept the water bottles stocked and I know that as soon as I left they were wiping down all the equipment and making sure it was ready for the next person that came in. The spa was excellent as well. The massage therapist I had did an excellent job. Seriously I can't say enough good things about this place, and I know that when we go back to Tokyo this is where I want to stay at again. The bad part is that now every other hotel we go to, we always end up comparing it to this hotel and it doesn't even come close :(

Excellent staff with excellent service. Excellent location as it is just beside Tokyo station. Had a chance to see beautiful sakuras which was just opposite the hotel. Excellent room and bathroom with all the thoughtful amenities.
