U get what u pay for. Surely, its not a cheap place, however, the rooms, the lounge, the service...everything is very nice. A couple of cons though. No direct buses from/to Haneda airport. I guess when u r staying at Shangri la, u should only take limousines. Another issue was that the hotel entrance is very small and hard to find, especially with construction going on - and the actual front is up on the 20 something fl.- so my taxi driver had to circle around a bit, which was brutally expensive. Still, would probably be back when visiting Tokyo.
user_name:
SoulfulSeoul
New York City, New York

review_body: Great views from all rooms. Great restaurants and lounge. Beautiful swimming pool. An excellent choice in Tokyo. Would recommend for anyone visiting for leisure or business. Breakfast experience very enjoyable.
user_name:
CJTQ
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff and service provided by this hotel were excellent. Location Superb, Staff Polite and efficient and always willing to go that extra mile to ensure your stay was memorable. WIll definately staying here on my next visit to Tokyo.

This is not only about location, but an excellent hotel with very spacious rooms and very good service.We spent two nights and we feel very good all the time during our stay, from the check in until the end of our stay, the way the attendants prepare the room and the service mind by all the staff we encounter in the restaurants and lounge.Location is just around the corner of Tokyo Station, so this means that is an excellent base to move around the city, get from Narita airport with the NEX train (15 minutes walking from the train to the Nihonbashi exit at Tokyo Station and with so many shops and restaurants around. You can reach Ginza in 15 minutes (walking).You also have two other main subway stations within less than 5 minutes walking distance (Otemachi Station – B10, Nihombashi – A3). Internet speed by cable was very good, although wifi not as fast as it should be. Breakfast was simply outstanding with a short but excellent food selection, plus the option to order some Japanese and oriental sets and any kind of egg dishes. Service was prompt and very efficient.This is the kind of place where you feel pity you have to leave and for sure our favorite place for future stays in Tokyo.

We stayed here twice during our 3 weeks trip in Japan and experienced poor level of service. We don't like writing bad review but we still feel bitter about this place... so here you go.1. Check In The lobby area of this hotel is absolutely tiny and it is always packed with Japanese ladies visiting hotel's afternoon tea or large group of wedding guests. When we arrived there was absolutely no one to greet us. The reception was busy so we sat one of the only two benches and waited to be served. But some people arrived after us started form the line and the reception staff began serving these people first. We guessed they didn't see us... even so we just arrived from Narita carrying huge suits cases and directly sitting opposite. We felt silly that we have to queue to check in in such a small reception space ( and this is 5 star hotel). For our 2nd visit check in was even worse. We were hoping that we would be greeted like " Welcome back Mr xxx how was your trip to Kyoto !" but we were wrong. They couldn't even find our reservation in the system and they really dealt with us badly. Basically they said there was no reaervation under our name but if we want we could stay by making a new booking. "Oh! you are lucky we still have a room" We were annoyed since we had a copy of reservation confirmation but it wasn't good enough. So, we ended up showing the credit card bill!!! We booked directly from hotel website using advance purchase rate so the money was already taken a month ago. This was our worst checking in experience for travelling 25 years in asia. The reception staff were all cold, unhelpful, and unproffesional. They even couldn't find the record of us staying there 10 days ago. What they thought we were? Stupid forigners trying to have a free night in 5 star hotel? We felt very sad and truly regretted coming back to this hotel again. 2 Room Service  To cut the long story short, basically no one picks up tel during busy time 7:30-8:30pm One evening we were told by a girl who answered the phone that they were all out and that's why no one answered ( sounds like pizza delivery). We always enjoy in room dining at Shangri la but this endless telephone calling was so irritating we orderd less than usual.3 Poor concierge serviceWe requested to book sushi counter at Nadaman restaurant in the hotel but we were told the restaurant was fully booked that night. So, we asked the other restaurant recommendation within walking distance, and by surprise, they gave us the english floor guide of Roppongi Hills ! We were so tired that day and decided to have a look at Nadaman anyway..... well... we couldn't believe our eyes it was totaly empty. Only 4 tables were occupied and no one was at the sushi counter. Sushi chef was absolutely brilliant his smile really made our day. We stayed in the restaurant till 11:00 but it was empty all the time.  We have been telling our friends this Shangri la is nothing like other Shangri la in other asian countries where professionalism meets warm friendliness. After Shangri la we moved to Ritz Carlton and sadly the place was much better run, even so we like staying asian hotel chain while travelling in asia. Also the view from RItz was better in our opinion. But the best hotel during this trip was Okura. The place reminded us true Japanese hospitality. Next time if we want to stay near Tokyo station we want try Four Seasons or Peninsula. Shangri la is wrong end of Tokyo station. Anyway, we will keep using Shangri la in Singapore and Malaysia but never again in Tokyo.

They provide you with top class services, best room quality, great comfort and convenience. It worths the money. Dont forget that they provide escort services to and from Tokyo Station Platforms, just inform the hotel well beforehand. Just above the Tokyo station, you may find it very easy to go anywhere starting from here. The First Avenue and Daimaru is just 5 minutes walking distance. If you have a boy, go to the Tomica Shop there !

This the third time I have had the privilege of staying at this hotel, the rooms and central location are why I keep coming back ! Please keep the prices down, as the recently renovated Palace hotel is looking amazing and is cheaper when I last checked.

Arrived early at the hotel and was asked to wait 18 minuttes in the lounge having a great breakfast - the lounge manager updated me twice during the breakfast about the room being ready. To my great delight I was upgraded to a nice corner room and my bags & ammenities was already in the very big aand comfortable room. From the front desk to horizon club manager the service and attention to details is brilliant - really made me feel at home away from home. The happy hour in the lounge is a non-stop service af quality drinks and small food - everything with a warm smile. Needless to say that the rooms are fantastic and the food bloody brilliant. This is a great location and I will definatly give it my best recomnendations.

Usually when staying at a hotel, however comfortable I start to miss the comforts of home. Not the Shangri-La Tokyo. It felt like I was in a better version of home. Every aspect of this hotel was amazing! I will go through a couple of pros and cons for the sake of the people researching where to stay in Tokyo but just to preface, if you can afford it please consider staying at this hotel! Pros:Rooms: The hotel itself is very tastefully decorated. I really appreciated the high ceilings throughout the hotel (even in the elevators), which is a luxury in Tokyo. The rooms felt incredibly spacious. Every aspect of the rooms was carefully thought out, from the Nespresso coffee machine to the super comfortable pajamas and slippers that were provided. I especially loved loved the bathtub and the specious shower. The bed was also so so so incredibly comfortable. I slept like a baby the entire stay also because the sound insulation at the hotel was so good - you never hear running water or noises coming from any other room. Service: Service at Shangri-La was exceptional. I was very very impressed by the level of English of all the staff. What I especially noticed was how every member of the staff, from room service, bell to even cleaning staff had impeccable manners and always gave us a warm welcome.View: We had a corner room on the 35th floor and it was breathtaking. I could sit and watch the view all day. It was especially relaxing to look out into the Tokyo skyline while taking a relaxing bath. Cons: (I wouldn't say these are huge flaws but a few things that could be done better at the hotel, which didn't significantly diminish the quality of my stay). Location: Although the hotel is located very close to the Tokyo station, the station itself is a labyrinth. I took the Narita Express from the airport and did not expect to be so overwhelmed. It took me close to 30 minutes to find the right exit to the hotel and even once I found the right exit I wasn't sure how to get to the hotel. Although I heard you could ask the hotel to pick you up from your train, I would have appreciated more detailed directions on the website and better signage. Gym: I found the gym to be a little small. Because of this, it felt a little uncomfortable to have a staff member inside the gym. I felt like I was being watched!Room Service: I did not get a chance to try the breakfast buffet at the hotel (because I wanted to save my appetite for other food delights in Tokyo) but I did order the Japanese breakfast room service once and found it to be rather mediocre. But the service was excellent. All in all, I still consider this one of the best hotel stays out of anywhere in the world.

I have stayed in many hotels around the world and a few in India compare.Large rooms with fantastic bath area that has a separate shower room.Amenities are top quality.From the moment that you are met at the train station you appreciate the fantastic service,terrific concierge,full breakfast and great bar area,Hotel reception is on 28th floor and rooms are above.Tokyo station is one minute away.We stayed in regular city view room.I can only imagine what suites or club floor is like

The service was wonderful, the bathrooms were amazing, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. This hotel is a must try, especially if you need to be conveniently located in the financial district. I will definitely come back again.

Third time in Tokyo, First time to be in Shangri-La Hotel, First time to spend it with friends! This travel privilege is the best birthday present ever. I will always love Shangri-La hotels and Shangri-La Tokyo is no exemption. The pool is my friends and my favorite because of its overlooking view of the city. As expected, the food was divine and the service was just exquisite. I love how everything is standardized from one place to another. When you’re with Shangri-La, you’ll have your satisfaction guaranteed. We crashed in 2 rooms and we spent more time sleeping and saying in the hotel than going out and about shopping. Definitely the best travel tour this year. I recommend Shangri-La to all travel and comfort buffs.

This is an excellent hotel with fabulous service. We had 2 rooms here from 10-14 Dec, 2013. The swimmming pool was excellent, especially for serious swimmers who are trying to keep up their fitness and water feeling while on holiday. They have even cordoned off a lane for laps, something my daughters, who swim competitvely, appreciated very much. The gym was well equipped. Most of all, every service staff displayed excellent levels of attentiveness and responsiveness. We appreciated that all had excellent command of English. The rooms are very spacious, something to be treasured in land-scarce Tokyo. Needless to say, the location next to Tokyo Station makes it super convenient for almost any traveller's needs.

As a frequent business traveller, I regularly experience 5 star hotels throughout Australia/Asia/pacific/USA. On this occasion I spent a single night at the Shangri-La Tokyo with my family - returning from a ski trip. I would rate it the best hotel I have ever experienced in both service and appointments. Great location also, being adjacent to Tokyo central station.

Shangri-La was supurb in all respects. From meeting us at the train to guide us to the hotel, to an excellent health club and pool. Service was unbelievable. They spoiled us...... They also allowed us a wheelchair for the three days we were there.

This is a really beautiful hotel and the staff here are incredible. They are so gracious - I suspect they are all hand picked - because each and every staff member here - not only provide the best service to their ability but they also show initiative and genuine warmth. Not stuffy at all - as I anticipated. Instead - friendly. How pleasant.The hotel is literally dripping in contemporary art works - its amazing really - even the elevators!The breakfast is scrumptious - it really knocks the socks off any other hotel breakfast I've ever experienced. The special selection choices - were outstanding.The only only criticism is the allowance of smoking in public areas. Its really not a good idea in these modern times when health issues should require better policy direction. However loved the signature fragrance upon entry to the hotel.

For the past ten years we have come to Tokyo many times and stayed at different hotels, from budget inn and upscale chain hotels. This time I chose to stay at the Shangri La as my wife stayed here for meetings and it appeared to be a good idea to join her afterwards. We stayed at the horizon floor with club access which gave us a great view over the east side of Tokyo. Service was spotless, staff very knowledgeable and the room was very quiet. Hotel is right next to Tokyo station which makes it very easy to go anywhere. We paid Amex FHR rate which is good value for us

Everything about this hotel is perfect: location, staff, services, room, bathroom… As we were planning to travel to Hiroshima on the 1st January, we asked the hotel to purchase the train tickets and charge the room bill. All was done with competence, and the tickets were waiting for us when we checked in. The hotel offers a very useful "meet and greet" service at the train platform in Tokyo Station, right next to the hotel. The pool is awesome, lovely view. Highly recommended. Free wi-fi in all rooms.

Rooms were great, staff highly professional and exquisite food. Every time I had to call the concierge, they were highly responsive. The two restaurants I've tried (afternoon tea and japanese) were serving exquisite food and the ambiance at the bar were very nice (great view of Tokyo from there).

We had a lovely stay at Shangri-La Hotel in Tokyo. The staff were great and welcoming all the time. Our Japanese is poor but the staff nearly all spoke English very well. The rooms were very comfortable and the food and service was tremendous. We would recommend the Shangri-La very highly.

This is the second time our family has stayed at Shangri-La Tokyo. Again the experience was amazing, second to none. The staff are wonderfully warm and so courteous and extremely helpful. Rooms are luxuriously beautiful throughout. The food is truly delicious. Location is perfect, right next door to Tokyo station, literally a 1 min walk - staff even take you and collect you from your bullet train platform. Do yourself a favour and stay here, just for the experience!

First visit to Tokyo and the hotel was very comfortable, great beds, everything worked but overall lacking in ambiance. All staff very polite and efficient, in fact "very efficient" sums up the hotel. Good hotel to get over inevitable jt lag after long flight from Europe.

Stayed here in Nov and could t be happier. Really top class service and went out of the way to help in any way they could. Room was very contemporary and a really lovely health club and gym.Hotel breakfast which was included in the rate was really nice and a great selection.

180 degree change from my experience at the Fullerton in Singapore, Shangri-La Tokyo was just superb. Service, service and service. Despite the fact the hotel is located near the very busy Tokyo station, it is so peaceful. Once you are in the hotel, very calm and beautiful. I once lost my earring and they found it and returned it to me! Since then, I have been a great fan. Once again, they did not disappoint me.
It was very nice. The room was really comfortable. I LOVE the hotel's decoration.

It was my first time in this hotel. The hotel is located INSIDE (or nearly) Tokyo Central station. It's soooo convient to travel all around Japan as no need for a cab. It's best location if you need to do 3 or more cities from Tokyo by train (expl. North and South). The hotel is brand new and at level of Shangri la in Asia. The indoor pool is beautiful (not very deep of course) with a view on Tokyo. Rooms are very confortable and breakfast is excellent. Concierge was perfect to organise limo to airport.

We booked a Horizon Premier room of this hotel.The hotel is very centrally located next to Tokyo Station, near the Imperial Palace; and since its located in the top floors of an office building and therefore very quiet.Our room, which was located on a corner of the building, had wonderful large glass surfaces with great views.The service at the hotel was excellent every time; and the room service even outstanding.It is definitely worth a visit.

This chain in tokyo was a surprise the ambience is sophisticated but it still carries the shangrila colors. By far one of the best shangrila hotels. The only comment is not enough japanese choices for food. Room was excellent including amenities!

I have stayed at 17 Shangri La Hotels and this may be the best one, even knocking my sentimental favourite of Singapore off the winning spot. Our room had an a true 'wow' effect as there was an amazing full window over Tokyo under which was a built-in curved divan couch which stretched the full window length. I would have been happy to lie there all day with Tokyo at my feet. The hotel organised a personal city guide for us, her English language skills were excellent and her general knowledge of the city seemed inexhaustible. The famous Shangri La breakfast buffet was smaller than usual as the hotel seems to have fewer rooms than the average S-L, however it was exquisitely presented with all that one could desire. We ate at the hotel's excellent Nadaman restaurant as well. Highly recommended!!

Stayed here for 4 nights as part of a 14 day holiday to Japan. What an excellent base for our first time in Tokyo. Stayed at a few other shangri la properties before and this one is up there, as with the others, service is exceptional. Every staff member is courteous and happy. A special mention to the girls who are the bell hops, they seem genuinely happy to help and nothing is an issue. They will collet you from your arrival at Tokyo station which is massive so it's a good help. Our room was gorgeous, large and had a lovely shower/bath area. Ten days after check out we returned to Tokyo for the day and the hotel kindly stored our luggage for the day and expected us. A definite choice if you're looking for a five star stay in Tokyo.

I've read many reviews before choosing this hotel, so I was prepared that the room is big the location is good etc. But the hotel exceeded expectations: service was excellent, newspapers in the morning, sleepwear in the evening, views, spa, and STAFF! The concierge (unfortunately don't remember his name, but he usually was at the desk the first half of the day... the lady which was just OK was in the second half) was incredibly helpful and cheerful... big respect! We were very much touched how the hotel staff helped us to get to Narita express train. The guy was standing in front of the train window waiting until the train started to move...! All small things make the big picture look excellent. Apart from the details: room was really good, breakfast was really good, pool/spa was really good... would definitely recommend this hotel, one of the best I've ever stayed in! PS. Free champagne on breakfast would make the hotel even better ;)

Just next door to the Tokyo train station, this hotel is very conveniently located. Tokyo Station is like a mini city on its own with restaurants and al kinds of shops. On very cold days, we stayed indoors. Access to the rest of Tokyo and Japan is easy. Choices of JR or subway trains available. Walk to Ginza is relatively easy. The room decor could be improved but otherwise, it is very clean, generous amenities refilled twice a day. Lounge is nicely decorated and has interesting breakfast choices included on the price of the room. My favorites are sautéed mushrooms, Lobster Benedict, fresh fruit selection, cold cuts, salads, very good croissants and butter, and fresh fruit juices. Room views are the beautiful. If there would be promotional rate, I would give 5 stars for overall value. But having stayed at better priced Hyatt Regency Shinjuku that necessitated looong walks to or long waits of free shuttle bus to Shinjuku Station, I realize that convenience has a price. :)

Stayed in this hotel in Dec 2012 (holiday) and Nov 2013 (business). I don't know how Shangrila Tokyo managed it; everything about this hotel was so good that I believe it is one of the best in the world. Location, physical condition and quality of services are extraordinary. Employees enjoy servicing guests. There seems to be motivation to never disappoint guests and to give more than what the guests expect. My family, including my young children, and I have so many good experience in this hotel, it is too long to explain. A hotel I would recommend to family and friends for both business and family holiday trips.

We decided to stay at the Shangri-La in Tokyo because it is a fairly new hotel, we trust their impeccable service and the most significant feature would be in our opinion, the train/subway station next door. We as a family enjoy venturing in new places and discovering the city's hidden treasures; the best way to do that is by foot / subway / train. Unfortunately during our stay, the Marunouchi Tokyo station was undergoing some kind of renovation and this caused a bit of confusion for us in the beginning. Otherwise, when you get your orientations right, traversing the station was very easy. Compared to Ginza, Shibuya, Roppongi etc. Marunouchi felt like the New York financial district had gone on holiday. Moreover we've discovered quite a good number of restaurants which are walking distance from the hotel; most especially a good Takoyaki stall a block away from the hotel. We were booked in the 33rd floor and the view from our room felt like we were living in the clouds. Our vacation became even more memorable because we were given connecting rooms between our kids, which made our stay even more enjoyable. Although we've stayed in other Shangri-La Hotels, the Tokyo service was different in the sense that it felt more personal and genuine; definitely one of our top ten hotel experiences. We'll definitely do a repeat stay soon.

An unforgettable trip! Me and my family stayed at this hotel for New Year holiday, and everything is just awesome. Ginza, Mitsukoshi, Takashimaya and Royal palace are all within walking distance, We went there during the big holiday in Japan, so many stores were closed early but we weren't worried at all because we were so looking forward to go back to the hotel to enjoy their facility and looking at their views. Just by typing this review makes me want to go back to Shangrila Tokyo again.

I've stayed at this well located hotel about 5 times in the last 2 years.Whilst a little smaller than most of the other Shangri La hotels I've visited (however the rooms are still a good size, particularly relative to most Tokyo hotel rooms), it is however very well located (right about Tokyo station), and like all Shangri La hotels, their level is service is as always, impeccable, and it is very well presented.

Having stayed at most of the Western brands in Tokyo, this one hotel is special. Location is excellent--attached to Tokyo Station. Hotel is new--about 2 years old. Room are modern. Beautifully appointed with nice wood paneling. The curtains have electronic controls. Had the view of the Tokyo Bay but have also stayed with the view of the station (always fascinating to watch the trains come and leave the station--just like staying at a airport hotel and watching planes take off and land). Prices are typical of 5-star hotels in Tokyo.Small fitness center but a nice pool. The Spa is expensive! ~$250 for a massage.Breakfast $40--nice. Cup of cappuccino ~$12. Afternoon high-tea about $40. Lunch at the Japanese restaurant was excellent--beautiful setting--really zen-like. Italian restaurant for dinner was very good--chef from Italy. Nice 4-course paired with a great Barolo--expensive but worth it. For something more reasonable--there are so many restaurants in the vicinity (Marunouchi Building or basement of Daimaru store next door). There is something special about their service. Stay there to enjoy it first hand.

We were at the Shangri La Tokyo for less than 24 hours but while we were there we definitely used the services of the hotel!Yes- you pay top dollar but it was worth every dime. The check in service on the club level was amazing and accommodating a group of tired American travelers. They helped us arrange a bike tour and navigate the subways. All with patience and smiles.Breakfast in the morning is included-- beyond the amazing buffet set up you could order anything off the menu- all included. Quite impressive.The appointments in the room were excellent too (stockings for the ladies were just part of the amenity kits!) Our stay was short but we will always remember and recommend this property.

Wonderful hotel. A definitely must see and stay. Wonderful rooms, wonderful Tokyo scenery, top hospitality and service. Just a few meters from the JB main rain station and Narita Expess. Also a few meters from main shopping streets, metro, plenty of restaurants, shops, malls. Excellent location in Tokyo. I very strongly suggest this hotel. One of the best that I have ever been...

This hotel is a good example of getting what you pay for. The rooms are more than $400 but are exceptional and the amenities are excellent. The shower alone is bigger than many hotel rooms I'm Tokyo. The staff is also outstanding. They are knowledgeable, friendly, and fluent in English. The hotel is also conveniently located right outside Tokyo Station.

The interior design, the room services, the front desk services and the employee assistance are really excellent. Could not ask for more. The hotel location (next to Tokyo station) is very convenient.

Tokyo was my last leg of my trip to Japan, after Kyoto and Mount Fuji. The Front of the House staff was well groomed, professional at all times and was able to converse fluently in English. The rooms are very spacious (especially for Tokyo) and reasonably priced. We had our first breakfast using room service, but we ordered after the time period. The order taker said she would call me back to let me know if they can do anything. Within 5 minutes, she called me back, passed the order and got delivered within 20 minutes. I need to highlight the excellent service of the bar tender where we went 2 nights in a row. he was very engaging. The day before our departure, the receptionist kindly offered us to buy our train tickets to Narita Express. The check out was fast. i have considered other international hotel brands before choosing Shangri la, as I had good experiences in Hong Kong and Paris, and they lived it up to it.

As being my favourite hotels chain, i have stayed for business trip. The room is spacious. However, I did not like the lighting. The location is very convenient to whom using the trains since it is close the main station. The hotel provided all services beautifully. Except I face issue in requesting deposit even when you order food and even I am a member of Shangri la club. It was the only disappointing feedback.

Very nice hotel with good sized rooms, located very close to Tokyo Station. Decent views and staff we're very friendly. There is a supermarket next door & lots of nice restaurants within 5 minutes walk.We travelled with a one year old, and while the start was promising (the cot was great & they provided a nappy bin & baby bath products complimentary), the reality was it wasn't great for the baby. We weren't allowed to use the pool with the baby, his sleep times got in the way of room cleaning & I had a floor supervisor chasing me every time I left the room asking when we would be back, how long the room would be free for, etc. and there was no communal space suitable for the baby.I'd recommend for business or a couple, but there are better family options

During a recent stay in Tokyo we split our time between the Shangri La and the Park Hyatt (I also reviewed the latter). Perhaps I'm being a bit harsh due to the extent to which I was impressed by the Hyatt, because this is also a really great hotel. Fabulous views, great location, attentive staff etc.But in small ways - mostly down to personal taste - I didn't like it as much as the Hyatt. The service feels a little slavish to me. The decor is OTT and occasionally tasteless. The hotel is more business-y and less understated, and you feel they are trying to suck up to you with extra pointless touches rather than just do things well. (An example - I had to move to check in to the 'Horizon Lounge' for some reason and instead of making things quicker we had to sit in what amounted to a sort of airline departure lounge for ages while they sorted things out. The tablet you add your details seems cool but ours didn't work).However, lots about it is excellent. The beds are supernaturally comfortable, the spa is good. Breakfast is excellent and the bar is not priced for oligarchs. It's still a really great place to stay.

Enjoyed the "Autumn Afternoon Tea" here. Spectacular views, elegant dining room, beautiful china and silverware. Excellent tea menu. Staff incredibly friendly and helpful. Two hours of bliss for any tea lover.

Shangri-La was all the name implies. A truly elegant, luxurious hotel in Tokyo, just a minute's walk from Tokyo Station (if you find the right exit). Stayed 4 nights on first visit to Japan and highly recommend this establishment. Location can't be beat for access to subway and trains. Breakfast buffet was fabulous as was every aspect of room. Staff go out of their way to be helpful.

Unfortunately, we were only able to stay one night on our way home from Vietnam, but it was a great night. Gorgeous views of the city, super comfortable bed and amazing bathroom. They had great amenities including a nespresso machine. The staff in super responsive, in fact my son left his rayban sunglasses in the room and they packaged them and sent them by next day air to our home in california. I offered to pay for the shipping but they said they would take care of everything. The sunglasses arrived safely to our home wrapped in bubble wrap like they were a priceless crystal vase. Thanks Shangri-LaThey certainly have my loyalty. It will be my go to in Tokyo.

Possibly the best business hotel I have stayed in. Gleaming sparkling crystal foyer, fabulous luxury fittings and a wonderful bedroom suite with amazing view over tokyo train station - like having your own private toy train set! Everything provided for from amazing toiletries to soft pajamas. Wonderful place. Room service & bar food extremely pricy but delicious.

Staying in a corner room at the top, room is spacious and luxurious with well-equipped bath room viewing high buildings. Amenity including skin care kit for lady, Nespresso, puffy slipper,etc. supported comfortable time there.Club lounge serves sweets, food and drinks in fine qualilty on each occasion.- Never miss fresh melon juice !One regrettable thing is the lounge space... too smallWhen club rooms are fully booked, around 30 minutes or more to be killed for entry would be required.

This Hotel has all the right things in all the right places but it completely lack feel and style. It’s definitely 5 star but boring. We felt like we were in a very clean and neat office building with a basic room. Sure it had nice amenities but there are definitely better 5 star hotels in Tokyo so we moved out. It was a nice touch that we were greeted at the Railway Station and escorted to reception, however apart from that we felt like we were under surveillance all the time. The breakfast dining was nice but again it’s an open, small dining room, a bit like a cafeteria. It’s a shame this brand has become so bland.

The Shangri-La is a a superb hotel. The standard deluxe room was large and beautifully appointed. The staff was exceptionally attentive and dedicated to making your stay as pleasant as possible. The location right at Tokyo Station proved to be very convenient. Tokyo can be an expensive city to visit and the hotel rates may be considered high, but for me it was money well spent on my first visit to the city. It really is a great hotel.
user_name:
RH4321
Dix Hills, New York, Usa

review_body: The quality of service, check in/out process, and room was superb. My wife and I stayed here laying over in Tokyo for a few days on our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier with the hotel. It was centrally located, just blocks from the train station. The check in was on the 37th floor accompanied with champagne, for the Horizon club offer through Jetsetter. The included breakfast was delicious and creative. The horizon club also offered currency exchange for the traveller. When they found out it was our honeymoon they offered us a complimentary bottle of Prosecco upon entering our room. We had a room on the 36th floor with an amazing view. The room itself was very tasteful and modern, controls for every common convenience. The shower was amazing with a direct view to the city, and remote controlled blinds. The bed was incredibly comfortable and we couldn't have been happier waking up to that view of Tokyo every morning. The staff at the hotel helped make our first stay in Tokyo memorable and comfortable. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling through Central Tokyo.

If you are traveling to Tokyo, you will not be disappointed with the beautiful Shangri-La Hotel. It is located within walking distance to the Tokyo Rail Station. A valet meets the guests and escorts you to the hotel. The real heart of the hotel is the staff. They project genuine hospitality. The breakfast buffet served daily is a work of art. My first trip to Tokyo would not have been as enjoyable without their patient help and excellent recommendations.

I stayed during the old and new of 2012-2013.We spent four nights at the hotel and we could the skytree from our room.The room was amazing and the housekeeper did a really good job cleaning the room.Every time when we came back to the hotel we felt that we were going back to our home instead of a hotel. The reason is that the staff are being very welcoming and thoughtful.Our family is planning another trip to Japan and we are def staying at the hotel again!

Spent 3 nights at the hotel. Was there on business with a colleague. We always like to stay around Tokyo Station due to convenience for meetings w/ clients and choose to stay here this time around. Could not fault the hotel. It is of the highest standard - exceptional rooms, beautiful bar, nice swimming pool. If back in Tokyo - will def come back. They were nice enough to extend our rooms on departure by a few hours so that we could make it to our flight in comfort. Appreciate it.

It is rather difficult to find this hotel given the construction around Tokyo station, but once you made it to the Lobby on the 28th Floor serene luxury surrounds you. We had booked a corner room, which was simply fantastic: huge, well designed, wonderful view and with incredible spacious bathroom. The only challenge was to work out the function and location of the various switches for lights, curtains and blinds.Breakfast was simply amazing, the buffet offered a tantalizing spread of savouries and the cooked breakfast choices were delicious. Just be prepared to fork out well over JPY 4,000 for it (incl. service and taxes). The hotel has a medium sized gym and swimming pool free of charge and internet was free also.The only outage was the knowledge of the reception team: initial answers were often superficial (e.g. the shuttle bus for Sky-Tree leaves from Tokyo station - we knew this, but where exactly?), simply wrong (it will take over an hour by taxi to Haneda) and for any specifics they had to consult the internet.Still, the location, room, service is as good as it gets and you will enjoy a stay!

This hotel is special. Inside, the surrounds are are beautiful and filled with lots of interesting art and floral displays which change every day or so. The rooms are big, wonderfully appointed have that hushed luxurious comfort that you only find in quality hotels. The staff are great and many. They are keen to be of service and will do any little thing they can to show it. Room service meals were delived quickly and were great, the restaurants , should you choose to eat at the hotel, have great food and service although they are not cheap. Outside, its location is very convenient with the station which is right there and this allows you to easily go to any part of the city. Its an easy walk to the great shopping of Ginza and very near the gardens of the Imperial Palace. We did ask the hotel staff to meet us on the platform when we arrived on the Shinkansen because the station can be a bit daunting - that worked fine. East view rooms over the city are great, you can see forever, or at least the fireworks at Disneyland each night at 8.30.

The Shangri-La is an wonderful hotel. The staff were very accommodating and helpful and were there just when you needed them. The breakfast buffet was amazing and the rooms were as well. Just be sure that when you get directions from the concierge you get an actually street address to tell the cab driver as most people do not speak english
user_name:
Deborah S
Chappaqua, New York, United States

review_body: My wife and I stayed 6 nights. They were the most pleasant 6 nights we've had in any hotel for quite a while. The location was perfect next to Tokyo Station and Daimaru. Our room on the 32nd floor overlooked Tokyo Station and the Imperial Park (glimpses only). Our room was sumptuous, quiet and the 12+ inch shower head was amazing! the staff were incredibly courteous and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Highly recommended.

Yes, everything is perfect in this Hotel. The rooms are spacious (rare for Tokyo), the location perfect, the service over attentive, and the food divine. Only criticism is the cost but then this dis Tokyo after all! A big plus is the quick access to the express trains to Narita!

I have been to Tokyo at least 2 time a year, usually stayed in the hotel with family and friends. Never disappointed! The service was truly excellent. The location was very convenient. All staffs were always helpful and attentive. They have always remembered my favorite things. In my last trip, my father did not feel well, the staff tried everything to make him feel better. That was simply impressive. I would like to say thank you to all staffs.

This place makes The Westin look 2 star by comparison. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Service was all excellent and they really helped out with me travelling with a 4 and 7 year old.

An excellent hotel. Can't really fault it on a any front. We had stayed here as a group of friends in September 2013 on a holiday trip. Well located near Ginza, which is thee shopping destination in Tokyo. The service is impeccable. Most of my reviews on trip advisor always have the ups and downs but here I cannot come up any any complaint of any sort after our five days stay. The check-in was as smooth as silk-they had our room numbers and keys ready as we got down from our car. Every staff of the hotel knew my name, even when I was passing them at the lobby or the lift. I had requested for an early check in through an e-mail as we were arriving in Tokyo early and though we did not get an assurance in the reply, the request was fulfilled. The breakfast is excellent with the friendliest and most hospitable staff. My friends enjoyed the Japanese breakfasts, as for me I stuck to my good old English breakfast. Everything was perfect. The stinky soybean in the Japanese breakfast was loved by all of us. The Japanese restaurant is a must try. A pity, we did not try the Italian food. The bar is also excellent with a gem of a bartender. Can't remember his name, but thank you my friend. The concierge was more than helpful and walked the extra mile to make our stay almost perfect. They did everything for us, even running to nearby stores to arrange tickets for whatever event we wanted to attend. Cars were arranged in time, food reached in time in the most presentable manner, etc. on departure my colleague dropped his wallet in the car, I called the guest relations officer and within minutes the wallet came back to the airport. Thanks again. And yes, not a single problem with communicating in English with any staff, from house keeping to bell girls. Just a slight bit of a mention, if at all, was the check out took more than normal time, because I was checking out for all the rooms with payments in USD and card. I had requested for all bills to be billed against one room when checking in so that checking out would be quick but this did not happen and I spent about 40 minutes checking out, if not more. Would I stay at this hotel again? Yes definitely and recommend it to others as well. This was also my first stay at a Shangrila hotel, and if this is their global standard, then I will surely be looking out for this chain in my other travels. So far as location is concerned, it's a perfect place to stay when on business or shopping.

My sixth stay here and it just gets better. The location, great views and highly efficient staff reallymake this hotel #1 in Tokyo. The rooms are large and beautifully appointed, with every modern convenience you could wish for. The pool and sauna are most welcoming after a busy day of meetings and the gym, although lacking some fairly standard equipment is good enough for a basic workout. I always have breakfast in Piacere on the lobby level, rather than in the club lounge. If this breakfast room doesn't make you feel excited about you day, then little else will.!Here, there is layer upon layer of luxury fittings, all tastefully brought together. The service is impeccable, with European management also in attendance. I look forward to my next stay.

Conveniently located above the main train station in Tokyo (Tokyo Station), the Shangri-la offers easy access to regional trains, subway, buses and walking distance to many major attractions including the Imperial Palace, Ginza, Nihonbashi, Tsikiji Market, etc.Hotel lobby offers a paranomic view of Tokyo and on a good day, you can even see Mt Fuji in the west. Easily one of the best hotels in Tokyo.Staff are friendly and efficient.

From the extremely helpful and courteous staff, to the beautiful and luxurious facilities and the excellent Horizon Lounge, the Shangri-La Tokyo was the best hotel experience I've ever had in over 40 years of travelling.

I'm usually not one to writ reviews ( this is my first), but after staying at this hotel, I must say that I was inspired to do so. I've traveled to a lot of countries, (I have even stayed at the Shangri- La before) and while many of them were very good, I have never felt as welcome as I did at the Shangri- La in Tokyo.The hotel is beautiful and very conveniently located near the Tokyo railway station, which makes travel within the city extremely easy. The decor is classy and the room we stayed in was spacious and gorgeous, with a lovely view of the city outside. I am generally rather picky about the bathrooms in the places I stay in, and I have to say, that this one did not disappoint.As nice as the rest of the hotel was, I was actually most impressed by the staff there. They were courteous and friendly and I have never met a more efficient group of employees. Whether it was our flight details, train tickets or information about the city, they took care of everything! We were even provided with an escort service to drop and pick us up at the station, whenever we needed to travel. From the concierge to those who assisted with our luggage, their efficiency is truly commendable.All in all, I had a wonderful stay at this hotel and would definitely visit again, in the near future.
user_name:
ShadowsInk
New York City, New York

review_body: Our room had a beautiful view of the city. The huge window provided us with an excellent view of the cityscape. We could look down on Tokyo Station and see the trains coming and going all day and night. The hotel itself was 5 stars. Unbelievable class and attention to details. The best part of this hotel for me was the location to Tokyo Station.

Gorgeous rooms and modern Asian design. All persons I encountered were exceptionally well informed, helpful, articulate, and they showed a high enthusiasm for their hotel and roles. Entering and leaving a hotel which begins at the 27th floor is a bit odd.

Words cannot describe how wonderful this hotel is. Our every need was attended to quickly and graciously. The food, service, rooms.....everything was perfect!!! This hotel goes far beyond any 5 star hotel that I've ever stayed at before.

Luxury at it's finest - I couldn't fault Shangri-La from the moment I stepped into its entrance. I was lucky to be upgraded - and what a sight I was greeted with: the Tokyo Skytree was in view amongst the beautiful skyline of Tokyo.The room was clean and spacious with a beautiful bathroom complete with a contemporary waterfall shower and in-built bath overseeing a spectacular panorama of the city skyline. Free wifi and a host of world channels on the TV made the stay that much more comfortable.Breakfast was gorgeous and the menu quite varied - something for everyone. I was particularly enamoured with the various fruit juices and muesli!My flight was relatively early in the morning and knowing the enormity of Tokyo station, decided to check out early. Although last minute, the concierge offered me to be escorted by a delightful bell boy all the way to my platform and carriage!From the concierge to the beautiful king size beds and a spectacular view to boot, I enjoyed every second of my stay. My first and definitely not my last - will return when I am next back in Japan.

Spent 3 nights at the end of August. Really enjoyed my time at the hotel. Was there for business and needed to be central so this fit the bill just perfect. Food was great and slept like a log. Awesom hotel.

I've stayed at Shangri-La Tokyo 4 times so far (once every year since 2010) and the hotel has maintained its quality and standards throughout the years! The location is perfect as you got the main station only few minutes away by walking distance so you can easily access most places in Tokyo! The service is great and they were always happy to welcome us back! The rooms are very nice and the hotel lobby lounge is great! Simply my favorite hotel in Tokyo!

Exceleent location, most comfirtable rooms, and very well trained professinal but yet friendly staff!They made us feel most comfirtable!Yummy breakfast!Couldnt find a flaw, everything is great!Pricey but worth a visit if you can afford it!Several hotels at this price doesnt necesarrily offer such service and luxury!

I travel quite a lot both in business and leisure and I probably can´t say this is the best hotel in the world but is the best one I`ve ever been!The service is well above the japanese standard (that is very high!), perfect location at Tokyo station and close to many attractions and restaurants. The panoramic city views from the room are simply superb and the quality of everything from the bed to the toilet are amazing. Even the lifts are great!The only thing that didn´t really surprise me was the health club. The pool and gym are quite small and just Ok.It is definitely pricey but worth every penny.

Perfect location at the Tokyo station, able to get to and from anywhere in the city in minutes, and several attractions are within walking distance. Food and Service at the best Shangri-La standard. Rooms are high, with nice views of the Station and a bit of the Imperial Palace, or view of the river side of the city. Don't miss having a drink at the lounge, looking at the Skytree!

While the hotel is expensive, the experience certainly meets the expectations. They have been very thoughtful about every small thing. The view from the room is also great. However, the directions from Tokyo station are a bit off. So it is possible to get lost.

Not warm welcome,not easy access by walk .I contact concierge ask to come from Narita airport but they said our customer use limousine or tax!We dont know exact way to come by public!We ask late night dinning near hotel because of all hotel dinning already close at 12;00 might night.but they can't introduce us just go around Roppongi!

Excellent room and service. The hotel is easily accessible to other areas of Tokyo and other inland cities which it is closely connected to Tokyo Station. In house facilites are all in good finishes and managment.

The hotel has a perfect location next to Tokyo station. If you arrive by Narita Express you will be met at Tokyo Station and escorted to the hotel through the underground corridors. All you have to do is to advise the hotel once you are on the train.The same service is offered to you when leaving for the airport.The service holds very high standard, typical for Shangri-la hotels in Asia. Very attentive and at the same time very descret.

Had a wonderful 5 day stay. Everything I needed was there daily without any need to call for service. TV, capsule Coffee machine, wireless internet, water, room temperature control that works. With a department store (with groceries and food at the Basement 1) next door and a convenient store at the entrance of the JR station, everything I need or may need is within reach.Being right on top of JR Tokyo station, it's a convenient 60min ride by the Narita Express from the airport. A short walk 5-10min and you are at the hotel.Make sure you print the direction guide from the hotel and have it in hand. The variety if food places inside the station distracted me and I walked around in circles for a bit, but it was good being lost for a while as you can see all the food that you can get to during your stay.The hotel is at the Yaesu North Gate Entrance past 2 Starbucks (along the walkway to the exit and up the escalator at the exit itself). Turn right at the entrance and walk past the convenient store and right again past a pizza/bar and you can see the ground floor reception slightly to the left in maroon (if I remember correctly). Go in and the concierge there will guide your to the lift. The main reception is on Level 28.If you have checked in past 830pm, most of the shops in the JR station will be closed. However, the bar downstairs and the convenient shop is open. More interesting are the all the food shops under the JR line starting from a short 5 min walk from the hotel.There's a whole stretch of them and about 15 min walk away is http://www.andysfish.com/. 15 min is esimated time after a meal and beers. Might have been 5 or 10 min longer but it's not far and there are lots of people around past 10pm. Just need to remember that Shangri-La's at the far end of JR Tokyo Station coming back from http://www.andysfish.com.

First impressions when you walk through the air conditioned first floor is wow. Very friendly staff, could not do enough for you. Chandaliers, beautiful flowers, art work, the list goes on. Obviously this hotel is a luxury for most people, we stayed 3 nights. Big rooms, comfy beds, turn down service, english tv channels, great view, excellent bath and 2 showers (rain and normal), welcoming fruit on arrival. All the amenities you can ask for, did not use any of our own.Great toilet (LOL), lid opens as you approach it. Worth spending that extra money for this outstanding hotel

Our stay in the Shangri-La in Tokyo was exceptional. I contacted the hotel the day before we were due to arrive and gave them my bullet train details from Osaka. Such was their attention to detail, they requested our seat numbers so that they could be ready and waiting to greet us at the door of the carriage. We were met with a smile and the young gentleman took the large majority of our cases and navigated us through the incredibly busy Tokyo station. I know the station fairly well, but even so it was well worth asking for their assistance as it just makes it that little bit easier. From the bullet train (or shinkansen) platforms, it is little over five minutes on foot to the door of the hotel, if coming in on the Narita Express from the airport, the platforms are further away so it may take up to ten or so minutes to get to the hotel.Once in the hotel, we were greeted on the ground floor before being whisked up in an elevator to the reception on the 27th floor. Check in was swift and paperless - everything was entered onto tablets. Others have commented on the decor, and it really is as good as people say. Some very beautiful pieces of art, and it is shame that many (me included) just saunter on by without looking at much of it. Whilst checking in, our cases were already on their way to the room on the 33rd floor, and we were reunited with them a minute or two later.We had a "Premier City View" room, which is a corner room that overlooks both the station and the Marunouchi district on one side, and north Tokyo and the Sky Tree on the other. So far, it has been by far the most spacious room we have had in Tokyo, and was well appointed and very comfortable. The bed, as commented on by others, was extraordinarily comfortable, and once in bed and with the lights off, there was something magical about having the blinds up and being able to see Tokyo glitter away outside.Nothing was too much trouble, and every request was sorted with the minimum of fuss. Being a bearded fellow, after a few weeks of travelling my clipper battery had run flat. Within minutes of mentioning this, a transformer allowing my 220V clippers to be fully charged was delivered to the room. And every time someone came to the room, everything was checked and completely restocked in the bathroom (...the bathroom was marvellous - the "usual" hi-tech Japanese toilet, a rain shower, and a bath tub which afforded a view of the city).We did make use of eating options in the hotel. If you have access to the Horizon Club, the snacks and drinks are pleasant, as is the atmosphere. For an evening meal, we went to the Italian restaurant (Piacere) and were not disappointed. The quality was very good and the flavours and combinations were carefully thought about. Breakfast was also fantastic. A huge amount of choice and all of the highest possible quality. And should you not want to eat in the hotel, there are literally hundreds of restaurants and bars in and around Tokyo station, so you will not be disappointed.All in all, a very good stay, made so in no small part by the hard work of all of the staff. Being next to the station the location is fantastic and everything was a smooth as you would expect from a high class hotel in a high class city.

Hotel sets benchmarks in service and quality. Staff met me at Tokyo station at the correct Shinkansen car so I would not get lost in the station as this was my first time to Tokyo. They also escorted me the Narita Express train upon check-out. Location is excellent for a Tokyo stay. There are many reviews about his hotel regarding great views and how comfortable the rooms are but it is really hard to capture the level of service in words. Service far exceeds professionally outstanding. Personal check in was excellent. Room was always perfect, even the angle of the tasselled night card matched the fold angle of the bed cover. Breakfast at Piacere and dinner in the Lobby Lounge were outstanding and staff was amazing. Concierge and front counter staff flawless. I would stay at this hotel again without question and recommend without hestitation.

I chose the hotel initially due to its proximity to the office (as this was a business trip) but the experience was excellent on all counts that I would definitely choose to stay their in future. The rooms have amazing views over Tokyo and located centrally in the business district at Tokyo station. The rooms are spacious, in very new condition and high quality fit out. The bed was a super king and comfortable. The linen was a high quality. There was a walk in wetroom with rain shower from the ceiling and a large separate bath. The service in the hotel is consistent excellent. The food quality is of a high standard. Wifi throught out, bose stereo speakers in the room. Shangri-la thinks of everything and preempts anything that you could miss! Highly recommend Shangri-la for any tokyo visit.

This is my favorite Shangri-La Hotel and the one hotel I consistently return to in Tokyo. Because it's not a big hotel, it has a nice cosy vibe and the rooms are a decent size and comfortable and a great refuge to come back to since Tokyo can be frenetic. As it's a newer Shangri-La hotel, it also has a more restrained, modern decor that is less busy than some of the older Shangri-Las. Being located adjacent to Tokyo Station, it's also very convenient when coming in from Narita or other cities by train. However, as I always get lost in Tokyo Station, I would recommend informing the hotel to request that someone (usually the concierge) meets you at the train platform to lead you to the hotel. The staff are gracious and have a genuine warmth and willingness to go out of their way to help out. I've also gotten them to help make reservations at restaurants in advance of my visit.

I have stayed at the Shangri-la Tokyo a few times, and each time, it has never failed to please me. I am very, very, finicky, believe me. Paying big money for hotels is not something I take lightly. I only review if I am disgusted or delighted with the property..There's in between. Okay, so here we are, moderately priced (for Tokyo hotels) Club Floor, King or Suite each time.. Club floor is one of the best I have ever experienced.. Large, gorgeous vies over Tokyo, stunning night views too. No need for looking at railway lines here (Four Seasons), far too high up. Evening cocktails, a wide selections of drinks, snacks etc.. Very comfortable and pleasant.Morning breakfast, superb! Eggs to order, tons of salad, fruits etc.. Good coffee, fast service, friendly staff, helpful.. etc..etc..Rooms are very comfortable, all with great views, especially as sunset.. spacious, well stocked, Bulgari amenities, its what you pay for, and it delivers..good bathrooms, powerful showers.If there's a fault, I'll find it.. Only other comparable hotel for me, would be the Ritz-Carlton, which is in Roppongi, about 20 min drive away. Shangri-la is a 3 minute walk from Tokyo Station, great location.

Very nice experience. Everything perfect. The hotel is just few meters far from the Tokyo Train Station. It is also very easy to arrive at the hotel from Narita Airport. Narita Express (N'EX) start from Narita Airport ad arrive to Tokyo station.

We had a beautiful corner room overlooking the train station. We would have been happy to stay in our room & the hotel the entire time.Alas, we has to get out & explore Tokyo which was very easy given that it is so close to a large subway station.The Lobby Lounge is heavenly to return to each night.
user_name:
Manila M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I review hotels in the context of where they are and what I expect from them, whether I am traveling for business or pleasure, and whether I am evaluating a unique boutique or an elegant international chain. This hotel is a top tier property, branded by a top tier international management company (Shangi-La) in a top tier location, with the highest quality contemporary finishes -- no expense appears to have been spared. There are comparable properties in most major cities, including other Shangri-La hotels, but this particular property stands out amongst the Shangi-La chain as one of their best properties, making it a serious competitor at the highest and most demanding end of the market. The rooms are nearly new, elegant in appearance and finish, staff appears to be fluent in english, and service is at the level expected of a hotel with a 5+ star rating. More than a business hotel, the rooms are nearly perfect in every way. Bring your wife or husband and enjoy the shopping, Tokyo may be expensive, but it is one of the best cities in the world.

This place is incredible. Dont go for just one night. Stay longer! We could only stay one, the night before we left. So close to the station which made getting around really easy. Great staff and very helpful. The horizon club is fantastic, and the rooms are amazing

I love Tokyo and this hotel added to everything thing I love about this city. This was my 4th trip to Tokyo and my 1st stay at the Shangri-La.Since the Tokyo train system is once of the best most people including myself prefer to ride the train that a car. My wonderful experience started with the hotel once I booked my train ticket from Narita station to the Marunouchi station. The hotel concierge explained that this station was large and challenging to navigate if your first time to that station. She insisted on meeting me on the train track and all I needed to do was provide my train number and car number. Upon exiting the train the concierge was dressed with a hotel sign waiting for me and to help navigate my way through the VERY busy station. I think we walked for approx 15 minutes just to get through the station as the trains traveling to and from the airport are in a different part of the station from the trains that most take around Tokyo. The crowd was also larger than normal because they had recently opened up that portion of the station after years of renovations and both tourists and locals were taking photos of the renovated station.The Shangri-La is a beautiful hotel and I was greeted with a smile from the front desk staff upon check-in and escorted to the elevator where I was met by the bellman at my room door with my bags. I had two twin/double beds but after a long flight and wonderful reception I was not complaining, nor did I complain at any part during my stay. The room was very nice and modern with a view of Tokyo. The meeting space this hotel has is amazing the ballroom doors have crystals in all the door handles and mirrors, simply beautiful.Breakfast was included in my negotiated room rate every morning and I ordered the same coffee and sparkling water the staff had it ready once I sat down. This again adds to the service that the Shangri-La and provides in making sure their guests are comfortable. I had high tea in the lobby lounge one afternoon, it has some great views of the city but high tea is expensive, keep in mind Tokyo in Oct was listed in the 5 top most expensive cities in the world. I often thought that I was the only one in the hotel on business as most people looked like they were only there to lounge and enjoy the view. None the less I would recommend a cup of tea or a glass of champagne while sitting back and enjoying the view. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Tokyo on business or pleasure as the train station is less than a 3 minute walk (central Tokyo lines) and you can get to most locations via train including the airport.

We had a wonderful stay at the Shangri-La Hotel in Tokyo. Used the Limousine service to and from the airport as I was afraid to use the train. Excellent service throughout this hotel, all the staff are courteous and will go out of their way to do anything to make your stay enjoyable.

Next to the Yaesu side of Tokyo Station. Arrange for hotel staff to guide us to hotel via Narita Express (located at Basement 5 of Tokyo Station which is huge). The staff already waited for us when we stepped out of the train. Lobby is not located at ground floor but not a problem at all.I stayed for 4 nights (3 nights in premium room, 1 night in horizon club) and checkin was good. last night when i need to swap rooms, the luggage was moved to new room and getting new keys for the room was a breeze. Concierge was excellent. They already assisted before we checkin by helping via email on some queries. They also have the portable wifi router and price is reasonable.Everything in the room worked as it should. Fantastic large rooms (especially for Tokyo standards) and bathroom was also excellent. Room is also very clean.Loved it!

Only one night in this beautiful hotel, and what a shame. This place is elegant, guests are treated with a high level of courtesy, and the rooms are amazing. My large room with a king bed overlooked the city, and so did my bath tub! The amenities were all you could expect. Never got a chance to use the fitness center or pool. The lobby bar was a great way to start the evening. This place is expensive, but worth it!

Very modern hotel next to Tokyo station. Ginza (shopping district) and the imperial gardens are in walking distance. The atmosphere in the hotel is pleasant and the staff is very helpful. Our room was on the 37th floor and offered great views towards the Bay of Tokyo. Will definately stay here again if going back to Tokyo!

We managed to get a really good corporate rate here which was a great start, especially for Japan 5* prices. We also stayed in the Park Hyatt during the same visit, to see different sides of Tokyo so have something to compare. The Hotel is located extremely close to the Tokyo station, which is so convenient (if you take the right exit). So it is easy to come here straight from the airport as the Narita Express goes direct to Tokyo Station. It is also a stone's throw away from Marunouchi area, which has nice high end shops, and lots of great restaurants for lunch (not just japanese cuisine) which was a relief, especially the Dean and Deluca close by. It is also very easy walking distance to Ginza area (20 mins) and the Imperial Palace Gardens (15 mins).We did have to wait a rather long time for the room to be ready, as my brother tried to check in early at 11:30, but we didn't get the room till just before 3pm, which was a little disappointing. The hotel lobby is actually based on the 28th floor if I recall correctly, which makes for great views once you are there, with a nice bar and a lot of people having afternoon tea, we didn't get chance to try that. The rooms are fantastic, contemporary and really big! Much bigger than we expected, and we were in a standard twin. The bathroom was the best, extremely comfortable with heated tiles in the shower / wet room. They also had the latest version of the special Japanese style toilets, I later discovered there are older ones, with less functions in other places and hotels.The views were fantastic , we were on the 33rd floor and the electric blinds were perfect for keeping the light out. The beds were reasonable, not firm enough for my liking, but still got a good night sleep. The service was also excellent.Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, particularly for the location and proximity to the Tokyo station, but also the neat modern rooms were just want you want in this city.

This is an Ultramodern hotel atop a high rise office tower, itself virtually above Tokyo Station. It is a very convenient location, with not only the station being right there, but being within walking distance of the Imperial Palace, Ginza, hundreds of restaurants etc. Inside the hotel has incredibly large and comfortable rooms, something of a rarity for Japanese hotels. The restaurants and food are also exceptionally good. But what really impressed me was the best hotel wifi experience i have ever had. Not only was the wifi very fast but it was a totally seamless experience wherever you are in the hotel. No need to log in again when you change floors etc, you are just connected, Fantastic!In terms of downsides for this hotel therevare only two. Firstly, it is very expensive. If you can get a corporate rate then do as it helps save a bomb. The second issue is that the hotel has no real street presence and can be hard to find and a lot of taxi drivers don't know where it is. Once you know where it is it is very easy to get to, but that first time can be a challenge.Highly recommended

This hotel is just about impossible to find by car. There's no logo on the building and even when you are right in front of it you still cannot see the entrance. It took me HOURS to find the entrance, which turned out to be underground. Friends of mine visited me in this hotel and even their taxi driver could not find the entrance for cars. Shangri-La should e-mail guests in advance and put a huge warning on their website about this entrance. Or how about a sign that is big enough to notice from a moving car?Once inside, this hotel is excellent and the car troubles are soon forgotten. Sublime service, impressing decor. The rooms are huge, luxurious and very comfortable. Reception is at the 28th floor, all rooms are above that so a nice view is guaranteed. It's the kind of place one would like to live at, instead of just stay for a few days.The only thing I did not like about the room was the Bose home cinema connected to the TV. The sound is American: big, fat and loud. It was impossible to switch to the TV's built in loudspeakers and therefore I preferred to watch TV with the sound off. It might seem like a minor detail, but since this hotel goes for perfection even the little things count.The location of the hotel is very convenient. It is a 10 minute walk to Ginza and a 5 minute walk to the imperial gardens. Shangri La is located above Tokyo Central station, which is an attraction on its own. There's lots of shops, including "Character Street" which is a huge collection of toy shops, puppet shops, TV memorabila shops and other such stores.The most important reason to chose this hotel over similar hotels is the train service. You can buy a ticket for the Narita Express train from the hotel. A friendly lady from the hotel walks you all the way to the platform. Tokyo Station is huge, so this service was certainly worth while. Just for this service I'd stay in this hotel again.

I really look forward to staying in Shangri-La hotels because they are consistently excellent and this is no exception.Location:The hotel is in a great location, very close to Tokyo Station and is within easy reach of the Ginza shopping district. Additionally, there are many restaurants close by.Service:As usual, outstanding. Every single member of staff we came into contact with was friendly and extremely eager to help. We arrived early but we were still able to check in and the process was quick and efficient. Room:Spacious, well appointed and a great view of Tokyo. Air-con efficiency was excellent, keeping the room lovely and cool. The bathroom was nice with a separate toilet. The shower was roomy and was 'rainfall' type, which was nice. Housekeeping service was excellent, as always.Bars / Restaurants:We used the Horizon Club Lounge most evenings for drinks, which offered a nice range of refreshments depending on the time of day. The breakfast service was good (which we also had in the Horizon Club Lounge). We had dinner one night in the 'Nadaman' Japanese Restaurant but I'm sad to report this was a slightly underwhelming experience given the price - the Nadaman in the Singapore Shangri-La is better, which seems strange.Overall:Another excellent stay. I'm very happy to recommend this hotel. It's pricey but it's quiet, understated and offers service levels most hotels can't get near.

We stayed here for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon in Japan. We arrived very jet-lagged and the staff were amazing right from the start, very humble and attentive. The room was beautiful on the 33rd floor with a wonderful view of the sky tree and city.They arranged for a complimentary bottle of champagne to be delivered to our room with a note signed by the staff - a really nice touch.The room had all the facilities you could ever want and was very modern and luxurious. The room had a bathroom with a rainforest shower, large bathtub and lovely view. There was a daily turn down.The bar on the lobby level was romantic and had a nice atmosphere. We had breakfast in our room once which was a slight letdown as they got our order wrong but they rectified this when we called them. During the stay the staff were consistently good and made us feel very special they do everything for you including calling the lift as soon as they see you. The hotel was in a good location for the sights and Tokyo mainline station. They took us and our bags to the Shinkansen platform when we left for Hiroshima and helped us book tickets - a nice touch as the station can be very confusing. They even kept one of our suitcases that we didn't need to take for the week that we were away.All in all a great hotel with attentive staff and an ideal place to stay if you are looking for 5 star luxury in Tokyo.

We just spend 5 night in this hotel during our vacation in Japan. It is probably one of the best hotel I stayed in. The location is perfect to discover the city, just near tokyo station. The service was perfect. The rooms in perfect condition with dynamic light systems depending on your activities. The view from the 31 st floor was amazing. The 25 m long swimming pool is good and not crowded. The only this that I found a bit disappointing is the breakfast.
user_name:
Xav080578
New York City, New York

review_body: Wow factor is high, which is tough to achieve in a city of superlatives. 5-star hotels are everywhere in Tokyo. Shangri-La has huge rooms and discrete luxury. The Peninsula, while a great property, feels overrun with humanity by comparison. Excellent location, just next to Tokyo Station. The shopping and restaurants are incredible. Elegant touches, such as Swarovski crystal handrails in the elevators. Piacere offers a nice buffet breakfast with amazing pastries. I did, however, need to alert them to the empty offerings on two occasions. Service at the hotel was perfect. As I got off of the airport bus, they asked me my name, took my bag, and summoned the elevator for me. The door opened and out came a smiling female bell person, pressed the lobby button, exited the elevator and off I went. I checked in, was about to go to my room, when the smiling young lady was standing right behind me with my bag, and brought me up to my room. Very nice!

luxury, comfort, views, great location, and outstanding service--it's hard to imagine how they could have done anything better! i stayed in a horizon club deluxe bay view room. i'd read some negative reviews of the value of paying more for the horizon club, and wonder at the expectations of the reviewers. the hosts were unbelievably gracious and helpful, the food a wide-ranging selection to please japanese and western palates, a substantial assortment of coffee, tea, cocktails, and those views! i've stayed at the mandarin, peninsula, ritz-carlton and four seasons marunouchi, and this is the one i'll return to

A true fan of Shangrila but this hotel was one of the best. We stayed in Horizon Club, and although more expensive is well worth the money for the breakfast, the cocktail 2 and half hour with nibbles, the coffee during the day, the best views 24 hours a day. I cannot praise this hotel and the Horizon Club team enough. Absolutely nothing is too much trouble. The hotel in itself is very convenient, more or less attached to Tokyo station, not much signage outside the hotel, but if you are arriving by train the Shangrila team will meet you at the station and escort you free of charge. If stopping in Tokyo, this hotel is a must.

Stayed three nights, April 7th through 10th. Got the Superior room with city view on the 34th floor, which happened to be on a corner with splendid views of Tokyo station on one side, and Tokyo Sky Tree on the other. The lobby is located on the 28th floor of the Marunouchi Trust Tower Main building, and you see the first smiles on the ground floor when taking the elevator. You have a choice from the Lobby Lounge, Piacere, and Nadaman for drinks and meals. Depending on the room category you may get access to the Horizon Club on the 37th floor, with also beautiful views of Tokyo Bay, Tokyo Sky Tree, and Chiba in the distance. Here options for breakfast are available, and drinks and snacks in the evening.I loved to have complimentary wi-fi access throughoutthe hotel, including the rooms. The health club and Chi Spa are located on the 29th floor. Chi Spa made my visit even more unforgetable. This spa service is unique for a city location with Shangr-la, since it is usually available on resort locations only. I had the keisetsu (seasonal) bath, which in this case included sakura (cherry blossoms), and the reflexology massage. I must commend Miyuki for an excellent service, she helped me kill the severe foot aches I was experiencing after days of walking at DisneySea, Shizuoka, and Tokyo.

I stayed here for 5 nights recently and enjoyed every moment of it. Location is great as it is walking distance to Tokyo station and very accessible to everywhere. The view at night is spectacular although it rained for the first 2 nights I was there. Impeccable service, spacious room, good breakfirst (try the oriental selection) and overall I felt at home. Check out KITTE, a new shopping mall which opened in March this year in front of Tokyo Station. Take the West exit from Tokyo station or check with the concierge on direction. It is walking distance underground. Interesting concept shops and cafes.

I've stayed in a couple of different Shangri-la hotels and this is by far, the best! The luxury, the space you get, especially considering the premium location in this very expensive location, the food, the service, and everything! I stayed there for a few days in the last trip and I can't be more pleased! They even remember my favorite meal in the morning and once I sit down, the food is on its way!The location can't be beat either, and yes, like someone else mentioned, call ahead so they meet you at the train station and take you back.Luxury at its best!

A superb five star hotel.Well located right above both the local and bullet train station, and next door to an excellent department store.An extremely service oriented staff, unobtrusive, but always available.The room was spacious with an excellent view, and very well appointed, albeit somewhat short on drawer space.The bathroom was luxurious with a TV, phone, a soaker tub, an expansive shower with terrifc water pressure.Toilet equipped with an electric bidet. Dined in house for breakfast, and dinner only once, see separate review.
